column2: Phone Friendly Its not okay that you charge for filing state and 39.99 for processing. I'm out 70 additional dollars on top of what yall keep from my return that I don't know about. If I file my state tax refund with TurboTax I shouldn't be charged both. Hidden costs
College 529 accts I have two sons in college and both have 529 accounts. I am also in a tax bracket where we don't qualify for any of the new education/college tax credit programs.

column1: Guidance says even where you don't qualify you should record expenses to avoid getting taxed -- well did that, but again little guidance.
So originally it wanted to tax me on $8,500 of the 529 funds that all went to college expenses. Finally I dug in and went through the various worksheets on my own.
Need to improve guidance in this area. Significantly.
Interestingly last year I took H&R Block up on their offer to review, they were equally clueless on how to handle 1099Q's in relation to 1099T's. Very little guidance provided

column2: Overcharged! I only had one opportunity to choose what I wanted to pay and it was $29.99 -- my usual amount. Instead, they billed me for $99 saying I ordered all these extras that I surely did not. They trick you. I have no home or children and to pay $99 for a tax return is ridiculous.

column1: Beware when choosing your payment. You may have to go back and search for the $29.99 packet as it's hidden someplace deep in all the screens. Shame on you, Turbo Tax! You trick people into paying $99 instead of $29.99.

column2: Feds Good- State needs help Ended up going to state revenue department for support and advice on how to complete the state return for some not so complex issues - certainly not worth the extra money I paid for it. Would have cost me less to go to a taxpreparer! State Return not enough assistance and info

non residewnt doing a va nonresident is not user friendly for this program. nor is it user friendly for doing a non resident north Carolina or a south Carolina. Program needs work on these issues. not user friendly
cost When i went to file the return you wanted $59 to file the fed and state return! I stopped and printed and mailed the state (2 pages) and then went back and filed the fed for free?

column1: I might have spent the $59 if I wasn't so offended by the charge but to learn the fed was free later in the process is truly offensive.
I have used TT for as long as I can remember but next year will shop for an alternative. uncharges for electronic filing

column2: NON RESIDENT VIRGINIA YOU NEED A TAB SO YOU CAN SEPERATE EACH INDIVIDUAL ON THE NON RESIDENT RETURNS. TAXPAYER, SPOUSE. OR JUST SPOUSE AND HAVE EACH ITEM ON THE ITEMIZED DEDUCTIONS LISTED AS TO WHEATHER THEY ARE FOR THE TAXPAYER OR SPOUSE. THIS PROGRAM IS A NIGHMARE FOR THIS. FEDERAL IS GOOD, MAY HAVE TO FIND A PROGRAM THAT IS MORE USER FRIENDLY IN THIS AREA. HAVE BEEN USING TURBO TAX FOR YEARS. CANNOT SEPERATE EACH SPOUSE ON NON RESIDENT

Last Year I've been a turbo tax user for years. This is my last year. There were to many glitches. Calling support took way to long, 30 minutes before ever getting to a human. Once I got to the human they did a good job.

column1: To many add on expenses this year, previously Turbo tax included state filing now extra charge, both for return and to file. Tired of the corporate greed. At this point I'll pay someone local that I can talk to. Nickel and dimed

column2: Dissatisfied In past years I knew very clearly when my filing was complete. It seems you make changes each year and this year my taxes were filed late. You asked for CC info to pay and I signed for a State of CA netspend card which I have already received. but nothing prompted be to continue after giving bank info for my payment to IRS to be auto deducted and printing a copy of my returns.

column1: If I had not been asked about it by my wife I would hot have checked today to complete and I am glad I did. Now I will have to pay penalties. I have used your service for about 5 years or so.
Dissatisfied. No clarity of filing being completed

column2: caused late filing I thought I had filed my taxes well before the deadline but I came back to investigate why money owed was not deducted from my bank acct only to discover your system had not actually filed my return. Not only did this cause me to file late but also necessitated the use of my credit card which cost an extra $48+

column1: In addition I will probably have to pay a late fee. All because of your ambiguous system for setting up the payment. How could you let a client go through the whole process of filing including processing a payment then not ensure that they were aware the payment didn't process. Very irresponsible on Turbotax's part confusing filing

column2: Not happy I had made sure that my taxes were submitted on April 18 and when I checked it today, it was saying that my taxes were incompleted. I know I had sent them already because I had made sure that I had submitted while on my phone. I am not a happy customer in that respect
easier to do it yourself had already filed federal by mail, was forced to refile them in order to get turbo tax to let me e-file my state complicated, constrictive
update failed had to spent one and a half hour to figure out why the updae would not work and why efile will not file with out the update.

column1: it sucks!!! e-file was a pain

column2: Hard to Figure Out How Entry Numbers Calculated I wanted to understand that the numbers Turbo Tax put in the return were accurate but this is impossible to do. Calculation are done but the basis on how the numbers are calculated isn't in the worksheets. I had several numbers in the return and in the worksheets, I couldn't identify from my inputs and didn't make any sense to me but are probably right but I couldn't confirm because not enough information was provided on the calculations. Can't figure our how numbers were calculated
made it worse As well u ask to print and mail it, if I had time to do so I wouldn't need your services tight? it's to complicated and long

We should not be charged an e-state filing fee. Seriously? $80+ and $35 on top of that. I think I'll use a professional next year. I understand it is less expensive. Does not stretch screen when using a touchable screen.
ways to get online . all the numbers and the security

column1: I never ever send in perfect taxes when I use Turbotax because I always end up coming back and fixing something . ways to getting online

column2: Great for Most Things Turbotax is very helpful and works for most situations quickly and easily. But in the process of doing two separate returns (my sisters and mine) I spent about SEVEN hours on the phone with a variety of Turbotax folks who sometimes couldn't, and eventually did, solve my problems. I have been saying the same thing for a number of years but Turbotax has been unable, unwilling or just lazy about correcting the problems connected to the use of Form 1116. Has some serious problems for serious tax matters
No one could give me my user Id even after giving my soc sec to them #??

I thought it said "free federal taxes preparation" other than unexpected fee for federal ($104) its a good way to file taxes. Of course personal tax preparers from the main tax services are human beings and are better. Surprisingly the cost is similar. I thought it said "Free" for federal taxes. Then total of $150 .

My brother used turbo tax and then went to an accountant and got a $16,000 dollar larger refund. My return should be simple but took hours to do, because I could not figure a way to delete a name from child care, because I did not have the Soc Sec. #. Extremely difficult to change certain information
Advertising misleading. Should have included a free download for state return but I had to go through four hour phone call to get a free download.

Frustrated with the softwear This is a real-estate rental business which used contractors that require providing a 1099-mis for expenses over $600. Yet there is no prompt. After trying for an hour I did by hand. So why do I need Turbo Tax?

column1: This version is too complicated, better done by an accountant. Plan to hire one. Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh. Interface really sucks.

column2: Headache for new clergy I couldn't retrace the questions I had answered. I couldn't go back to the actual form. It was frustrating to try to figure out where some obscure exemptions and additional income that I had to submit should go. Not very functional - I couldn't go back and forth between the Turbotax interface and the actual form.

I have used Turbo Tax for the past 10 or more year, I never will again. I first loaded the software about 6 weeks ago and completed about 95 % of the return , saved it . I started to finish the return just before tax day, it asked if I wanted to update the software , agreed , and updated . After that there was nothing at all in the 2015 form , had to start all over again , and none of the data from all the previous years on my computer would transfer . Had to load all the back data manually, it has been a night mare ,never again will I use Turbo Tax. Not at all user friendly as previous years. Bud Green

Refund Very upset that there's no-one to talk to when the state rejects your state taxes and you've fixed them over 10 times and your site says everything has been fixed and it still keeps being rejected. Need REAL PEOPLE TO TALK TO.. Not good for when you need a real person to talk to.

shirley Disappointed in changes to Turbo tax. Much more difficult than 2014.. surprised in 24.99 charge to email state.. could not get answers to questions. charge of 24.99 to e-mail State.. Could not get answer of how to attch form 1099-r for federal taxes. Much more diffic

It was very confusing The 1st time home buyer repayment was very confusing this time . It was very hard to find. It took me getting rejected 5 times or more and calling the IRS to try to figure out why it was rejecting my tax return. Turbo needs to guide you more to where you repay for the 1st time home buyer.

column1: In result of the rejections I upgraded my pakages to see if it would help and it did'nt so now I am stock with having to pay a extra $129.00 in upgraded turbo tax package fees.
I use my tax refund to pay my house taxes now I have to try to come up with the difference.
This is the 1st time I have had this much trouble filling my taxes using Turbo I was very disappointed with Turbo this year.

column2: Not bad, but annoying flaws 1. I often return to part of my return to review parts of my return, and every time I'm asked "Was this income earned out of the US?" and so on. Why not let me answer it once, and then say, "Has any of this changed?"

column1: 2. This year for the first time, I could not click and review entered lists. For example, I entered charitable donations and business expenses which were totaled. Previously I could double click and see the list of what I'd entered. Not always this year!! As near as I could tell from your users forum, I'm not this only one with this problem. UGH!! Fix this, please!!! If you return to review something, you must answer the idiot questions again and again; FLAW--cannot review stored data

column2: What happened to Turbo Tax? Dear Intuit,

column1: I've used Turbo Tax since the 90's. What happened? Where are all the links to IRS publications from the key words & phrases that need clarification. Rental Houses are extremely painful for example- Why do I have to answer the same first 5 questions over and over before I can finally get to an overview of certain types of expense? Please provide an overview of everything with Rental Houses - like you do with the overall income/expenses big picture. Where did all the helpful interpretations go to help explain how I could save taxes as I fill out the forms? I will be exploring your competition next year because I need more helpful links. Not nearly as helpful as previous years.

column2: Requesting Improvements Foreign Earned Income Tax filing can use improvement - both in federal and state levels. Automated prompts are not all comprehensive and clear. User can be guided better before choosing between Foreign Earned Income Credit or Deduction or Exclusion. There are software glitches in entering dates to qualify for Bona Fide or Physical Presence Tests as well as in entering foreign employer addresses. In my case spouse's foreign employer info got transfered on IT-2 showing up in W-2. And I wasn't able to delete it from W-2 info since it was foreign earned income. I am sure Turbo Tax users all around would appreciate if you would improve the Foreign Earned Income Filing. Thank you for your attention in advance. Foreign Earned Income Tax filing can use improvement

2015 Tax Return Filing ALL IN ALL THIS WAS AN EASY WAY TO FILE REFUND TAXES; HOWEVER, THE HIDDEN FEES THAT ARE ASSOCIATED WITH RECEIVING THE FUNDS ARE RIDICULOUS..MY TAX RETURN WAS OVER $1400 & IM ONLY RECEIVING A LITTLE OVER $1000 DUE TO FEES THAT ARE NOT MENTIONED WHEN ADVERTISING "FILE YOUR TAXES FOR FREE"..IF THAT'S THE CASE I COULD HAVE USED A 3rd PARTY TAX PREPARER AND PAID THEM $400..THAT IS ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS..AND A WASTE OF MONEY. YES IT SAVED THE HASSLE OF GOING TO A TAX PREPARER..BUT $400 IN FEES IS UNACCEPTABLE Too many windows pop up

Charged me for extra with no way to undo I had an employer-imposed health savings account. I made no personal contributions to this account but just because it existed I had to upgrade to the deluxe turbo tax. It wasn't until I had chosen to do so that the service revealed I didn't even get any deductions because I had made no contributions. I also had no option to undo the upgrade. So I spent 50 bucks for nothing. When I finally got to selecting my method of refund it would not allow me to receive a check, a prepaid card, or the free efile option. I was forced to pay an additional 34 bucks for a refund processing service I did not want. Thanks TurboTax, my refund is now 100 dollars (sales tax brought the total up) short for literally no reason. I will never use this service again. Forced me to get deluxe version and RPS

Nice, but issues with Personal Business and State Turbo Tax still seems like the best way to prepare taxes for the money. However, for more complex tax returns that offer multiple forms for different sources of income such as 1099 Misc Income, it can be very confusing. Additionally, Turbo Tax has always been a challenge when transferring to a State and one has more complex tax filings. I spend the bulk of my time trying to understand how the Federal return handles the distribution of my income to the different forms and how the State works in general. It would be nice if the program would offer a flowchart to depict how the tax info will be distributed to multiple forms once all the types of tax inputs unique to the preparer are identified. I am not sure what other services are available that would be better. Every year I consider Lacerte, but talk myself into believing that this year Turbo Tax will get it right. What is the definition of insanity - same actions with the hope for a different outcome? Overall it is still better compared to manual completion and filing. Significant time spent on forms TurboTax selects for income (1099 Misc) for Federal; State transfer always a challenge
Lost most to fees I upgraded thinking that I needed it but it was a big mistake. fees and misleading

Can not efile extension. Does not allow me to add a statement and therefore can not efile. In previous years I could have done both of these things. Not as good as in previous years. Can not efile extension. Does not allow me to add a statement and therefore can not efile.
Tooktwice Thought i had filed it but i didnt No ne

Server has issues or else the software has a bug. After many tries, I was unable to edit nor delete an error in just one box. I know about software & servers. I called support & had to go thru all the steps I took prior: closed program, reboot PC.

column1: Support had no idea hosw to fix, as the software and/or server does not laoow a fix.
I had to start over & enter all the data. I have an income of $182K so the data is extensive.
Seems I had to pay for the filing as I thought the download software for $82. covered that cost.
I read the reviews of software nfor 2016.
BTW: support staff is trained for one week & they work for Sunderland here in Rochester, NY.
Go figure the competentce. software may have a bug, as was not able to edit nor delete an entry.

column2: You Suck very difficult to find number to call for help, no one to chat with for help. very little help
Using Turbo Tax for the wrong reason. I don't have time to right a detailed review. If I did I would research another tax software and never come back!

column1: I use turbo tax for the same reason many people don't want to leave apple phones or change auto insurance - its difficult to change when you don't have the time.
Here are 3 things that really upset me:

1) Late at night I wanted to contact someone or at least leave an email message with my thoughts and problems at the moment. Long story short there did not appear to be anyway to do that - instead I was re-directed to an area where I could "post" my question. I don't have time for facebook garbage, but i did anyway - I failed to highlight my text and copy. Due to some bug it was all lost.

2) Why is it that after using TT for 7 years this year I was not able to import my tax information from fidelity!! The ability to import anything IS THE ONLY REDEEMING QUALITY TT HAS! ITS THE ONLY REASON I USE IT! 3 or for times i was asked if i would like to import my documents and I selected FIDELITY - I was not told I could not, instead it just lead me down the path of manually typing everything in. THIS TOOK HOURS AND IS INFURIATING! Especially when i got turbotax through the fidelity website!

3) why after 7 years is TT still not able to import a w2 from the 8th largest company in the WORLD? GE! Yes i realize you have an app now that lets you take a picture etc. I don't want to mess around with an app for the 1 simple step of a W2 import. Especially when I will not use the app for another year. Hopefully I will never have to use TT again. I dont' know where to start.

column2: I think that Turbo really should secure their system but i really found it easy to file my taxes
Bait and Switch If you have a Health Savings Account you must upgrade. Always need to upgrade to complete return.

just, Ok I can see how mistakes can be made. Some items, like payment made with automatic extensions are so hard to find they can be missed. Also, I did taxes for my parents and with their return there was a requirement for a new PIN every year. There was no added security when I did my taxes using the same Premier package. too easy, some items are hidden, hard to find

Money Hungry This year it seems that TurboTax got a bit money hungry. In previous years i was able to have my info transferred and do my federal and state taxes for free because I didn't make more than x-amount. This year the wanted to charge for everything and I made well below that amount. They were charging $30 for each state tax that need to be done instead of doing the one free one and then charging for each additional one after that, and then they are charging $30 just to pull information for my previous years and when I choose to not use that option, it deleted everything i had do the previous years from their system so I am not able to retrieve it if need be. For a site that you do most of the input yourself, it seems like it gets to be pretty expensive when its all said and done. all the extra charges
All in all a good method for filing taxes. too many questions that were not relevant to my situation
Had to change password 4 or 5 times, annoying!
expensive expensive to use every year. online edition won't show forms as you go along. can't handle all k-1 fields. expensive; can't see forms while using online; poor with k-1 forms

b@stards charge extra to file b@stards require a full 1040 instead of the free 1040A or 1040EZ filing methods. they do keep track of all your last years stuff and are cheaper for the average person who doesnt want to fill out tax forms by hand, but the fact that they charge money for federal taxes is absurd. they dont do the 1040A filing system or the 1040EZ which are free to file and require you to do a full 1040

Really messed me up This is the last time I use Turbo Tax. I couldn't get my Fed tax to go through on time. I tried sending it on the 15th of April. On the 20th I learned it hadn't gone through. I tried again. On the 22nd it still hadn't gone through. I'm still not sure if it has gone through. I am now trying to send the State tax. I paid the $25. and was told that I need to file both together. It is due on May 1, and now it won't even print!!! Lousy lousy service. Filing is a nightmare

Great and easy returns until 2016 I have used Turbo Tax many times, but not the past few years. I am disappointed with two things. 1. the print is now too light for me to move thru efficiently, taking longer to complete my return. 2. My work has changed and I no longer have much business income (only $10,000 and minimal expenses. But the software repeatedly pushed me to upgrade to Home and Business, even blocking me to complete and file my return, and causing me to miss the tax deadline. I tried in vane to get help from Turbotax to no avail. So I had to go back through the whole return and remove all data regarding my minimal business expenses. 2nd, I thought my return had been transmitted early on Apr. 16, but checked back today only to find out it was not, even though I'd paid for everything and selected electronic transmission. I would have appreciated a notation on the return or email reminder that It had not yet been filed. I checked back today on the status of my refund, and was shocked that I Had no actual filing verification, rendering me almost 20 days late. All of this is leading me to switch to the HR Block tax prep software system. TurboTax seems to place too much emphasis on selling higher priced software, and less emphasis on insuring that a return is actually completed, once the fees are paid. The guidance for me to upgrade to H & B was too strong -- wasted time, missed filing deadliine.

Used to be better You advertise a free federal return but then you just keep on trying to up the ante and say you have to upgrade because of this or that and it isn't right. For my sons return it ended up costing over $140 which is much more then it would have been if I had just bought it in the store. It just isn't right. They kept trying to charge me more and more money. I could have done better if I had just bought it in the store.

IRA contributions and this review program The program keeps referring to IRA contribution eligibility. I am not eligibile for any type of IRA contribution. I and my spouse are both over 70 and do not work.

column1: Nicknames are nicknames. They should not be required to be a certain length. If I am known as J I am known as J. The IRA contribution and deduction program should be modified.

column2: Not as advertised I've used Turbo Tax for 10 years and always find it helps in loading information and filling forms. However, the advertising is misleading in stating that one State filing is free. I had to pay twice for our joint filing and my dependent son's refund. Advertising said one free state. I had to pay twice to file state tax

Poor directions for Electronic filing I thought my return was filed once my TurboTax payment method was entered. There should be easily noticed instruction to go forward and complete the electronic signing area at the TurboTax payment area. I "filed" on March 15, 2015, Patiently waited for my return payments to post and forgot about it. Today is April 27, 2016. I checked the status of my Fed Return and there was no information on it. I imagine if I check my State Return the same would occur. I am now delinquent on both returns. Not happy at all. efiling instructions unclear
difficulty of electronic submission of tax returns

tax credit Turbo tax is boring. it doesnt give you suggestions on how you could lower your tax further. during the process, it may somehow gives you a link so you could read up. IRS texts are boring and limited. it doesnt expound so much. it would be nicer if turbo tax expound on stuffs.
Good but too much It was great but if we decide to not get the extra help I don't think that we should be charged so much. The amount it costs to do it yourself.

payment by credit card after rejecting my card twice because they told me my security code was wrong, i called Capital was told my credit card was charged twice, now in order to process my credit card so i can submit my taxes i have to resubmit my payment for a third time . total waste of 1 1/2 hours. would not accept credit card

very difficult to file this year!!! Because I could NOT pay for audit protection on April 19th (the last day for filing - I live in MAINE), and because I had to enter driver's license information, I was not able to file my taxes in time. And now, because there is NO option to set up payment arrangements for my MAINE state taxes (even though in the program it said it could!), I am still unable to file my state taxes. I am very frustrated and unsatisfied not being able to make payment, not being able to set up payments

Wouldn't Recommend there are hidden fees everywhere and is not as user friendly as it likes to say it is. I missed out on my refund last year because of turbotax not notifying me that there was an error.. They still charged me for filing my taxes even though it says i didn't file with them. This will be the last year use turbo tax. I wouldn't recommend. hidden fees and horrible costumer service

Not Satisfied I contributed to ROTH IRA, Even after entering the contribution details, turbo tax showed deductions as NIL and infact took me to its partner website ( MInted.com) to create an IRA acount . I found this to be ridiculous .

column1: Also i had issue in submitting my tax returns , turbo tax failed to send me emails asking me to fix my errors and refile it even after the deadline to file taxes got over. Bad business ethics

column2: Not great this year I filed for an extension and was approved but the IRS never received my estimated tax payment info even though I sent it in on 4/18. TT does not give you a receipt for the direct debit payment and after checking my bank account everyday, on 4/27 I filed my taxes and entered my payment info again. I will either get double billed or owe the IRS interest and penalty payment. Not happy, this is the first time this has occurred. IRS did not receive payment

Updates I have spent 3 three days trying to work to get my computer to accept your update. I am beyond tired. Spoke to several people to finally get this done today. I finished my taxes by 3:00pm 04/18/2016 , every time I tried to update my computer it would freeze. When I read all the question and answers this happen to quite a few people. I am now 9 days late with filing my taxes. Do your work, so we don't have these problems. This may be my last year doing my taxes with Turbo tax. Very tired and unhappy. The people that were helping me were great. You don't pay them enough to take abuse from your clients. Talked to several people as each time you call back you get a new person and must start over. All updates should be done before putting Turbo Tax on my computer.

I was led to believe that my ohio tax return was efiled, but apparently not. the lady on the turbo tax help line said she was "sorry" that I did not do things correctly! I did what the program told me to do and believed that my return was completed. Very disappointed in this product.

Dissatisfied When I thought I completed my filing process, a week and a half went by, without any notification, before I checked online on the status of my refund when I found out that it was not completed. Turbo Tax would always send me emails about starting the filing process but there was no email sent to me letting me know that my process was not completed. Now I have to wait another 2 week before receiving my refund. Was not clear on on finishing up the filing process

my experience I had problems with my daughters social number because the x all ready claimed her witch he wasnt suppose to at all. I couldnt get any information on line. I tried to file e-file, then mailed. trying to get help

concern filing was some what easy. Additional charge for filing state taxes electronically has given me pause for using this method in the future. shocked when additional charge for filing state taxes electronically
2015 Tax Return review I'm not sure I received all of the deductions that I should have. I feel like the fees are too steep. I plan to shop around for a less expensive solution. Cost

Too Many add on's for $$$ I don't think I'll be using Turbo Tax next year. They wanted me to spend an extra $100 to file the business documents for $1400 of extra income. Does not make sense. Phone support was not available, FAQ did not answer my questions.

column1: Plus they constantly offered upgrades, additional services, etc.
Also, it does not make sense when you just need to fix one area, to be required to go through all the screens again to get to that specific area.
It could actually be simpler. So much so that I'll probably either use a different system next year or go back to paper. too many options to purchase more

column2: Needs improvement  duplicate entries applied, difficulty removing items not applicable

Could not access account - was billed twice Couldn't log in to my account, it wanted to verify through an old email address. I called the number but kept getting recording that I would be called back. Tried to log into account for several weeks and finally gave up and re-purchase Turbo Tax for 2015, meaning I paid for it twice and received it once. I received a letter that my credit card information was outdate, and yet i was already billed

Very disappointed Turbo tax did not notify me that my return was not filed. I thought I was finished. First time in my life I am late. Turbo tax started bugging me to file since Dec 2015. It could not notify me I had one last step?????????

column1: Very disappointed Discovered NOT FINISHED. NOW RETURN IS LATE

column2: No Knowledge My taxes have been rejected like 10 times electronically. I call the operators and they just follow a script and never know how to help. They dont even pay basic attention to what they are helping me with. Operators appear to have no knowledge of tax

Not As Good As It Used to Be The Home & Business App needs a lot more detail for business situations. When trying to get answers from help, the program sends me to the IRS which either has no answer or so complicated an answer that it is not helpful. Specifically you need to make more help available for Net Loss Carry Forward. Also the program asks for us to provide a photocopy of ID for ID Theft but doesn't say how to upload or where to send. The program did not carry forward my loss from last year. So maybe user error but the old Turbo Tax would have made it simpler. I also don't appreciate the fact that it is not easy to go to the Forms method as available in previous versions. I have used Deluxe version in the past with less hassle but now that option is not available to me. Overall a disappointing experience. I have been a TurboTax customer for decades but will be investigating other options for 2016. Too many "help" items that didn't help
hidden fees was better last year. it seems like every year they find a way to add on another fee hidden fees

Easy but expensive They make it all easy until they add on a $35 fee for deducting the $30 that it takes to file state returns (in CA at least), out of your federal return in case you don't have a debit or credit card to pay for the $30 it takes to get YOUR paid taxes back... As if it's not enough being a tax payer with no money on your debit card, they take more from you... They charge $35 to deduct the $30 it costs to file state taxes (in CA at least) from your federal tax.....

I spoke with a agent because of a name change. Name change I spoke with an agent 3/30/2016 and he told me that the name change was done and he would file my taxes. Well today I wanted to know when the refund would come into bank account. And the name was change was done but he never transfer to the federal & state. That make us filing in April 26th 2016 late fees will make our filing late.
Taxes weren't filed until 4/26 ? I thought I had filled. Have done turbo tax several times, including helping my kids...

column1: This year, I thought I was all filled... Was waiting for confirmation of taxes being accepted by federal and state IRS.

Realized I had not gone. Went in to turbo account. apparently I missed final step ??? I did my husband and my ID, I put in bank info. I thought I was done and was waiting for refund (and payment to KY) But it wasn't actually filed? Ahhhh!
What kind of penalty is that going to be????

Turbo tax had sent me reminders to complete filing through out process of working on taxes, I can't imagine why I wouldn't have received something when my information so complete, but apparent'y not finished. And it was April 16 or so???? kind of confusing on the actual filing

column2: Amended returns duplicate costs Since I already paid for the software service, it seems unfair to have to pay a second time to file an amended return. I made an error on a two=year old return and TurboTax made me pay again to buy the software
NOT hAPPY No comments WAS VERY DIFFICULT TO DEAL WITH SPECIAL INCOME AND SOME 401K THAT i HAD TO CASH THIS YEAR

payment not pleased with paying fee. when return was started it said free, then wouldn't let me file until I payed which mad me file late because I didn't have the money right then!!! had nto pay to file taxes while still owing the IRS

Missed out on tax return I tired to load my info from last year´s tax return but this was not possible until I paid first, however when I paid it was no longer possible to load last year´s info and I had to start from zero. On top of that I had no other option then to pay for the more expensive version. While I received last year a refund of $2,370, this year I merely got $392 while nothing in my situation has changed, unfortunately I could not ¨mirror¨last years return because TurboTax did not let me load last year´s info. I tried to resolve with the help desk which was impossible, when I finally got through after wait time of more than an hour I was referred to a tax expert and finally I had to give up after another hour of wait on the phone. I have been using TurboTax for many years but this is the first time that I needed help and I couldn´t get any .... very poor experience and clearly I missed out on a tax refund !
AGI Since I decided to continue use TurboTax it would've been really helpful if YOU stored my AGI from last year. Last years AGI
Decent but costly Expected a $20.00 rebate after signing in via USAA membership. However, never saw a rebate applied.

column1: Lastly, this is the first year I have been charged to use TurboTax and may look for an alternative next year due to the fees. Costs

column2: Great - but some additional guidance would be grea Love the program and the ability to do this on our own. But sometimes it's a bit tough - like the balance sheet and such - can be a bit tough. sometimes can be confusing

High Fees TurboTax does NOT partner with Non-Profit Credit Unions. If this "Corporation as a Person" does, it certainly fails populate a user's credit union. In addition, the fees for filing a 1040 are too high! Also Intuit's Turbo Tax manipulates 1040 filers to pay $35 to some Bank to have their tax refund deposited digitally. TOTALLY ABSURD! The online application does not make this $35 fee clear unless one reads all of the agreements, and then "doubles back" to "un-check" the "direct deposit" box. UNBELIEVABLE INTUIT and BANKS! You need to be THAT GREEDY?! I believe that last year this option was FREE! I won't be using Turbo Tax ever again. High Fees, TurboTax does NOT partner with Non-Profit Credit Unions

Great but pricey I love absolutely everything about TurboTax. TurboTax is easily the BASE that every program should be. The clean interface is the best and should be an industry standard across all programs that serve to a user. The only thing that I absolutely hate is the price. I really wish TurboTax would have discounts for stuents or cut their prices by half. So this may be a biased review but the program is great. I reaffirm, TurboTax is great. I just wish it were a whole lotta cheaper. PRICEY, EXPENSIVE

E-File Issues E-filed federal Taxes. Was rejected for incorrect IP Pin. Received correct pin numbers from IRS: re-submitted form electronically. Received email taxes was rejected again for same issue. Don't understand. Filing my taxes by mail. continue to have problems during e-file

Highly Disappointed I was very disappointed to find out that not only did I pay $50 to be able to start filing my state taxes, but when I was finished, there was an additional fee to e-file online costing a total of $75 which I did not know. That's not appealing at all and I was surprised that I was not informed. Because of this, I won't be purchasing Turbo Tax again. I had to pay to buy Turbo Tax a second time for state taxes and then had to pay an additional fee in order to efile

Poor Turbo Tax Mechanics for entering IP PIN Why is the IP PIN entered under Personal - Other Tax Situations? Very illogical. Why does Turbo Tax NOT SPECIFICALLY AND SINGULARLY ask the user if they have IP PIN numbers from the IRS to add. Lots of people do. Needs to be a STAND-ALONE PROMPT. Your Fix-it button and solution were just flat out, and comically, wrong. The directions told me to go to Federal Tax File tab - Other Tax Situations.... Just ask Angela, she saw my computer on 25Apr16 between 5:15 - 5:30 PM EDT.

column1: Also, why did I not get an email from you stating my Return was rejected by the IRS? I shall be contacting you, for payment, if I get any kind of penalties or have issues with the IRS. You all really messed up my taxes for this year.
Shame on you. Tell your CEO, I'd love to hear from him and have him answer the questions I posed above.
Regards, Location of where IP PIN is entered is faulty. Turbo Tax does not prompt user to input IP PIN numbers. Fix it is wrong

column2: Helpful as Usual Did find very useful; however some fields were automatically deleted and had to be reentered???? Slightly more frustrating than prior years. Have been using Turbo Tax for over 15 years. Appears that a few areas this year were more complicated.
I think uploads should be allowed to verify tax payer's dependent's information is correct.
Previous years I'm disappointed. This has been such a life saving program for us until this year.

column1: I couldn't go back to add ins form that I did not know was coming in mail. I tried to go 1 level up in coverage, program grabbed it & I couldn't go back to drop the extra cost because I didn't need all of it.
Just seems that with our issues this year we should have qualified for help with utilities or something.
He's disabled, I'm on workmans comp. paying my own health ins. & we are trying to live on $1,700 a month & still pay for our own meds. & I have co-pays of $40+.
Oh well, I won't be singing Turbo Taxes praises and if I have no other choice I will be far more careful using your program.
Sharon I couldn't correct $ for filing. Harder to use, couldn't get back to page asking if I had insurance forms.

column2: more difficult than in years past Overall the experience was good. any special circumstances was difficult. TurboTax kept taking me back to fields that could not be modified

Less Helpful for Iowa Tax Iowa has an unusual joint return filing separately on the same return. This involves separating a married couples income. TurboTax did some of this, but left me to do a lot without any help. The forms being used are hidden, so I'm not sure how well it was done. Although all the information was entered Turbo Tax was useless for dividing joint income.

Line 73 on 1040 AUDIT ALERT !! I have used Turbo Tax since 2009, NEVER EVER AGAIN!! In our year of retirement your program had a "clitch" in it that checked & deducted all insurance from the ACA plan credit, causing an audit to us ! checks boxes that get you auditted that are wrong !!

Frustration This year I found this program to be difficult to follow and understand. When I needed help, I had a hard time getting it. I just wanted someone to talk me through the problems I was having. It took me two and a half hours to get signed in. When I was finished, I was relieved to be done. When taxes didn't come out of my account, I went back in and found that I wasn't finished. I swear I thought I was finished when I got to the screen that said taxes would be withdrawn from my account on April 18, 2016. difficult to get help
review not very happy with turbo tax doesnt explain things well

free HA HA charged me at the end two yrs ago hey Turbo Tax made me pay over a hundred $ now I was tricked again When i Called in to find out what was happening I was told that is the way it is Very poor service I will spread the word!! Then today I check to see what my status was and IT WAS NOT SENT even tho I paid EXTRA in full two weeks ago. I hope i don't get a penalty When they say free state and still have to PAY $80 HA

You're a scheme That you take $34.99 for to pay using your tax return is a total scheme. You don't really make it clear that it costs $34.99 to pay with your tax return as opposed to a credit card. That's a total hit on low-income people without access to a credit or debit card or people who don't realize. I will surely speak poorly about Turbotax to anyone that I can. They try to scheme you out of your money
Rocked my refund love using turbo tax to do my taxes. Quick easy simple and good price nothing

1099 Issues My wife had a 1099 and while Turbo Tax let me enter the information as income it became confusing later in the process. It listed the husband of the owner of the business on the Schedule C form. Neither the husband nor the wife was the owners. It made a $300 difference depending on whom was selected as the owner which was forced. There was no option to select otherwise. Some Problems with 1099
Easy but more expensive than expected NC State EmployeeCredit Union: $0. TurboTax: $100. Expensive

Oops, filed late I know it's probably the tax process in general, but I found it to be quite difficult, and I've been working in technology for 30 years. I filed my federal taxes on time, or so I thought, only to find out when I went in to file state taxes, that my federals had never been filed. When I filed them again, I remember going through all the same screens but have no idea why they didn't file. I got TT because it was the first year I had a small business and I needed some way to print W-2's. Still didn't know what some questions were asking me

Disappointed in the fees. I signed up at the $79 price and then was charged $100+ - didn't know there was a time limit to file to get that price. They failed to warn me every time I logged in. Not happy.

Not very easy for military w/tuition assistance Turbotax needs to do a better job of helping active duty military members input their 1098 T taking the tuition assistance into consideration. I got audited and sent an IRS correction letter last year using Turbotax. This year the software did not get any better. Still confusing. Military Tuition Assistance?

late return filing I spent a lot of time completing the return and completing the filing was the most difficult due to a fee for an extra service that kept popping up. Also, the bigger problem is that I was under the impression that I filed on 4/15/16. Just now when I went in to check on the status of my return I see that there were still steps left over and I have just now filed LATE. This concerns me because I do not want to be fined for filing late. Please let me know why it was not already filed when I recall that it went through on 4/15/16. An extra fee kept popping up for a service that I did not want.
It was easy to file 1040A It should not be an issue if I file it or someone else in my family.

column1: This is the third time it has been rejected for no other reason except for the fact that I did it this year!!! This is ridiculous!!! The return kept being rejected because I did it myself this year

column2: Not enough control TurboTax gets the job done but not without some frustration. The new version does not let you see what is being entered into your forms until you purchase a version. This is annoying. You also need to re-answer questions multiple times if you want to go back and change something. I would like to click on a value in a form and be able to edit that particular section - not every section associated with that schedule.

column1: Every value in a form/schedule that relies on aggregated data should show a pop-up of that data when mousing over. For instance the income could show the various contributions when you mouse over the number(s).

The final tax document that TurboTax saved to my desktop was not quite correct. We have health insurance (and we answered the question correctly in TurboTax). However the PDF of our Tax forms does not have the correct box checked. This is hopefully correct on the electronic version being submitted to the IRS. Of course if we had filed via mail we would need to be vigilant and check these. Seeing actual forms when entering data is really helpful

column2: Excessive frustration, FEES You added fees, making it impossible to get out of being charged. At no point was I ever asked if I wanted to elect to pay for the FREE service. You lied! I will NEVER use Turbo Tax again! was not easy or accurate, I was lied to, it was NOT free (false advertising)

I thought I had submitted my taxes on line on 3/29/16 but didn't hit the submit button and Turbotax fails to email and notify me that my taxes wasn't completed. This could create me trouble with IRS since I just discover today that it wasn't sent but Turbotax did not email me any information that it was not completed.
Turbo tax sucks Taking a picture of my w2 screwed up my whole tax return and let to it being rejected several times. No customer service

Information held hostage by buying Plus All of my information was not transferred to my 2015 from my 2014 because i did not purchase the plus this year with threats like " all of your past information will be deleted" . This is not incentive to use your product again when i do make enough to use Turbotax plus or deluxe. I'm a college student and one day i will be making money that you will want to have to do my taxes!! Ill remember this information held hostage

Additional States fees are out of this world!!! I travel for work and receive wages in multiple states. This year you profited $150 from me using Turbo Tax. Next year someone else will get my business unless the additional state rates are reduced significantly. So it may be Good-bye Turbo Tax, it's up to you. $75 for each additional state

This year was much more confusing I opened the program, and entered only my name when my refund of $35 appeared. That number remained the same throughout the entries all through my final refund which was $35 (coincidence?). Suspected a problem, so went out and bought the disc (as opposed to the TDAmeritrade on-line version)--same result, but the disc was somewhat clearer and more comprehensive.

column1: The timeline was so limiting as to be useless in terms of navigating from one point to another. Could not retrieve my 2014 import, so had to enter all (twice) from scratch. Will not likely use Turbo Tax next year after being a many-consecutive- year user. Flow of program didn't match 1040

column2: Purchased deluxe Not sure how to rate owning All data from income forms entered as in past years. Went to file state and said $24.99 due. Called and spoke to rep who was very helpful and saw that one state filing was included with the Deluxe. Helped me clear issue and I e-filed. State e-file was rejected. I checked income input on form indicated and saw all data had been entered correctly. Just to be sure I retyped data on income form indicated and refiled under e-file. This happened not once but twice. They said if I still had issues they could help me file by mail; that's not what I paid for. This is the first year I purchased Trubo Tax Deluxe and used for filing. Strange how I never had an issue e-filing State tax before using on line turbo tax and paying additional for state filing and now I do..... No changes in type of income either. State filing will not e-file

Not notified that tax payment was rejected! I filed federal and state return and received "return accepted" notice on Turbo Tax for status. But little did I know that my tax payment had been rejected by my bank until I received a letter a week later from IRS. Why didn't Turbo tax notify me?? I c checked my e-payment and sent payment again before due date of return. Tax return accepted but no notice from Turbo Tax that payment was rejected
Forgot to file I have used Turbo Tax Deluxe for over 20 years and found it easy and fast (for me) until this year.

column1: Still easy & fast but somehow the filing screen led me to believe that I had filed (submitted both state & federal forms) when I had not.
To my shock when I looked for my refund on 4/24 it was not there.
Went back to Turbo Tax and it indicated I had not filed.
Turbo Tax needs to alert preparers that the filing is not complete somehow or improve there product.
I will only recommend Turbo Tax with a caution from now on. A need for prompt reminders to file taxes

column2: to pay must set up account, a confirmation # is sent via e-mail. so close turbo tax and sign on email for #. log back on turbo tax and submit conf # and am told no longer valid. tried 3 times then quit and just filed federal return very,very,very difficult to charge fee to e-file state return

TERRIBLE terrible interpretation of tax code. No waiver of ObamaCrap healthcare fees. it's not applicable let alone the fact that it's outright unconstitutional. John Roberts is a joke. this program is not used to save the republic money on their taxes, rather its a money funnel robbing America.

column1: will not be using this again!!!

column2: So-so This is not a product to be used by those unfamiliar with TurboTax and/or with tax form completion in general. The help topics are not particularly clear. Moving back and forth between views can be confusing.

column1: One issue that was particularly annoying pertained to printing and saving PDFs of the documents. When all I wanted print/save were state documents, the check box for federal documents kept re-checking by default every time I moved from one screen to another. Why? troubling coding

column2: A little frustrated I have a small investment in a venture capital fund, and the Deluxe edition did not allow me to complete the input of Schedule K-1 information. TurboTax requires me to spend an additional $50 and purchase the Home & Business version. I decided to override the limitation, print out the needed form and file the return by mail. And I needed to do this to take advantage of a $65 loss. In the past, I was able to complete this information using the Deluxe edition. I hope that Turbo Tax will reconsider its offerings in the future. Disappointed in limitations in Deluxe edition
terrible I did not want to get premium anything and I HAD to spend the little refund that I got (which is ridiculous I worked all year non stop) for something I don't want. snap shots didn't work

2015 TurboTax Review Frustrated with Turbo Tax 2015 when loaded onto computer with Window 10. The program would not update. Therefore not all forms were available. This caused considerable frustration not knowing what was wrong and why the program would not update. Eventually downloaded program onto computer with Window 7 and the program work smoothly thereafter. Because of this difficultly with Window 10, the tax return was submitted one week late. Did not work with Windows 10
Could not get Turbo Tax to work Will hesitate to use again Could not get program to work until return was late
did a poor job on my K-1s I was extremely disappointed in the performance of the K-1s If it isn't fixed for next year I will need to switch for another service K-1 was poor at best

No Way I filed my tax return on 3/16 as I knew I would not be at my home during tax time. I checked my bank account today and the amount I owed for my taxes was not taken from my account. I came back into TurboTax and there was an error on my return.....Why wasn't I notified? I refiled today, but still, my taxes now have been filed late..........not a happy camper, No notice

Needs work! lots of mistakes in printing 1. When one selects a particular form to print, it does not print the selected form. It prints some other form. This happened with several forms. 2. Transferred incorrect information for amount paid with extension to final return from Missouri to Kansas. 3. "Print front screen", does not print the form on the screen, it prints something different. 4. Nice if one could view online the actual income tax instruction booklets one used to obtain from libraries & post offices to refer to those instructions for working on one's return. Next yrs won't work on current Mac OS. Instructs not always clear
I didnt have the option to pay what I wanted  No option to change payment plan
Too Expensive its a ripoff. Too expensive. I will not be using TurboTax next year. too expensive

Unimpressed I used Turbotax through 2011 and liked it. I was disappointed this year, when I returned. The screens were child-like, unprofessional. It was hard to figure out where I was at any given time. I had trouble navigating. I missed the ability to make notes on the under-screens or to make entries and calculations. The expense seemed way out of line for the quality of this current product. Hard to navigate. Couldn't find need screens easily

2015 tax e-file, married filing separate not much relavent explaination or indication of what has to be signed and mailed. wouldn't allow e-file required by state, nickname requirement is rediculous - most already taken
It's wrong how much you charge simply to import previous year's returns and for handling a simple 1099-Misc
Terrible!!!!!!!!!! Never submitted my return!!!!!! I will dis-recommend this service to everyone. It never filed my tax returns. Never submitted my return!!!!!!
Horrible Please review with your quality teams better before sofware release. Interconectivity and information sharing from last year was a pain. Too many bugs
easy process with a hiden con $30 to have my state return delivered, it was not. closed source, false information regarding charge

BAIT AND SWITCH Way too many fees I have used TurboTax for many years and this year for some reason, they did a bait and switch... I had three different fees that I was not made aware of until the last minute! I Dont appreciate going through the entire process only to be told about all the EXTRA fees at the end Too expensive BAIT AND SWITCH

Poor communications I completed my return before 4/18 and believed it was submitted. Your form said, "And since you PAID by credit card...". This led me to think I was done. Apparently, I missed something. Yet, TurboTax could not alert me that the deadline was approaching and the file was not yet transmitted, even though you have all of my contact info. When I tried to contact you for instructions on what to do I got nothing but a useless computer generated "associate". There was no help on your site. I am truly disappointed. A text, an email, something... return was not filed even though your forms indicated it was...
Frustrated eFile did not work. I had to print and send in a return. System should allow uses to submit return by eFile instead of instructing users to print and mail return….. eFile did not work
screwed me thanks alot  there cheeper than H&R

I am really disappointed with you this year!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I've been trying to get my taxes filed since April 6th and had to file an extention with another online service because for some reason my taxes I filed through you have been rejected manyl times my taxes still arent filed
Disappointed Payment for efiling was totally a waist of time. I spent over 20 minutes trying to obtain passwords, etc. I just printed and will mail them in.

column1: Save everyone a lot of time and just tell them to print and mail them in. I couldn't auto load last years taxes.

column2: Error partially my fault Need to make depreciation schedules carry over year to year. However, when you step away it's hard to find what you need

Software Great - Website Awful I use It's Deductible because I make a lot of in kind donations. It is a marvelous part of Turbo Tax. I was terribly disappointed when I found that I could not import my It's Deductible data into Turbo Tax because I was locked out of the website. I was locked out for about 6 weeks and tech support was abysmal. One techie had me log in numerous time using a new password each time - that is until I passed the daily log in allowance and was locked out completely for 24 hours. Finally I was put in touch with the TTaxInvestigations group and they got me connected. After that, the software did it's job and filed my taxes. New security measures on website kept me locked out for nearly 6 weeks.
A Review My pros and cons pretty well sum it up. What I implied was that I didn't know (still don't know) if I did it right. Most of the time I didn't know where I was, and couldn;t back up easily
I AM LATE :( I filed and thought I completed this process on April 1, 2016. I even went back on line when a discount was offered via email to me for 50% off Turbo charges.

column1: Today, April 22; I realize that I am late and just completely finished filing. Now, I have lost the discount AND I am late filing and I am unsure of the penalties.
I am not a happy customer.

column2: I had to go back and fix information three times when you said you would fix it!! Will never use you software again!!

TROUBLE THE FIRST TIME I DID MY OWN TAXES SINCE 1962 WAS LAST YEAR 2014. IT TOOK ME A LONG TIME BECAUSE I DIDN;T KNOW TREMS ETS. BUT, I LOVED IT AND WAS jumping up and down happy with your program. This year 2015 tax was a nightmare. I spent 2 to 4 hours a day on support services with multiple problems. The first one was trouble with buying it. In retrospect the problem there was nobody asked me if I was using a Mac and therefore didn't recognize that I didn't where my downloads were. and of course they weren't when she was telling me.I just kept saying I didn't receive it because I couldn't find it and of course multiple copies were in my download file which I figured out the next morning.. It would have saved both me and the nice person helping me a lot of frustration if you just routinely ask people if they were using a Mac. The next day the problem was finding the forms that I had two thirds filled out. All I could find were all of the blank forms. The next DAY was the inability to open the form. then something decided that both my password and username were incorrect. That problem was never solved by a most helpful person. It still didn't work when we changed the user name and password twice. I finally gave up and on Sunday started all over again with a new form. Almost all of these problems would be solved if you sent me to the Mac group and also if you had a program to screen share with Mac. I'm not a person who cries much but this brought me to tears on several occasions. I probably will use you again because you're the most highly rated but then again I may not and certainly if I start out having problems I will quit. One of the most frustrating things was that Daniel who was most helpful tried to find out if I could get my money back since I hadn't submitted anything because I was just going to go and give it to my old accountant. It was left that I would receive an email because my brain was so tired I couldn't stand staying online waiting for the answer. I never got an answer. That's inexcusable. I certainly didn't save any money over taking it to my accountant given the amount of time lost. MINIMAL MAC SUPPORT THAT YOU DON'T TELL US ABOUT
never received state return $$ and federal still not with drawn from my acct.
Hard process to efile. not able to view requested information.
It was ok. FIrst time ever having to pay money back. Coincidentally, first time doing my taxes by myself. Feel better if a tax expert was by my side First time ever having to pay money BACK
Programming error / penalty Turbo Tax should be liable for the programming error made and compensate the customer accordingly.

column1: Incidentally, we been a Turbo Tax customer since the inception.

3393 Paseo Halcon
San Clemente, CA 92672
jeff.douglas@sbcglobal.net Turbo Tax error caused us to have to pay a penalty

column2: Difficulty filing First of all, Turbotax missed a couple of items. If I hadn't been reading the pubs, I would have missed some key points. Not only that, I had to go looking to find out where to insert them. Could have been a MAJOR problem.

column1: Second, I selected to file my fed return on April 15. I found out on the 20th they hadn't been filed. I found out on the 22nd that they had been rejected. I refiled them today.
I tried to order the "insurance" item, and still don't know if that "took", and if I am covered.
TT has gotten more complicated and harder to use over the years. Why??? Sometimes misses, difficult filing

column2: Pathetic software It is a wrong software which doesn't have all the forms and no customer support. Pathetic experience Wrong sotware which doesnt have all the forms for MA state tax filing

A real pain Used Turbo Tax for years with no problems. Last years turbo tax could not be located to transfer data to 2015 return. This was a major problem having to start all over from scratch. last years tax information did not transfer over
This will be my last year using this service. No help with hetting e filing pin. I have sent several email and no responses.

Disappointed user I filed two sets of returns on the filing deadline 4/18/16. First set of federal and state transmitted without problems. My personal returns which I owed ~$3k on federal return with refund on state took me through the entire menu, I input CC information and hit transmit. Screen indicated file transmitted successfully. Last few days I was monitoring my bank account to make sure the $3k was deducted. Never happened so I checked my email and no notification of filing was received. I checked the return this morning and the status said never printed never filed. I have the 40 page return printed and sitting on my desk. My drivers license information was entered as was my bank account information which transferred over from last years return. Not sure what happened but now my return is late and IRS will assess penalty. Have used TT for years and very happy with product but disappointed with what happened this year with my return. I bought Deluxe and had 5 returns I could file of which I used 4. Don't know if an update came through which caused the returns not to be filed. Should have checked my email for confirmation, a mistake I'll never make again, but screen said returns were filed so I took it face value. When I went back in and filed the return this morning, I was prompted by a message suggesting to sign up for an alternative application when filing more than 5 returns. As I said I filed 4 returns, the one this morning 4/22/16 was the fourth. The message prompt leads me to believe the unsuccessful transmission Monday of my returns is being calculated by TT as a successful transmission but it never was sent. Very disappointing considering I had the return done for a while but since I owed money I opted to pay at the extended filing deadline and now for the first time in my life I'm filing late and will be charged penalties.!!!!!!! Return marked e-filed on 4/18 was never filed!

Thot I filed 3 days early... Was proud of myself for having everything ready to file 3 days before the deadline. The "new" efile requirements apparently tripped me up and my returned didn't get filed until i logged back in and did it a second time - 3 days late. Fortunately the Premier Edition had helped me find enough credits to get a refund, so I don't think there will be any IRS blow-back. e-filing too complicated now

Mixed feelings this year Mostly fine experience, but disappointed that some info from last year's return did not auto-populate for this year's return despite fact I had filed with TurboTax last year, too. Especially frustrating because I then had to close out of my return in progress, sign back in, access last year's return from my account archive, and then close out again, and sign in yet again to continue my 2015 return. Shouldn't be that difficult. Some items did not auto-populate from TurboTax 2014 return

When I first e-filed my Fed return, it was rejected. After I made necessary correction to my return, and I tried to re-efile, I was instructed that I had to "re-set credit card authorization". Tech support gave me a phone number to call. Turned out it was a number to a different efile servicer (pay1040.com) instead of the original Intuit servicer that handled the tax payment the first time. I just wish the process can be made simpler. What happened also was the amount of tax due the first time I efiled became a pending transaction in my credit card, while the larger tax due charged to my card (by pay1949) went through and was debited to my card. I will now have to contact my credit card company to stop the pending transaction.

No updates of rejected returns I like Turbo Tax, but not happy at all with no notice of my rejected return. I didn't find out until I called the IRS, to see why they hadn't yet taken my payment, because I owed! Turbo Tax only said when I filed the first time that my Taxes were sent and completed. No email or text updates that my return was actually REJECTED!!!! I ORIGANILLY FILED IN FEBRUARY!

column1: THANKS! My e-file got lost in the digital world, didn't know my taxes were rejected until; April21, 2016!

column2: Bad business I use to believe in turbo tax but I don't now cause I never got my returns but they got paid. I never got my returns and you took all my money while I'm homeless

Issues with actually filing I've been using Turbo Tax for years. This year something buggy happened and not even the Turbo Tax rep's could explain. In February I filed and thought I finished the process. I felt I needed to verify that a week before tax day and found out that wasn't the case, their software indicated that I already e-files and could not resubmit though the IRS did not receive the files. Now I have to fight to remove a penalty for late filing. I like what Turbo Tax has to offer, BUT the e-filing process needs to be fixed. Didn't file when the software indicated I did.

1099 B My 1040 filing was delayed because my form 1099 B had glitches. Line 1f required a code W for wash sale on everyone one of my 1099Bs'. This information should have transferred into the right place when I did a TXF from my brokerage. Please correct this glitch for next year's return. Thanks

Since I never hit e-file, or paid, or received notification stating anything, when I finally completed my taxes and submitted, it was rejected. What a nightmare to submit this once again. Not as easy or understandable as in previous years I have used TurboTax for many years now. I have previously found your product to be easy to use and transparent. This year, I found the Home and Business version quite cumbersome, particularly with regard to my LLC and filing my California return. I started a business at the end of 2015. According to California's tax law, I did not have to file a form 568 or pay the minimum $800 LLC tax since the business was in operation for less than 14 days in 2015. Nevertheless, TurboTax generated a form 568 for 2015 and suggested that I file it along with the $800. I spoke with a tax professional, who told me not to file the form or pay the $800, but neither of us could figure out why TurboTax did not take the date on which I started my business into account. I must have answered a question incorrectly somewhere in the program, but I have no idea where. Like I said, the current version just seemed less transparent than in previous years. Home and Business version was very cumbersome, non-transparent, and generated a form that should not have been filed
No Help IF I COULD RAT YOU ANY LOWER I WOULD to high of a prioe

Charged me when I shouldn't have been charged. The reason I use TurboTax is because its free for military service members. I am a sergeant (E-5) in the US Army and according to TurboTax that means I am able to file for free. Instead I was charged almost $100 to file. Now I have to jump through hoops to get this corrected because TurboTax made an error. Additionally I tried to nip this in the bud (because I could see the discount not being applied) by using their help function to ask a question but the answer I received was "we'll apply the discount automatically" which was not the case. Now not only did I get my credit card charged $100 to file but my taxes are late as well. I was charged when I shouldn't have been.

PA State - needs improvement Mac product - Deluxe (installed from CD).

column1: I was very disappointed with the state version, due initially to the very confusing handling of a dual-state W-2, where a portion of withholding had already been taken for NJ (a reciprocal state to PA), and the majority withheld for PA. By default, income from the two states showing up in Box 15 was added together, almost doubling the real income. Turbotax failed to recognize and adjust for this, and failed to give any guidance in this case, although to be fair, the Intuit support person I eventually reached gave excellent guidance (2nd start for that - thanks!). I still half expect to hear back from the state about an adjustment, though.

The navigation (or lack thereof) really got on my nerves, esp. given the frustration with the above situation. There is no way to jump in at a particular point in the return like in federal (i.e., lets user decide what to work on). I had to repeatedly advance screen by screen to get back to where I wanted to edit or continue. This shocked me (in this technologically advanced age), but maybe the state product has always been that rudimentary, and I've been luckier to have a more straightforward return. Given that the federal product has these features, I expected them to be available in the state product as well.

Another annoyance that I noticed with the federal product - I seem to recall a visual indicator in older versions that something was marked 'estimated', but that's not the case now. Of course, they will show up during the review at the end, but it would be useful to also have an indication when simply looking at it, without having to set a flag manually, or wait for the error check at the end. Could be different font color, with italics, etc. I don't remember how it was indicated in the past.

I also noticed a typo in the state product (escapes me where it was, but might've been in a help screen), where two words were run together. Since spell check should pick that up, it just seems sloppy to me, and an indication that not much effort is put into the state product (the last straw for me, today).

Finally, I'm unhappy with the outcome - since my deluxe version only includes one state, i will have to spend another $40 or so (not sure of exact amount) for the NJ product, just to file a non-resident return, in order to get $300 back. I would like to see more client-friendly pricing for non-resident / out of state income, for example, a price break on getting and filing for a multi-state situation, for a single individual or joint filing.
'Nuff Said. State version does not provide easy navigation like federal product.

column2: State Tax Forms rejected after using TT State Return prepared using Turbo Tax was rejected. Got it, sometimes things happen. Re-logged in to Turbo Tax to fix. Go thru the software and believe issue is resolved. Turbo Tax says that it's fixed, I refile, and it gets rejected AGAIN for the SAME reason. Turbo Tax didn't correct the problem. Re-logged in to Turbo Tax AGAIN to attempt to fix. Go thru the software and believe issue is resolved. Turbo Tax says the issue is fixed (same messages/dialog boxes). I resubmit. As of the writing of this review, it's unknown if the State has accepted the return.

Late Filer Due to Turbo Tax We had our taxes completed and thought they were filed on 4/18/206. After waiting for the automatic checking account deduction from our account that never occurred. We finally checked Turbo Tax. We tried over and over to efile. It would never complete. The final "Continue" button just never did anything. No message, no nothing. We had to go back and efile the Federal taxes only, and printed out our Colorado taxes and will file them via mail.

column2: getting better and worse Yes, it's faster and more intelligent but the bugs are worse and require too much workaround. Incompatible versions (deluxe vs. business) Y2Y result in inconsistent auto downloads of previous year's data. e-filing is still a hit or miss proposition. infinity loops, incomplete transfer of previous year's data
caused me to file state late  screwed me trying to enter a sale of a house.gave me wrong forms

5 years with Turbotax I've used the free edition of TurboTax for several years. I'm confident that my taxes are quite simple, and would need nothing more than a 1040 or EZ. I've filed my taxes by paper before, so the ease of entering things on the computer certainly makes it convenient.

column1: This time, since I was delayed in getting around to completing my filing this year, I decided to go with the plus version. Not quite deluxe, but it offered to auto-populate some fields from previous filings. It also said I would get a military discount. So why not? It did save some time on the front end, but the other plus benefits didn't quite meet my expectations. And I didn't get the military discount at the end.

Another person with slightly more complicated taxes might find the benefit in the service, however, I feel like it was heavily marketed to me to use it, and didn't meet my expectations. I'll stick with the free version next time. Marketing

column2: Cost is much higher and same amount from others who don't charge as much including deductions.

I compared Turbo Tax with my CPA I always hire a professional CPA to do and file my actual return because I have a complex situation. I later used TurboTax as a mathematical model to do sensitivity analysis to figure out, say, if I earned $1000 more or less, how my taxes would really change, or if I gave $1000 more or less to charity, how the taxes would change.

column1: Turbo tax uses a much simpler approach to capital gains than the CPA, so simple I'm not sure I would trust it. The result was, I would have paid $60 less Federal tax with TurboTax but $1100 more than advised by my CPA for State of Illinois Tax. My CPA charged around $500 for the service.

I think you need to use a human professional if you have a complex situation. But there's still a use for TurboTax as a model for financial planning and analysis, even if you use the CPA for your real return. It's serving me well for that purpose.
Better yet let's choose a President who will introduce a flat tax you can file on a postcard! My CPA saved me $1100 I would have paid with TurboTax on state taxes

column2: Refiling because of Turbo Tax "error" scam? Turbotax spent too much promoting how easy it was to file. It was NO EASIER than paper returns. It's WINDOZE push button end screens do NOT allow for logical decisions -- just railroading to the TurboTax way. This led to duplicate entries, because I had already entered the information. When I realized what happened, I had to go back and redo my business expenses. Then, the program wanted me to make those corrections again. I called and spoke to a TurboTax representative who had no idea why I was encountering this problem or what to do to avoid it. After several hours of trying, I figured out how to circumvent this feature of the program. Program repeatedly prompted me to make duplicate entries during the review portion.

column1: 1) Worksheet boxes didn't load immediately when entering numbers and more frustrating was the fact that the details entered in to the worksheet didn't always save from one session to the next.

column1: I was not getting the reduction I expected based on previous years, and so I had to call in and review the relevant IRS literature.

The IRS calculation (Worksheet 4-1) yielded a different value than the TurboTax software, but the support person just kept saying things like "Turbo Tax doesn't have any bugs" and "we stand behind our product, as it calculates everything correctly and never makes any mistakes". I obviously like the TurboTax software - I've used it multiple years in a row. However, I'd rather my questions be treated logically by someone who can explain the underlying calculations and go through them with me in the rare event that I have an issue than someone who is going to be dismissive.

column2: PIN numbers and/or AGI process needs attention Had difficulty in attaining new PIN numbers either by phone or IRS web site. Once I synchronized to how things worked it was relatively easy to go through the process.

I will use TurboTax in the future. At almost 82 I will be glad to have the privilege. Free in the interface for a user was grossly misleading and destructive.
