column1: I am not impressed TurboTax 2015's lack of logic flow. It does not deliver the user to the correct troubleshooting area, unless the user happens to be very alert, noticing oversights such as:
1. After an error on my original submission (a dependent incorrectly selected, she was not), I received an Email from TurboTax stating that a "dependent" was incorrectly selected.

However, once I returned to the TurboTax application, the program delivered me to "resubmitting my filing" WITHOUT making any correction. There was no assistance by TurboTax to deliver me to the correct software page, nor any assistance from TurboTax to identify WHICH dependent was incorrectly annotated on the original filing. That's absurd. Disorganized logic flow(s): does not deliver customer to correct trouble area (correcting dependent, for example).

column2: 15 Days of Pain i spent 15 days attempting to again download my program because of a computer failure. The Phone folk were great, but the pass-word back-up and access to other files was very BAD!

column1: Every time I got a pass-word agreed, it would be rejected by the system because someone had not added it to the records after the phone staff got it corrected. we went through about 40 versions of the pass word - until I finally called the President's Office for help. Then it moved very quickly & I had my software on my computer in 15 minutes! This was late afternoon 4/18/16.
I still had to file with a late fee --- But it was Complete! getting through support failures to back-up Phone helpers!

column2: Something has changed - difficult to use There was an error on my MA state return, during review TurboTax indicated there were too many characters but did not indicate what should be entered in that field, did not bring me back into the Q&A to understand what to enter. Return was rejected, impossible to figure out how to fix. Ending up printing and filing paper with wrong entry. I've been using Turbo Tax for over 15 years. I will not use again. Also, the cost to use has increased to the point that it's not worth it. Impossible to fix error

Disappointed This is the 4th year that I have used TubroTax and its the 2nd year that my tax form has been rejected. Last year I kept using the fix my return and it never got fixed and as a result my taxes were never filed. This year I have run into the same situation. My problem is this, TurboTax makes sure that they get their money up front, this year $104.00 + tax. After that you are left on your own. Instead of a money back guarantee for getting you your biggest refund, how about a money back guarantee if your taxes aren't ever fixed. Also, what about a loyalty discount. I could have used another company for half of what I just paid. The only reason I didn't is because I waited until the last minute to file and their program wasn't familiar to me. Next year I will file early and for sure use someone else. Trouble filing & Price
i have used turbotaxfor several years - this was I had a very difficult time getting this sent - I have been trying since 4-15-2016.. the pin number was difficult to get
frustrated that my return keeps getting rejected will look at other options for next year can't get return accepted

First time filer This is the way the world is going, so I e filed since my local library no longer had the proper forms I needed. It worked out ok. I now know I need to save all of my charitable receipts. But I can't complain since I filed a day late. They kind of trick you on all of the fees they charge you with

Lack of info made this take too long! I am an American citizen based abroad, and have used TurboTax to file my taxes in previous years in the exact same situation. This time around, TurboTax wouldn't let me access the foreign earned income section, and I just got an error message any time I clicked the link (I tried links in the search box, the "jump to" links and the actual link in my questions while going through the normal process). Each time it gave me an error and logged me out. It never told me this was only available if I upgraded, so I spent an obscene amount of time in the search function, reading other questions and trying over and over again to access the section. Finally I upgraded, and voila! it worked. TurboTax, **just tell me** if I need to upgrade to access a form and it would have saved me hours of headache.

column1: Finally, at the end of the whole thing, I went to review and it found errors, but it wouldn't direct me to how to correct them. It gave me the option to file without correcting, but when I got there it said I could not e-file and had to mail my returns in. I finally gave up out of frustration and tried again a couple days later, and it worked with no errors and I was able to e-file.

My tax filing is very straight forward. I easily met the foreign earned income exclusion using the physical presence test and otherwise have nothing unusual. There is no reason it should have been so complicated or hard to fill out my taxes. Error messages with no explanation

column2: A Big Blip when filing Non-resident tax for Hawaii E filing for Hawaii was a first this year and when it came to e file, I paid my TT on line for Hawaii State non resident Taxes and it wouldn't accept it and said I had to mail my return because TT doesn't cover form N-158. It took me forever to get a suggestion that would work from the community blog. Luckily the deadline for Hawaii is April 20th. E filing for Hawaii non resident tax was a problem

Still havin problems, but couldnt find mistakes It took two tries to make it work today 4/19/16 & I did my taxes last 4/5/2016. IRS said, there were two, mistakes, Turbo said, there was a mistake, the mistakes of numbers were the SAME NUMBERS I re-entered 2day w/ new 5# code I re-got from IRS. it is not making any sense. I had trouble w/ 2014 taxes, BUT didn't KNOW IT, finally got return, in July??? 2014 & 2015 had problems

worked last year - not so easy this year I spent an hour looking for forms and when I did find it, I was not sure when entering if ti went to the 1040 ... I found quick zoom but could not find how it worked except to open the same form I was already on. I spent about 20 hours and ended really burned up at work.

column1: I mailed 6000 to the Federal gov and now am wondering what I should do about the money I owe the State. I doubt I charged it to Turbo Tax or my credit card so my next call is to the State Tax Department. forms hard to find , quick zoom confusing,

column2: Email me! I thought I'd filed and went back to return to find out I hadn't. An email or some kind of alert that I didn't finish would have helped Didn't alert me that I wasn't done

IRS pin does not work Everything went smoothly but the confirmation. I can not get an IRS pin for my wife that successfully confirms her identity. I have tried the other option on your site and the return keeps getting rejected. The 1 800 number provided has yet to work to get her a pin. It was always busy. The IRS pin does not work

Very Misleading... You see free and you think that you're getting free but what you're really getting is hooked on the bait. Does not tell you that you will be paying up to $75 in additional fees for using the product.

First Time Filer Rejected Three Times I have used TurboTax since the 90's (think bar code forms), and was a beta tester for eFile. Can't believe that my Fed filing for my son's first eFile was rejected three times. Instructions and "fix" were completely lame. I'll bet there would have been some work put into this process if Intuit was soaking me for some extra money for the filing process. I'm sure that they will reduce the number of included fed eFiles next year. I'm a 20+ year customer and I wonder how they will get the next generation interested in this software if you can't successfully file your very first return. BTW, I am sure that this review will never see the light of day on their site. Hope for better luck on Amazon. Can't TurboTax provide competent instructions to deal with rejected eFile for first time filer

Comparing 2015 Turbo Tax to previous years Unlike the previous years 2015 Turbo Tax software was frustrating and unpleasant. The form 8949 was generated and may have been sent electronically, but the instruction sheet indicated that the form had to be mailed to the IRS. Several users commented and complained about the need to mail the form 8453 with 8949 as an attachment since they were filing their returns electronically. The answers I found on your site were not sufficient to decide one way or another.

column1: I will not use your product in the future since it is no longer superior to software from other organizations. Form 8453 to also include form 8949

column2: Sucked This system sucks. My return had been rejected 5 times now for the same issue. And the online help is absolutely useless in resolving the issue. My return has been rejected now 5 times for the same error

Happy but with a suggestion I love that we can upload our investment account info, but I wish TT would upload the investment account expenses at the same time it uploads the INT and DIV info. I did the extra step of learning if that info was loaded, learned it wasn't, followed up on that step and netted an $800 savings on our taxes. doesn't upload investment costs.
wtf  why cant they take state fees out of refund thats some bull f/d me

Deceptive Don't be fooled by the "file your taxes for free" line. It's never free. They always find a reason to charge you for itemized deductions even when you don't really have any. AND there's a sneaky $34.95 refund processing fee tacked on right at the end if you want your refund deposited to your checking account. Deceptive, sneaky, and never free. I will not be using Turbo Tax in the future. Hidden fees
I feel that this company is wrong for doing that to their customers. Bad service. Will not recommend I was charged $34.99 for an upgrade that I did not need nor want.

User-friendly, but sneaky While the application was quick and easy to use, I lost a chunk of money by a hidden "service" they gave me with my State Taxes (allegedly), then they *FORCED* me to either accept their charge being deducted from my Tax Refund (or lose the refund altogether)... then slammed me with another $40 charge to TAKE my money. I went from a $227 refund, to roughly a $150 refund, using the same process I used to fill out my fiancee's Tax Forms....in which she not only got offered a BY-MAIL check option, but also DID NOT get slammed with two hidden fees. They must've slipped a service I didn't see in there (-$27 or -$28) & forced me to lose -$40 for deduction from refund.
return rejected  error "fix it" doesn't work, return rejected 3 times, turbo tax gives me the reason, but doesn't take me to the fix

TurboTax has lost me I'm a long-time TurboTax user, but do not plan on using it next year. We had a few complexities in our taxes this year such as moving and a sole law practice. I had problems with allocating income between states - it seems that TurboTax has less and less explanation and built-in aids each year. Still not sure I have the income correct for my new home state. And, when I needed to indicate that my stock gains were not while I was a resident of my new state, I had to open each entry individually. As some of my stocks had monthly dividend reinvestments, there were a lot of entries. I probably missed a few, which would mean I paid double taxes. In addition, I kept getting errors that showed up in the review that resulted from carryover data from past years. I was not able to fully get rid of it. I will be looking at other options next year. Not up to the job of handling multiple part-year states. Hard to get rid of data entered in previous years.

Free to File- My 4$$! The program itself was fine, but not worth the cost. I actually left an actual tax prep company and came back because it was supposed to be free to file. Turns out not only did I have to do all the work, but I had to pay for it as well. I did all the work and had to pay to file
Total BS Thats some total Bs When i click no plus ill do it my self thats what i expect not a forced payment! Forced Plus payment 29.99
2015 Refund Flaws I am a MA resident and our deadline for taxes is April 19, 2016

column1: It said I could not pay on line and also stated I was required to Mail my State Income Tax and could not file on line.
There was no reason listed under review as it stated there would be. Very dissatisfied this year. Would not let me pay online

column2: This year sucks No errors reported in the error check. almost 0 chance of audit. It said I already filed a return using the pin. I used the pin numbers given to me online and my return was rejected twice. I went back to try and find where the error is and everything on my return disappeared. Nothing, zilch. This is pathetic. I may never use turbo tax again.

column1: I may have to start all over and it is now late. This sucks. my return was rejected twice

column2: Bait and switch Was quoted $49.99 for my federal return which included the promise that this is all that I would pay for my federal return. Was forced to pay $79.99 in order to file. The application generally works well with some confusing points. Unfortunately the bait and switch is a customer killer. Will not be back next year and will be warning others. Price quoted at start was much lower than paid

Turbo tax 16 This version of TurboTax was not nearly as friendly or clear as previous years versions. I wish I would have used a different method or a different application to do my taxes this year. It was the first year I have ever owed money and for the life of me cannot really figure out why. I will probably have someone professional look at this next year to review my 2015 taxes because I don't know if I was guided correctly by the TurboTax. On top of that I spent $110 almost to have my taxes done by TurboTax. When really, it's me doing my taxes. I think it is an overcharge and should be about half that price. Confusing, lacking explanation, not as intuitive as before
If you say that turbo tax is free, than why did I have to pay like a $100.00 hidden fees. it's not free.

Review As stated in the 'cons' selection, Turbo Tax was extremely misleading because they state that their service is free, or partly free. I ended up paying over $95.00 just for them to tell me that I OWED money (both federal and state). I have NEVER in my life owed anything in my tax returns and don't fully understand how this is possible if I've been paying my taxes all year....how is this possible???? Turbo tax is misleading because they state they are 'free' but yet I ended up paying almost $100 just to find I owed $$$

My Turbo Tax The service is great because it guides the customer through steps that are simple to understand. It made me feel like I was in charge. I also liked the service's ability to backup and edit or add information at different stages, which made it easier to use because I always had the ability to add things that I remembered. This allowed me to make better use of the service.

column1: The electronic banking fee at the very end (in addition to the filing fee) is rather compelling because it becomes realized after the customer’s investment of time and effort becomes optimally expended. It is very difficult for a customer to say no or deny him/herself the filing service and banking fees, after investing time and effort into the Turbo Tax service. It is not funny and I didn’t like finding out about it so late into the process. However, I decided to pay the fee because I want my return to be filed expeditiously and I also want the convenience of direct deposit. I’m willing to pay for it. I just don’t appreciate the last second banking fee at the very end. Your service is fast and convenient. Turbo Tax doesn’t have to trick people in to paying for it. Turbo Tax is great because it is simple to use and it has the depth that customers, like me, enjoy. Is it necessary to delay the notice of the banking fee until the very end? Not for me. I’ll pay for the service anyway. But, you might lose other customers who can be negatively influenced by competitive advertisement and gossip.

Your survey is also narrow-minded because it lists its rules and reasonable expectations before it starts. This, to me, is a defensive posture that your service demonstrates before the customer even begins the survey. It’s like saying “tell us what you think, but only in a way that we like it…please don’t tell what you really think, especially if it is something that we don’t like.” Everyone knows that when two parties communicate, defensive statements always validate the complainant’s position. If you don’t like what people are going to say, you shouldn’t ask for their input. But, you won’t know what people really think unless you give them the environment to speak freely.
Respectfully,
SliQster Surprise "I gotcha!" fee at the very end of the process

column2: TT Premier 2015 The user interface doesn't seem to be improving in the past 3 years. It gets the job done for latest tax law, but there should be an early screen asking for basic changes to your finances such as "did you sell or buy a house" or "did you have a child" or "Did you change employers" or whatever is necessary to narrow down the topics I need to address instead of the present situation making me deal with a lot of things that don't apply out of the 10 income topics, 12 deduction topics, etc. This would be particularly useful when I do my offspring's taxes who has few assets and little income.

column1: Bottom line: find ways to get me through this process faster! Even with all the records I need in front of me, it still takes several evenings to do my taxes with TT! Schedule K-1 is still painful to fill out. Hard to figure out how to print state return after e-filing fed
I e-filed using Turbotax for 2014. Later the IRS sent me a letter stating that I never filed for 2014. I printed a copy and sent by mail to the IRS.

I tried to e-file with Turbotax for 2015. The IRS rejected my e-file stating that either the PIN is incorrect, or I didn't file for 2014 (vague, still not clear if they ever processesed 2014 yet). I'm going to mail 2015 to the IRS. failed to e-file again

column2: Was charged three times My credit card was charged twice to file my state taxes. After neither registered, i had to deduct the fee from my federal tax refund (an additional 34 dollars) in order to get my return in on time. sketchy payment system, lack of customer service

I had two people that were incredibly helpful! I was up till after midnight trying to figure out how to edit box #12. I knew I had to delete the "oo.o" in the amount box #12 but couldn't find the tab to do that. Now I was very tired and frustrated so after being up trying till 1230am I went to bed to get up for work.

column1: I called turbo tax after work and talked to "Russell" who was amazing! But I couldn't get wifi. So I had to han g up and try when I got home. I called again and this young lady was so awesome! She was so calm and patient with me and helped me to succeed and file my son's taxes...Thank you turbo tax I had trouble with finding the tabs to edit

column2: Phone support was sweet, but guessing  website has no phone number posted in the contact support page, could not print from the print button in the end

Good thing gone Bad. Any other year I would have said I was a big fan of Turbo Tax. I have been using them to file my taxes for the last 4 years now with no problems. This year however I get all the way through filling everything out and just before the last couple clicks to actual send everything off to the IRS a little box shows up saying please pay $29.99 to complete and file.

column1: Granted its not much, but the point is that they waited till I was all the way through the process to let me know I was going to have to pay for “help” services that I barely used, and might not have used had they let me know ahead of time that I was going to be charged for it. I even recommended Turbo Tax to a friend this year and they paid $50 for an upgraded version because they had more things they had to factor in then I did.

Its just that fact that they waited till the last minute, after all the work was done, to tell me I was going to be charged that really disappoints me. Had I known up front I would have considered it a reasonable fee and had no problem. But they didn't. So I'm off to read a few reviews to help me decide who I will be using next year. If your doing the same I hope this helps. Hidden Fees

column2: to hard to log in and made me late filing will never use again have used for years with my family never again
This year not so tood  Made changes to fed return didnt make the changes to state return

kept adding charges at end advertised as free even though it wasn't, and i dont know if it was a glitch but everytime i Denied paying for the extra packages it kept adding them to my total at the end. first the 29.99 that i did NOT want, then i went back and it asked if i wanted another package for 30, i DECLINED again and.. you guessed it, it was added to my total. im already stressed in having to deal with this so i just gave up and finished it, i dont have the time nor energy to deal with customer service trying to figure this out but i can say i probably wont be using turbotax again and yes my friends and family will know about this problem and inconvenience this website provided. costs money

A Horrible Experience Worst experience with taxes ever, and I have been using Turbo Tax for four years now. Importing your Quicken and/or Quickbooks data is a black box. I have no idea what it is including, not including, how it is calculating amounts, etc...

column1: And then I had to change something and in order to do that I had to delete a whole form and start over. Don't get me started on having to pay for State filing and then being told that I can't file electronically (hence needing to make changes).
Save your sanity and hire someone or look elsewhere for tax help. Not worth the hassle and frustration

column2: four long days and nights Many time consuming problems with 2015 CD home and business. Have used TT for 10 years. At checkout TT gives you the option of saving as pdf file. DON'T do it. TT can't input pdf data into your next year's return. I found out the hard way this year. Had to recreate 2014 tax return by scratch.

column1: TT doesn't tell you how to save it as a *.tax file, the only data it CAN input. So if you want to lose your data from last year, go ahead and select the "save as pdf file" option.

Also, the 2014 program incorrectly gave me depreciation on a business vehicle when it was FULLY depreciated the year before. So when I sold the vehicle this year, I had too much depreciation - TT wouldn't allow me to change the numbers and wouldn't let me complete my tax return due to their mistake. Two smart people at TT found an end run around this -- the only nice thing I can say about this 2015 experience.

My final complaint - there's no obvious way to get thru to the bosses at Turbo Tax with suggestions/complaints as to what needs improving. Just this public forum. Not the same thing. TT can't carry over last years TT info

column2: The IP PIN Mystery Why the deep dive to search for the placement of the IP PIN. Is it not possible to place it with other PIN ID stuff? Placement of the IP PIN

Last year I will be using Turbotax I've used Turbotax for the last 6 years and while it was a great value before, now that I have a stock share through my employeer and a HSA it makes me get the $50 package and then robs me for the state return on top of that. With the all the free programs now available out there I'm done and this is my last year. For $100 I could go to a CPA. Way too expensive for what is out there now
whont let me sign in I have used TurboTax since it was on 4.5 in disks

column1: state still has not thiers ?
I was to pay $24.99 for the state but you took $48.14 out of my credit card and then you took another $48.14 out of my debit card
at this bpoint I think you should refund all my money plus the money for the program too many to count

column2: Absolutely no Support My experience on TurboTax started out well. It was quick and cheap. However, my tax return was rejected twice, based on my incorrect efile PIN or AGI. I tried both ways and got rejected again. When I called TurboTax, not only did the customer service agent question whether I was actually me several times (I am a female with a traditionally male name, not uncommon), but she was also, rude and didn't seem like she knew what she was talking about at all. I will never do my taxes this way again. I'd rather pay double what I paid and have actual support should something go wrong. Customer Service
Inadequate information before filing began. Inadequate pricing information before filing.

column1: Repetitious suggestions exert unnecessary, distracting, pressure to 'Upgrade' or miss additional deductions, access to filings, etc. My current income profile [senior with a dependent grandchild] qualifies me to file free. This information isn't shared until one has filed &, in my case, borrowed $59+ to pay the unexpectedly large bill.
I believe this amount should be refunded. TurboTax tactics regarding upgrade pressure and information sharing are indicative of an ease with questionable business practices.
I'm uncertain if I'll be a returning customer or EVER recommend TurboTaxto anyone. Exerted repetitious pressures to 'Upgrade' or miss deductions, access to filings, etc.

column2: Easy, till you have a problems with a 6 digit pin I had never done my taxes before. I got through everything easily enough. I liked that I could do it at my own pace and come back to it when I wanted to. It was pretty easy to understand and the explanations were good. My problem occurred when the 5 digit PIN that I was given wasn't accepted. my return was rejected. I verified and retrieved the pin again, but it still wouldn't work. Then I read that I should have a 6 digit pin being that I live in Georgia and it is a pilot program state for an identity theft security feature. I never received a 6 digit pin in the mail. The function was not working on the IRS website due to security issues. I couldn't get through to the irs. I had already paid via credit card. I was difficult at that point to figure out how to change to mailing the return. Mailing wasn't entirely clear what to include. I paid $119.00. I usually pay my accountant $240. I don't think it was worth all the aggravation and stress! E-filing is easy, but if you have a problem and have to file by mail, there are issues

Everything was fine!..... I did my taxes the night of April 18 and I was done.....until I got an email on the 19th that my files got rejected. Now I'm going to have late penalties!!! Didn't have extended help on last tax day

Be sure you qualify for the free return If you are coming here thinking this will be free, turn away. They get you in the "door" by promising a free service but after you've spent a good 30-60 min here, they pull the rug out and reveal that your particular return is not eligible for the free service. Just be sure your return qualifies for the free return before you waste time here.

WILL NOT ASSIST- BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE I WILL PAY H AND R BLOCK THE 400.00 TO DO MY RETURN... I WILL NEVER USE YOU AGAIN...... I CALLED THE 18008291040. AND THE NUMBER ON YOUR SITE.. ON HOW TO GET THE INFORMATION FROM THE IRS. ALL I NEED YOU TO DO WAS TELL ME- HOW TO GET BACK TO A PACAFIC AREA. SO I COULD ENTRY THE INFORMATION I RECEIVE FROM IRS ALREADY...... YOUR PERSON KEPT SAYING YOU NEED TO CALL IRS. I ASK FOR HELP ON HOW TO GET TO A PACIFIC AREA AFTER CALLING IRS. SHE KEPT TELLING ME YOU NEED TO CONTACT IRS.

Used TurboTax for 20 years plus As guardians of our adult incapacitated daughter, the medical and legal world caused horrific problems for us and our daughter. TurboTax could make it easier for these exceptional circumstances to provide for a guardian easily filing for their ward taking one problem off the table. This year a problem because we are guardians
IT DIDN'T WORK FOR SOME REASON MY E-FILE WAS IN A LOOP - I THOUGHT IT WENT THRU BUT ONLY THE INTUIT CHARGE WENT THRU -- THAT FIGURES. MY TAXES WERE A DAY LATE

forced fees We force to pay fees don't want

column2: Charge for State Not as quick as you would think, Half believe I'm over paying and may actually have to have an accountant check the return. State was harder than Federal and less help

Extremely Unhappy Disallowed my efforts to file extension. Said I would receive the proper form in my E-mail thus was never sent. Getting too late to mail on time. Next day (Apr. 19th) a different format came up that wasn't there. Then no problem completing today. Used Turbo-Tax for prior year returns with no problems. Made my return late
helped out ith refunds ok,took too long took too many trys

Hidden fees The tax return is easy to do, what is confusing is what you are paying for. The total does not come until the end. Would like to know as you go what you will be paying for Fees are not explained and can be confusing

I am not satisfied with your :" Service Experts" I tried to get answers dealing with adding state corporate products to a second computer. No one in your service group knows how to download the product. I have spent hours with your service group and I finally gave up. Now looking for other software.l Your severice reps are not very good.

Overpriced Underwhelming I already had my tax return completed manually, but it was getting late so I wanted to file online. TurboTax doesn't exactly follow the way you might do things manually, and you may have trouble finding the info TurboTax wants. My 1099-R boxes didn't match up with the TurboTax version of it, and there were no explanations available. TurboTax doesn't handle some unique situations. The website also doesn't fully explain some situations or terms, requiring visits to other websites (non-Intuit) to get helpful info. I had to go back and redo some sections, and make multiple phone calls. I ended up extremely frustrated and filing late. Overpriced

Too Many Fees They do not give the max refund. They TAKE the maximum from your refund. $35 to PAY the $60 out of my refund?? Why? That's $35 dollars that could be in my gas tank. They advertise free federal, but then coerce you into a paid package, then charge for every other thing possible. I have used turbo tax for the past few years, but I will more than likely go to a tax office next year. They take less of your money in person. So may fees for no reason.
Unable to import. Unable to E-File Paid $64 for deluxe turbo-tax and the result was:

column1: Unable to import
Unable to E-File even though the EIN number was correct.
Told to file by mail, but wasn't given all the information that the IRS wanted.. Couldn't E-File was given poor information for mailing the return and it was returned by the IRS for more information.

column2: Upgraded to premium but... I've been using Turbotax for many years. I purchased the deluxe version but I could not easily find forms i needed. So i upgraded to Premium because it is supposed to have more forms and a free state return. After paying $30 to upgraded, I found out Premium has same forms as deluxe but they walk you thru each step. Not worth the extra money. SO I figure at least the state is free, but NO. Premium has NO free state efile. I still had to pay $27 to file my state return. If deluxe and premium are soo similar, why pay $30 more and still no state efile. Premium and deluxe both have same forms and both allow 5 federal efiles. Dont waste your money on premium. too many hidden charges

What a Nightmare Did Federal without a problem. Made the mistake of putting in a land line number instead of my cell. No way to correct this issue either by software or on the phone to agent. Told agent I could not get my SC tax forms On the disc. .He said I should have gotten Deluxe. Told him I did. The system was in a loop! It kept saying I had to install updates then back to same screen. The State was AL and not SC. Today got an agent that had to believe me by getting into my Computer. She said uninstall and reload. We did and I changed state to SC not AL. Finally got it to do the state. Should have been given FREE E-File!! Paid $50.00 for Deluxe and should not have had to pay for State
printing issues Fast, easy to input data. NOT SO EASY TO PRINT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I DON'T WANT TO EFILE! almost damned impossible to print the forms

Not as good as it gets They have they CPA let's hope, you can click and go, that helps but let's be honest. If we didn't wait until the last minute or past the due date, have too much on our plates and just too little time, we would have sucked it up and did it ourselves!!

column1: The program at times did strange things that I have not encountered before - for example, when trying to edit brokerage information, it entered a new brokerage account instead so I had to go back and redo things several times.

There is no good way to enter foreign income or pension and still retain the ability to file. Foreign entities do not - and are not required to - issue US type 1099's and W2's. After much searching, I did find a work-around from another user who had a similar problem. I was able to efile and hope that I have not created another problem by using this method.

A few years ago, TurboTax had a feature called "what if". I found this very helpful in trying out different scenarios, as well as for tax planning for the following year. I would like to see that feature again.

I am seriously considering using another tax prep program next year, even if I should have to re-type all carryover info. could not use on more than one computer, difficult to enter foreign pension, customer service not helpful

Need DL info? I went through the entire process of filing out the forms and filing... however, they needed my driver license info for some reason and since I was in the process of waiting for my new license (the current license was expiring and I had applied for a new one and got the temp license) I did not yet know my new license expiration date. So I filled out the rest of the online TurboTax forms and they gave me the "Congratulations" screen and let me print the forms and everything. I got the new license a couple of weeks later but I did not remember that TurboTax still needed that info before my taxes were filed correctly. So it was my fault but I wish they had done a better job of reminding me that I hadn't finished the filing process, ESPECIALLY as the Federal deadline was approaching. It wasn't until today (day after the deadline) that I checked the IRS site wondering why I hadn't yet got the refund, and my investigation brought me back to the TurboTax site where it looked like the process had not completed. I never got an explanation of why they needed my DL info and no notification that I was about to miss the deadline. I likely won't use TT next year. Need for Driver License info caused me to miss deadline

column2: HOW TO Make Tax Day Less Painful Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) introduced a bill that would make doing taxes vastly easier for Americans — and would strongly push back against the tax prep industry's attempts to keep taxes difficult.

column1: The Tax Filing Simplification Act of 2016 would order the IRS to create a free online tax preparation and filing service comparable to TurboTax or other commercial programs. Moreover, it bans the agency from working with the tax prep companies, as it's been doing for years.

Currently, the IRS collaborates with tax software providers (mainly Intuit, which sells TurboTax) on what's called the Free File program. The program is supposed to provide free access to commercial software for low- and medium-income taxpayers. But because the eligibility rules are so complicated and the system is so poorly advertised, only 3 percent of taxpayers use it, and the National Taxpayer Advocate has repeatedly called for the program's abolition.

Warren's bill would kill the corrupt, feckless Free File program for good. But it goes further than that. Best of all, it establishes a new "return-free" filing option that would send millions of Americans with simple tax situations a pre-prepared tax return, which they can submit unchanged if they like.

column2: Good service, bad lobbying I really Turbo Tax for the convenience, but the fact that Intuit is lobbying to keep tax law complicated has made me decide to stop using this service in the future. If you have a good product, people will use it. You don't need to spend untold dollars in lobbying money to make sure that tax law continues to be a nightmare. This is particularly a problem because the Americans who suffer most from complex tax requirements are poor Americans. Intuit, why do you need to be part of the problem, aggressively so? It's disappointing, and I can't continue to give my money to a company that plays this corrupt game. Greedy company meddles in tax law

What a Scam Not happy that it says you can file for free but that is not the case. Also hate that i got charged for every little thing like using a credit card, direct deposit, etc. Will never use turbo tax again. Lied about being able to file for free, Nickel and Dime you on everything

TY 2015 TurboTax Experience I've been using TurboTax for over 10 years. Usually, its a great experience. Easy, simple and convenient... However, this year was different. The self-guide questions, didn't simply address my issues and the help button or assistance wasn't as detailed or available for each entry. Even worse on the state tax forms... It was very vague on Traditional IRA Rollover determinations and partial early withdrawal penalty and income issues... Additionally, there was a glitch in the program that didn't allow me to purchase the Tax Audit Protection feature. I tried multiple times and it wouldn't take me to the credit card page to pay for it. Worse, the program would not let me proceed until I opted to cancel the purchase. I called the CSR # provided and had to wait 40 min and was hung up on. I then called back and after an hour was able to finally speak to a live person. Unfortunately, the CSR didn't know what they were doing, put me on numerous holds for minutes at a time and provided me wrong information and an incorrect phone number to call to purchase the product directly. I finally had to go online and find the Tax Audit Protection and pay for it separately. The experience was terrible, frustrating and very unlike what I've grown to expect from TurboTax and Intuit. Hopefully, next year will be better... If not, I'll have to find a better product elsewhere... Respectfully, Poor Phone Customer Service Support and Program Glitches

I was horrified that I couldn't print two years of taxes off my computer. Thankfully I am old school and keep paper copies. When you go to open an old tax return (more than current tax year old) TT says there is a new version of TT and you watch your prior tax return disappear. I've never filed an amended return, but I'm wondering how I would do that if I found some tax document from 2014!?

column1: Another annoyance is that I don't believe you can alphabetize your entries in a section. We have stock in over 40 companies. Some times they change, sometimes they get sold, sometimes they don't give dividends. What good is all of that history if it is no longer in alphabetical order because of changes over the years. What is worse is charitable contributions, because in that case it is over two hundred organizations. As the list of organizations we donate to has changed over the years that too has fallen out of order. That is a Real challenge to go through. Worse yet, as you scroll through, if you edit an item, when you flash back to the list they start you at the top again. I probably spend an additional 8-10 hours on my taxes because of these two sections not being in alphabetical order. old returns disappear after the new version of TT is out. can't alphabetize entries in dividends or charitable contrib.

column2: Harder, less helpful than in the past I am less pleased with this software than in the past primarily because it gets more "robotic" (numbers in, decisions out without my participation or understanding why the end result is what it is.

column1: For example, for 2015, the software stated that the home office business deduction that I have taken in the past, was not allowed in 2015 - - but it did not state why it was not allowed. I read the help page in the software, and the home business expense deduction guidelines on the IRS site, and still do not understand why the deduction is not allowed. If your software knows the deduction is not allowed it should be able to tell me why - - what has changed since 2014 tax year.

In past years your software has been a great "guide" that has lead me thru the process and allowed me to understand the reason for each action/decision. Just entering numbers and getting auto-results that I don't understand or agree with is anxiety provoking for me. Couldn't get help with home office expense issue

Heads Up I use Turbo Tax every year. It is simple to use, so I buy without concern for price or reading the box, because it's all I use. Due to circumstances beyond my control, I was very late in getting my taxes completed. We run two businesses, which involves my father-in-law, plus we have 5 children that are required to file, which I filed all 7 returns last year from my home & business turbo tax. I don't complain about all the fees at the end, as I can take care of things on my schedule from my home. However, when I finally got them all filled out this year, I wasn't able to E-file them all. I got the first 5 returns filed, then when go to do the 6th and 7th one, it says I'm sorry. I know this isn't what you want to hear at this point, but you need to go back and hit Print and mail your taxes in. Seriously, at the end of the program, you say sorry. Information that pertinent should've been at the beginning, when STARTING the 6th return, maybe stating, WARNING: you may complete this return, but only 5 may be E-filed!! So, at 9:00 p.m., when all post offices are closed, I am left scrambling to get 2 extensions filed. Thankfully, in Indiana, you only have to file a federal extension, as the state extensions were required to be mailed on Friday. Yes, after getting the box out and inspecting it, it does say that on the back, but who reads the box when this is what you've always used. Extremely frustrated, with much unneeded and unnecessary stress. Thanks! Only 5 Returns to be e-filed

column2: Best Electronic Tax Program I have used TurboTax for years because of the ease of use and straight forward instructions. The only disappointment I find with TurboTax is the increased cost every year. I use your TurboTax for Home and Business every year because of the ease of use of the application and a consistently good product. But each year I find that TurboTax finds ways of increasing its price. Last year the price increased by 20%. I was surprised that the price this year was lower until I had to file and found that I now had to pay to file my State Income Tax. In all my previous years of using this product I never had to pay for state filing. NOW I realize that again, TurboTax has increased its price by about 15% over last year. Having to pay for State Filing was deceiving. It should have been noted more prominently on the packaging that electronic state filing was no longer free like the federal filing. Com'on TurboTax, be more truthful in your marketing. I guess this review should remove me from any chance at winning a "prize" from you. Please start thinking about the average tax payers who's wages have not increased in years and have a small business that is struggling to keep its clients and to pay their bills. Love your product very much but the increased cost will start to rival having to hire an accountant to do my taxes. You now have to pay for State Tax Filing

column2: Greedy I had to file state taxes for two different states and was not only charged 29.99 two times for each state which i was fine with but was also charged another 34.99 to, from what I gathered, allow them to take the now 59.98 out of my tax return instead of paying it directly, this seems a bit greedy and is not specified initially when choosing the option, I dont recall having to pay this last year and if I did I didnt catch it. It makes me wonder how may people have unknowingly paid this fee, it doesnt seem like much but it took half my return and with thousands of people using this site im sure it adds up quick. Just seems a bit greedy is all. getting greedy turbotax

No E-filing for Federal ITR Extension?! Why is the Federal ITR Extension form be printed and mailed - and not E-filed like State? What is wrong with this system? I was forced to file my ITR and pay everything with my credit card with all the fees because I do not have the money in the bank. I always thought that TurboTax was better than other software. Been using it for the last 10 years but with this glitch, it is mind-boggling why TT doesn't have this feature? Please amend this portion for the Federal ITR Extension to be able to E-file, otherwise, I may have to switch software. Why should Federal ITR Extension be mailed?!

Mixed Bag Overall, I like using the program and find most of its coverage easy to navigate and understand. I found it a bit frustrating and confusing. Confusing information about Self-Employment, 1099-MISC, and business expenses
we did it i like bc its easy but i still feel the fees r to high fees to high in comparsion

Last Year with TurboTax TurboTax has been getting worse each year, this was the worst. The review process finds problems that it doesn't explain, navigation is amazingly bad. Why do I have to click through questions I've already answered to get to something I skipped? Why do flags point to random pages instead of the pages where the flag was created? Worst of all are the surprise fees at the end. I ALREADY PAID $99.99 for this piece of c--p software, now, they want to take more at the last minute!!! Best of all, they say they will take that fee out of my federal return "for FREE" Isn't that sweet of Intuit!! Surprise fee at the end of the process, review finds "mistakes" when information was never requested

Pros and Cons I do like how easy this process is. But the pricing is not as transparent as it should be. You start out clicking a button that says 'Free' (obviously not free) , then you find that filing state returns is an extra cost (ok), then you are hit with yet another fee for 'direct deposit'. I would hope that in the future Turbotax can find a way to be much more upfront about how much their service will actually cost. Pricing information is not upfront

at least I got them paid I am a little frustrated. I did NOT want to pay my state taxes at this time, and I could not figure out how to make sure that I didn't. I needed to wait the extra couple of days for my paycheck so I would have the money in my account to cover them. I have always purchased the disc to do my taxes before and never had any trouble deciding when I would pay my taxes, so you can imagine why I am irritated. There should be a way to do this. I don't want to bounce my account, and, if the funds come out too soon, I will. I could not separate my state taxes so I could pay them later when they were due!!!

Beware of PLUS More I appreciate the ease and painless use of the website. I don't like how Turbo Tax slips in PLUS More at the end and justifies it by telling the user why it added it. I am sure it snuck it in somewhere in the middle of me paying more taxes then being relieved that I don't have to pay as much as I thought. I would like to be given a blatant sign saying from this point onward the $29.00 you thought you signed up for will be doubled.

column1: I'll have to not let my guard down next time.
Happy filing! PLUS More Scam

column2: Foreign Tax credit and Schedule K-1 Schedule K-1 foreign tax credit asks if foreign tax was accrued (but no option for paid). So when I selected accrued, since no option for "paid", then TT doubled the foreign tax credit. Please add a tip sheet (hotlink) to tell mutual fund holders they cannot select both paid and accrued. e.g. 1099-DIV box 6 is labeled as foreign tax paid, and they should not select accrued for a simple mutual fund situation (passive income). Or add a tip sheet (hot link with a clear explanation if TT has no option to say either accrued or paid for Mutual Funds, Schedule K-1 foreign tax credit asks if foreign tax was accrued (but no option for paid)

a couple of hiccups Paying for State return was a surprise. I purchased Turbo Tax for $55 (Deluxe) and have done this for the past 10 yrs, and it's always included one free State. This time I had to pay $24.99 extra to e-file my State. That means I had paid $80 to file my tax return this year, plus $24.99 to do the e-file. That's a grand total of $115. 10 yrs ago I paid less than $40 to file both Federal and State. I think it's time to switch to a professional tax preparer. TurboTax is gettting too expensive. Schedule K-1 needs more instructions.

traded speed for gimicks It wouldn't download my financial records with the online version. Told me to use the CD app instead. That didn't work either though it got a little further. Ended up having to do the transactions by hand.. and that took a while!!

column1: Lots of times the app was slow as it recalculated every single time I entered a number. This was extremely annoying when you have hundreds of entries to go through (see above). Then after it did the math it would animate the refund amounts going up or down. That took even more time. How about you do that AFTER all the hundreds of records are entered and not waste 10-15 seconds after I enter each entry. slow and limited

column2: Good but not on Deadline Day I have used Turbotax for the last 3-4 years and I have been very happy with the application and service. However, this year, while the interface was great--the server was extremely poor. I spent 3 hours trying to finish a few minor edits in my taxes because the program kept disconnecting and freezing. I've transmitted on deadline day before and did not experience this enormous delay. I was not even able to make the deadline. I hastily filed for an extension and I do not know if I filled it out properly because of the speed needed to complete it. I am now very worried about the status of my return and whether I will be approved for my refund. Even more, I am getting married and need all the extra funds I can get. server was very poor prior to deadline

2015 TURBO TAX PREMIER REVIEW SEVERAL MAJOR BUGS COST ME HOURS THIS YEAR, AS FOLLOWS:

column1: - ONCE IMPORTED, PREVIOUS YEAR TAX DATA CAN'T BE CHANGED IF INCORRECT, REQUIRED COMPLETE RE-ENTRY OF ALL DATA ON NEW TAX FORM

- ELECTRONIC IMPORT OF BROKERS DATA ON STOCK TRANSACTIONS THAT HAVE NO BASIS OR ACQUIRE DATE CAUSES WORKSHEET ERROR WHICH PREVENTS TAXES FROM BEING FILED (EVEN THOUGH TAX FORMS ARE CORRECTLY DONE), HAD TO ENTER INCORRECT DATA TO FOOL PROGRAM, SUBMIT TAXES

column2: turbo tax not too turbo! I have used turbotax the last 7 years. It is very convenient to pull up your taxes whenever needed on a site.
