Tried to Rip Me Off! I did not appreciate not being informed of the charges that came with choosing the option to get my fees deducted from my refund. I had specifically chosen to NOT use the Premium benefits and when asked what method of payment I wanted to use (1. Pay with Credit Card or 2. Deduct fees from Federal Refund) there was no notice saying that they were automatically adding the Premium benefits charge to my services after I had specified that I did NOT want them.

Hmmm... worth it? I am curious if just using the online version for free, and THEN paying for the state e-filing is cheaper? Can anyone advise me on that? Pay for the software, and again for the state e-file? Make it more user-friendly. Make it auto-scroll to areas at bottom

Poor customer service Called customer service waited on hold for an hour. Got hung up on. Never got my question answered. Customer service on phone over an hour wait and then hung up on me never answered my questions

2015 taxes I had to do a lot of re-checking and going back and forth from easy steps to forms. Seems Turbo tax is getting more frustrating to use. It started last year and got worse this year. I tried getting help prior to spending a good 2 hours trying to fix it myself through the forms, but ended up waiting an hour on hold before having to hang u because i had to pick up my son. The issue was with paid family leave I checked that box and it took my husbands enter income and made it PFL, which completely messed up my State taxes. I went in and corrected it but it would not correct it, I even went completely through it again and nothing changed. Countless hours wasted.. froze A LOT, i had to manually enter changes in State because they didn't change over when changed in Federal.
Good Too many questions and few hints to understand what most of them mean Not enough details
Unhappy Camper :-(

column1: Plus FILE signed me up for a subscription service I did not want. Could not see the actual forms, could not see how down deep I was in a form category or if I had the right one to correc

column2: ok till your tricked into paying more fees its easy file. the problem is that its deceiving- its not free its 30 dollars which is not bad. the problem is that they are not upfront with the fee. after you spend about 30 minutes working on it then it tells you o the federal part is free not the state. mostly everyone pays state taxes so dont deceive people. then at the end after you have decline the $35 upgrade multiple times. guess what it was added anyways. now that is the part that really made me mad and that has driven me to right this review and to share my experience with others. this is my second year using the service. i dont mind payig for the convenience. deceiving -they try to force you to pay extra fees

Very Easy -- but there's a trap I could *not* get it to not charge me for the premium audit defense (after several tries of explicitly removing it), despite it also saying I have extremely low risk for audit. This persisted as long as I tried to get the fees taken out of my refund. I ended up using my credit card instead (which indeed did not charge me). But there's a trap

UPSET I am very upset with the fact that I cannot file my State Return, because I cannot afford the Turbo Tax fees, and my federal return was not high enough to cover it. Now, I have to file an extension, just because I cannot afford the program to file my taxes. FRUSTRATED. Could not afford to file my State Return
got ripped off another extra $34 dollars I tried to remove the the extra fees with no success I ended up paying $64.XX even with picking the free option
Fee for filing Shame on you for charging 55.00 to file an EZ Form!

column1: We are elderly and have to watch every penny. I'd like a refund. Fee is too high

column2: Required my phone #????? Won't process your forms unless you give them a phone number to call you on??? What a bunch of Do-DO!! I gave them my Dads number who will rip their butts when they make their sales call! Slow
Too Many Fees and cannot e-file unless accept additional services at a charge

You should spend less lobbying! turbotax charges too much money for their sevices. This must be because they spend that money lobbying congress to keep taxes complicated. Thanks turbotax, thanks a bunch. helped make taxes compicated

Not Super Happy I have filed with TurboTax two years in a row now. I have filed with their free software, and then this year I filed with their Home & Business software. I could be very mistaken, but I don't remember being required to upgrade to the $105 plan JUST to file my 10-99!! Very frustrating. It is quick and relatively painless otherwise, but I know how to file my own taxes. I know what portions of the form I need to fill out, etc. but I am on TurboTax for the convenience of it. I know that I will owe taxes, so this whole "you can just deduct the cost out of your refund!! :D " doesn't actually work for me. Just let me file my 10-99 for free. Please. Constant Upsell, Unable to File 10-99 without Paying, Feels like Scam
Has Gotten TOO Expensive!!!!! Will not use again....it used to be reasonable and now they charge for everything!!! and ridiculous amounts!!! Better off going to a new site TOO EXPENSIVE!
Not free This program ended up costing me $130 after all the added fees. I filed a w-9 and 1099 and another fee for using my bank account to direct deposit the money. Wrangled me in for the free tag

Overpriced. No better than cheaper alternatives... I gave up on TurboTax about 10 years ago and started using some of MUCH cheaper alternatives. Last year, I found that I had a couple of significant questions which I was not able to find easy answers for with those other software packages. Consequently, I resolved to give TurboTax another shot this year in the hopes that it would provide much more clear explanations thereby speeding up my tax return preparations.

column1: Sadly, I found TurboTax2015 to be no more informative than the software that I'd been using when it came to providing background information. I gave up trying to find answers in the help and found that google provided much faster answers. As an additional insult to their customers, they charge $25 to e-file with the state when it is FREE! I ended up WASTING even more time transferring information out of TurboTax into the interface for my state's FREE E-File interface.

Nice job TurboTax. You are the MonsterCable of tax preparation software. You charge for a premium package but don't actually bring ANY additional value. It took me longer to prepare my tax return this year than when I used other packages.
I will not be using your product again. OVERPRICED, not much actual guidance that isn't FREELY available online and from the IRS itself

column2: good program its a good program but due to the rising cost of using it there are other programs out there just as good I will probably use next year instead cost went up too much
No Refund - I had to pay over $500 I had to create a new account midway and clear and restart because the results didn't make sense - an practically every

column1: time I restarted it was giving different results.
My impression is that the software is all messed up.
The phone consultant did not give a satisfactory explanation. Can't explain why my $6500 Roth IRA contribution didn't have an impact towards giving me a refund

column2: HIdden fees and broken card payment The website gave me the unmistakable impression that filing my federal returns would be free, but because of one deduction that I'm still unsure of the exact nature of they demanded that I upgrade to a deluxe account for 55 dollars! Mind you they didn't say this until I had already filled out all of my forms.

column1: And worst of all, after that the credit card payment screen wouldn't accept my card that I routinely use for online purchases, and they demanded I "upgrade" again just so they can charge their exorbitant fees straight from my tax return! It's completely outrageous!
0/5 stars, will never use again. DO NOT USE THIS "SERVICE" Basically my whole experience

column2: Stupid process for electronic filing. Asks for credit info and personal data and then starts to ask questions for which there is no entry needed or info to provide...I DID NOT NEED a K 1 filed this year. Can't e-file unless I lie about something. Another form the same. Am I to be charged for e-file when it would not transmit without erroneous data.

Not what I expected If you elect to mail in your federal tax due on your own, turbotax automatically sets you up with voucher(s). I elected this option and they printed six vouchers with a set amount of payment. I didn't get to elect what I wanted to mail in. What if I am mailing the full amount owed?? Now I am stuck with a voucher with an incorrect amount. And is this reported to the IRS?? It doesn't make sense for turbotax to predetermine an amount that you may or may not be able to send. If you elect to mail your federal tax due turbotax automatically sets you up with a voucher(s) several.

Been ripped off Thiis system is rigged to take your money. Please refund my money that you charged with out my authorization. forced me to pay or else. told not to include extra charges system charged extra any ways.

Disappointed Not sure why Turbo Tax suggested I pay the premium rate. This was not something I needed. I thought it was to allow for my state return to be filed in addition to the federal but I had to pay another fee for that. Very disappointed. Probably would have been even more upset if I had to pay taxes which is what Turbo Tax originally showed. I had to do some research because I could not believe I was about to have to pay over $1000!!! Which I did not have, different problem! Turbo tax should have picked up that I have a rental home and that I did not account for depreciation for my house in the assets. Disappointed :-( I was going to have to pay over $1000 if I did not do my own research. I paid too much for a service I did not need

WORSE EVER I have used turbo tax for over ten years and this year's experience was horrible. The program forced me to use a higher valued package than normal. Made me pay for it only for me to have to file for an extension because of problems with data entry in the end. Turbotax had already charged me even though I was unable to e-file. Turbo tax also had higher rates but I was reluctant to use anything else bc all of my information was stored with turbotax. Never again. LIVID. GREEDY
I owe, I owe.....off to work I go! Hoping next year will be easier. took much longer than anticipated
Too expensive  every year I have to pay more money to do my taxes

2 thumbs down this year Used turbo tax for years have gotten many friends and family to use the program very unhappy this year refund amount was there but customer service and help was not Qyick zoom function, inability to ever get through customer service
Don't want to pay for "why" You tell me I owe the govt money, yet you do not tell me why. You have this info readily available, yet you hide it and want me to pay extra to see it.

column1: Your unwillingness to provide me with an explanation is harmful to my peace of mind and just feels wrong. I don't need live support, just a succinct written explanation.

These tax calculations are very important, and if I am to pay you $50+ extra just to get a basic understanding, I may as well go to a tax preparer. I'm sure it's a simple explanation, why hide it and cause your customers anxiety?
In short: do not charge extra for the "why". You will lose my business, along with anyone else who does not want to be nickel and dimed just to get a basic explanation. lack of explanation

column2: Not Happy This is my 6th year of using Turbo Tax and I won't be using it next year. Despite using the Premier Version, Turbo Tax didn't take me through a simple sale of property without having to research it extensively and call support re correct forms. When it came time to file, the program was glitchy and kept repeating error messages. Tech support was lengthy and not very helpful. They finally decided that form 593 couldn't be e-filed in State of Ca, which should have been determined at the beginning. Instead I wasted hours and hours on Turbo Tax. Going to a CPA would have been more effective. My tax situation is not that hard but Turbo Tax made it almost impossible Not Good for Complicated Tax Situations

pricing The pricing is higher than most other online sources and I completed a quote on TAXACT & it said that I owed $800 less than what TURBO tax is giving me. pricing is higher and gives different amounts owed
not happy I can buy this cheaper at a retail store. what happened t0 th free state efile
Not up to standard this year Improvements: transitions from Easy Step to Forms and back seems more seamless this year. And more effort has gone into getting the Clergy Housing Allowance right.

column1: But ... the Clergy Housing Allowance isn't quite right yet. And: having to re-enter the same vehicle data more than once is annoying; nor does vehicle data appear to import from previous years. Reviewing answers given to EasyStep questions is still awkward. Schedule E may have a bug in its passive activity programming. Confusing instructions, multiple entries of same data asked for, possible programming errors

column2: under cover charge not free as said you claim it's it free but you charge me three different fee even when I'm still saying no upgrade charges you charge for state and federal taxes when I'm filing state taxes then you charge for another upgrade i didn't want but it continue to charge me because it won't let me go on until i click the upgrade . Then the bank charge for direct deposit .I see two charge but the the 34.99 no I don't because i'm not filing two taxes.
Give more helps and tips Give more helps and tips and show where we can find it on the previous year's tax return and how to change it on this one.

column1: easy to use but when it checks it it does not explain how to fix it.
I wnat to be able to click on a hyperlink that tells me just where to look for the answers to each specific question and how to be sure it is correct as well as where to put it.

The software did not tell me I had 2 vehicle forms and did not tell me to delete 2 other forms I did not need. It just kept asking the same unanswerable questions over and over and this blocked me from efiling my taxes. when it checks it it does not explain how to fix it

column2: I felt like you forced me in to the most expensive option. whenever I tried to choose another option everything would disappear. I will never recommend or use again. much cheaper and less hassle with my accountant

Unhappy with State Individual LLC filing There were several times when Turbo Tax kept implying that I would also have to purchase Business - but then flipped and said no, okay for Home and Business, Unclear, and deceptive.

column1: 1st the 568 form filings were more complex than the State said I had to do for a single member. 2nd the directions by Turbo Tax were confusing and random. 3rd. If I need to file a 568 and 3522, then I expect it to be done with Turbo Tax along with the payment for it would be included in the Turbo Tax process, but you don't so now I will probably miss the deadline and have to pay a penalty because you were not clear, and not complete for a business filing. Ca FTB says I am required to e-file and you are now forcing me unexpectedly to mail. Incomplete Filing

column2: Pricey I love TurboTax and have used it since it was first released but the price continues to rise to the point that I am strongly considering a switch next year. Price goes up up up

Don't upgrade turbotax Always use only the free turbo tax. They will charge you more but offer exactly nothing additional. Free federal, pay for state and be done. The "super" packages did not decrease what I owed one penny. They are useless. charge you extra without adding any value

Charged for TurboTax MAX fees I did not like to be charged the extra $34.99 fee for Turbo Tax Premium or TurboTax MAX Fees and that both filing for state and federal were free. Money that I do not have despite it being taken out of federal return,

Really turbo? I've filled with turbo tax many times. I've never paid to itemize and couldn't get my state refunds without paying a ridiculous amount. For the price I'd have to pay I'll be better off going somewhere else and just dropping them off. Same pay and no headache of doing them myself. Don't think I'll be using turbo tax again nor would I recommend their services for others with the way things are now. Paying for what was free before.
Costly The fees are way too high for the amount I am getting from my returns. I imagine this is good for people who want to get taxes over with and don't care about money. Fees

Bait and switched Baited and switched all the wat. What was supposed to be free ended up costing $170. I had no other option as I had wasted hours with this service and was forced to file on the 18th due to a paperwork error on behalf of my employer. I travel to many states due to work and need to file in two or more usually. Each state cost $40 and my federal ( the free one?) cost $55. The rest you ask? $35 processing fee for them to take it directly from my refund!! I could have handed my paperwork to an accountant for that and not wasted all my time on this scam. My opinion, do it yourself with efile (as I have every other year) or pay an accountant to save yourself this head ache. Ended up taking hours, couldn't file until I purchased upgrade, fees started piling up.

Dear idiot software programmers, Definitely a rip-off of $50 after this experience with TurboTax and then requiring me to be on the phone almost 1.5hr with someone, so i missed the midnight deadline in FL...oh why? because I was entering my ID as reqd on mobile, then on desktop, and as I am in FL, IDs contain hyphen (do a google photo search), yet NOWHERE on mobile, or desktop does it say anything about not including hyphens or other characters if theyre a part of the number. YOU PEOPLE ARE FKG IDIOTS....1 SIMPLE " *do not include hyphens or other characters " under the box wouldve allowed me to file this on time before 12 without a phone call, etc, etc....instead....THAT was the only problem. IM FILING TAXES, EVERYTHING HAS TO BE LEGAL LONG NAME, ID, ETC ETC. Dear idiot programmers with NO common sense, how about you let a 3rd party look at the website next time you try to program BEFORE you release it? Or is user friendly not a concept youve ever heard of? ITS SIMPLE STUPID MISTAKES LIKE NOT INCL MY SUGGESTION, for example, THAT WASTES TIME, ANGERS PEOPLE, CAUSES YELLING AT PHONE REPS, AND MAKE PEOPLE NOT WANT TO USE OR RECOMMEND YOUR SERVICE AGAIN. USE SOME COMMON SENSE!!!!!!!! I for 1 will NOT be using or recommending anyone EVER use TurboTax. What a waste of $50. Ill gladly use another service, maybe even pay a little more, next year if the service/software is actually aimed at the user for quick and easy filing. That is all, thank you. Now back to your regularly scheduled programming. idiots who've never used a site to file anything w other than a CA ID before must've programmed this
screwed again Back to H&R Block next year fees added never agreed

Darn BUG! Mortgage Interest Worksheet Receiving an error message due to a known bug an hour before the deadline is not pleasing whats so ever. In fact, its definitely something that would stress anyone beyond my comfort zone and borderline heart attack. Thankfully, I quickly found the solution to the bug on the web and was only on hold with customer support for 10-15 minutes. INTUIT: if you know you have a bug, FIX IT! Darn BUG 1 hour before the deadline.
Cost Too Much!! Costs too much and there are other companies out there to file with....that are a lot cheaper to use and just as good.

column1: Just due to the fact that I have a Trust account, I have to now purchase the Premium Turbo Tax, ,and in 2013 I only had to get the Deluxe package!!!! Costs too much and there are other companies out there toi file with....that are a lot cheaper to use and just as good.

column2: Nice Refund Worksheet questions were not detailed and often confusing. Can't go back to previous page when running smart check.
missimg i could not fine the start where i left off option its very helpfully went you have to stop and start often

Generally Unhappy I am disappointed by how it seems every few pages you are asked to upgrade the program you use. Why the federal filing is free but state filing costs money I don't know, but I don't believe I saw anything about a price for such until about the end of the program. I understand as a business you need to make money, but I wish TurboTax was more upfront and were to present a modest fee in the beginning instead of playing up "the free and easy" image as they do. Took too long, Unhappy with upselling

Losing your touch The IRS letter i received said i could still file electronically and that you would offer place to input my indentity protection personal ID number. The place you offered only accepts a 5 digit number and the PIN the IRS provided me was a 6 digit PIN. I was vicitm of tax id theft last year, i suspect thanks to Intuit who got hacked but you didnt pay courteousy of emailing to tell me that. the IRS pin you prompt me to enter is 5 digits and the IRS gave me a 6 digit pin

Not Good to Use this year! I will not use this method again. It would cost me less to just purchase my own software. The State is included and your not forced to accept or refuse MAX product. Plus it isn't worth going through my CU for the free usage of Turbo Tax, because it went up if I wanted to itemize. Took way too long and forcing additional fees.

Easy to use, way to expensive! Been using this product for years, only because I feel it will ne a hassle to switch to a cheaper product. After paying $144 this year, I will deal with the hassle next year and will look at cheaper alternatives, including doing it manually. Price keeps increasing, much to expensive

fees I am not very happy that when we returned to turbo tax, there was a new $30 fee just for keeping the old personal info. Then, got to the end and it was going to charge an additional $35 for holding payment out of federal return. This would have been $95 total on a $239 return. We have sent several people to this site and helped them with doing their taxes on turbo tax, but with these fees, may be cheaper to just take them to h and r block.

I could not change my banking information from last year's tax return no help to get one 800 number poor way to contacting turbo Tax. When there's something important as banking information I personal would like to be able to have some type of way to speak to a person to assist me!!! Very upset no help an had too pay for poor services!!!!!!!!
generally effective step by step overview of segments:

column1: most steps do not offer "back buttons" in the federal tax and deductions section... which i recommend they change
would prefer a main page menu with all sections itemized, ie:
state taxes, federal taxes, 1099, deductibles, etc
there is an existing front face menu, but i would like one with a more minimal lay out of buttons opposed to having to search through the spyglass bullion search for more simple menus.
other wise happy with my first time on Turbo Tax

column2: There should be an easy way to NOT depreciate a car used only 10% for business, especially when several illnesses including two hospitalizations.

column1: You way of doing the Schedule C is confusing. Still not sure my 1099-Misc included.
Why do I have to re-enter Pros and Cons when already wrote that the first time?

column2: Don't Look Back I found Turbo tax unnecessarily difficult and confusing to make changes to data once entered. The state tax exemption area (including major purchases) and the college expenses area were difficult to return to. Also the page showing an overview of income included college fund payments under "other income" even though these weren't computed into my taxable income, and so presented a confusing picture of my income in review.

column1: On the other hand, the overview of my tax form under the "Tools" tab was clear and useful and cleared up the questions I had about how amounts I was entering computed to taxable income and credits. Very convoluted and mystifying to correct or make changes to data once entered

column2: too expensive / hidden costs Even if you made next to nothing, if you have 1099 forms they make you upgrade. Further, if you would like to deduct office expenses you have to upgrade even more. The product should be income based, or have some consideration of this factor. Won't be using it next year... lots of hidden expenses
Good Software - Horrible Customer Treatment  Company baits and switches you, leading to more than double the cost.

Windows 10 NO HELP Each year the Home & Business gets better. Known what can be deducted and where to put the deductions can be hard for a small business owner. But this year, TurboTax was working at a disadvantage in that Windows 10 decided to do an upgrade in the middle of tax season that slowed down the way that TT worked and the overall ease of working with TT. Every time I had a new calculation, or went to the next page, I had to retrieve TT from the task icon because the Windows 10 Desktop came up! I also ran into a section where if there had been math in the example it would have helped figured out what the IRS was asking for. This about the FMV Before and After the event of Theft or Destruction, was not clear if FMV at time after destruction or at time of replacement after destruction. Some of the examples needs to have math in them to better illustrate the results wanted.

Never Again! I've used Turbo Tax for years and this will be the absolute LAST time I will ever use TurboTax again! I've never had to pay almost $100 for a simple tax return. Our taxes have never been complicated. They were always as simple as type in the information and hit send. Never had to calculate anything to figure anything out. If I wanted to spend this amount of money I would go to a professional and not have to worry about doing them myself. Its supposed to be cheaper to do them yourself, not cost you more! I will NOT be using TurboTax again and will for now on having a professional do them because it would only cost me half of what TurboTax is costing me! Costed me more than using a professional

This was the worst tax filing i ever experienced in my entire life. Not only did it take over an hour it was difficult to even retrieve my information from last year. Then on top of that you slap an outrageous charge of $124.97! I'm a hard working single parent who raised two children and is struggling to pay my mortgage and all other bills and you want to charge me $124.97. I will recommend your service to no one. I will also bad mouth your service and tell everyone I know how you ripped me off charging me two different charges of 49.99 and 39.99 and in the end it totaled to 124.97. Rip offs are what you are. I could have went to a private person and paid less. Never again will I file with Turbo Tax and I know a lot of people who I work with, family, friends and social media friends and associates who I will spread the word about Turbo Tax. It won't be a positive review I share either.

Not happy Poor poor poor, hidden fees, difficult to correct, not easy to use. Was supposed to be free for Federal and it would have been nice to have warnings that state would have been extra with extra fees tacked on. I am a widow, I do not think i was given all the breaks I should of had. It was very difficult to file social security for my children. I will NOT recommended this to anyone. Didn't like having to restart it, and the sudden extra fees at the end .
u-name it diff. to change type of filing (free, max, and audit)......loops back. pushing for higher cost file on a low rate return. op to change to lower rate file

Pay or no guarantee of best refund It should be free and easy to pull up previous years tax info. I also did not like how it kept asking me to upgrade; no I don't want to give you an extra $30, yes I'm sure! I'm being when I click to submit this survey it will ask me again if I'd like to upgrade! Lol Kept asking for more money

Payment Customer Service I have used Turbo Tax in the past, however this year I owed. I tried to make the payment through Turbo Tax and had an issue with it transmitting. I called the 800 number Turbo Tax asked me to call. The guy on the phone was so rude that he alone will make me seriously think twice about ever using Turbo Tax again. Payment Center
2015 rant I have used you for a number of years and my frustration this year was close to causing me to drop you. Give not place where ndgitive number can be entered

Very Useful Software but Payment seems Underhanded I find it very helpful to be able to use the TurboTax software and think it does an excellent job guiding through the tax return process and explaining some of the more difficult elements.

column1: My only complaint (and it's a rather big one) is that it's very unclear when different payment packages are selected and if an option is chosen it's apparently impossible to change it. I thought I'd be paying the the $39.99 to file a State return (which would have been money well spent and I'd be happy to do it), but somehow I ended up signed up for a "Deluxe Package" and a "Premium Package" on top of this with a total that ended up costing over $120. I couldn't figure out how to go back and change it, so my options were to either bite the bullet and pay, or start filing all over again by some other means. I bit the bullet this year, but I may try another tax program next year to see if they are more transparent with how they charge. Very difficult (to the point of being sneaky) to figure out what or when I am paying for something until it's too late

column2: Dead end questions, some questionss not feasible
State I didn't like how it charged me 29.99. State cost $29.99
not confident in the process or end result of refund

End of 25 years of using Turbo Tax After over 25 years of using Turbo Tax, I'm going with a different option next year. It's too late for me this year as I already paid in order to file. The forced upgrade to Deluxe at the end for having a measly foreign tax credit is tricky. I was then hoping to offset that cost with the 10% Amazon gift card bonus which I received last year, which wasn't there nor were any bonuses. Other tax filing companies offer bonuses which I will take advantage of next year and recommend others to do the same. I apologize to everyone I recommended TurboTax to this year for the Amazon 10% gift card bonus which you aren't aware is missing until after you pay. I did an internet search on this and I'm definitely not alone. Tricky upgrade to Deluxe and zero benefits

Costs and Benefits Not Very Well Explained I've been using TurboTax for years, but every year I get less and less pleased with the upselling. I get they have to make money, especially when they allow users to file for free if they fill out everything themselves. I started a business last year and made no income from it last year, but they made it seem like I should most definitely buy their premium business package, regardless of how little I would need to fill out if I did it myself. I was convinced, but regretted it. Of course they then make it too much effort to start over from scratch, so I went with it. Then they hid the $35 upcharge for having their fees deducted from my return within an ad for yet another upcharge that I could add if I wanted to. I didn't notice until right before I clicked to submit. I ended up paying with my credit card to avoid that exorbitant fee for simply taking my money at a very small convenience. Doesn't make it easy to understand what you're paying for

Not so happy I went through the return, then the software recommended I upgrade for maximum refund. Since you are not obligated to pay prior to filing, I tried it. The upgrade did nothing for me. I tried to go back to the original version of the software that I used, but I could not unless I deleted EVERYTHING and started over. So overall, I lost an additional $100 by trying the "recommended" software. Upgrade didn't help and I actually lost money

Dissappointed TurboTax should charge a percentage of the return and not a flat amount by forcing customers to sign up for benefits which they do not want. Being charged more than $60 minumum to file when your refund is only $81 seems unfair and somewhat like a scam. Charged me much more to file than what I'm getting in my return:

Beware, It is not all free Advertised to be free from IRS website but it is actually not. $104 charge. You should goto a tax preparer and save you some time and stress to figure Turbo tax It was advertised to be free but was not

extra cost adds up apparently ≤100 of capital gains put me in a higher tax bracket, requiring me to upgrade to a more costly version of Turbotax, (for one extra form) and added $380 to my taxes. the K-1 I received did not match the TT format, so for a nominal loss, I spent more money and time than it was worth. Although TT is not all to blame, it would be nice if the extra costs were prorated by the number of additional forms required and if the tax increase was explained by a chart, rather than just providing an amount. Obviously, it can be checked at the IRS site, but it would be nice if it was referenced within the software. K-1 confusion

Not impressed I have used TurboTax for years and always recommended it to my friends. Now it is cheaper for me to use an accountant. I am not sure why I would ever use this service again. I don't think your software costs went up that much this year. The price was way tooooooo HIGH this year. What is up with that?
Reviewing section for errors that needed to be fixed revealed no context or detail of where the errors came from or what they where referring to.

column1: Had to waste time skipping past hidden offers like a Mint IRA and hidden fees like 39.95 just to use my refund to help cover the state file!!!! That's awful and you know it.

column2: more complicated and more expensive online it showed discounted rates, but when I was finished it charged me more than regular price. I had to fix my returns several times because information was going all over the place, often counted twice. Other places I just couldn't edit anything and it wouldn't let me proceed. frustrated instructions, cost more than a box

No E-filing of Extension in TurboTax I have a love/hate relationship with Turbo Tax. Each year I have greater difficulty in finding the actual place data was entered when I find I need to make changes. It also seems to force you to revisit a lot of questions that were previously answered, as the only way to get to a place to make a change. No E-filing of Extension in TurboTax; it seems to have less helpful information in the "Help" function each year

NEVER purchase TurboTx again after yrs of loyalty I cannot recall the last time I have been this upset filing taxes!! WHAT happened to TurboTax, the program we faithfully purchased through our USAA acct, year after year? New management??

column1: Something drastic and incredibly negative has taken place!

Not to mention the disappointment I am experiencing in a product I have trusted for so long but in the poor performance as well! Horrible experience ....this will take sometime to recover from, my blood pressure is soaring I'm sure! and additionally....the product I initially signed on for, changed when it came time to pay (magically more expensive) AND would NOT ALLOW me to go back and fix the unauthorized so called "upgrade" the program changed on its own!!

Nothing (without exaggeration) NOTHING on this program went smoothly....I should have stopped, DUMPED TurboTax and moved on....what a mess!!! Finally, adding insult to extreme injury....the dang thing simply WOULD not allow me to find a route around using my credit card to pay for the program, why NOT! I paid my nearly $8000. tax debt from my checking acct....SO why did the program insist on making me pay the $64.99 on my credit card! You folks need to sit back in the coming months and get your act together before everyone flocks to other means of tax prep!
I'll be shaking my head for quite some time on just exactly what happened to cause such a fine respectable company to go sour.....more like ROTTEN!!!
thanks for letting me vent.....Col. Patrick Roman Too many Cons and too upset w/TurboTax to add here

column2: Turbo Tax Premier 2015 Issues Been using Turbo Tax for years and have not been as frustrated as this year. Always an issue is the number of questions that are never answered. Would be nice to have a subject forum like "Turbo Tax 2015" where there is one place to look for problems etc. Now I have to submit questions or a string of words and hope that some of the questions and answers found relate to what I was asking. Secondly, why does TT ask me to input my bank information when it obviously has it already? And why wouldn't TT accept 04/18/2016 as a valid submission date? I had to put in 4/15 to get my taxes e filed. I hope that it goes through.

column1: Also on the interview for Rental property: there is a question asked about when you acquired a rental property. Then when TT reviews your information, the date pops up as when the property went into service. Those can be two very different dates.

Also, it seems to me that the printing of your tax returns are all the same option (you get everything) no matter what you choose in the drop down menu. The Health Entry Sheet also besides the entry problem, also puts in everything on the bottom (name, SSN etc) that the form says NOT to put down there. Annoying errors, Questions not always answered

column2: TurboTax Review Normally the help is really good, but this time was much more difficult. My questions were not answered and I don't feel comfortable with my filing for state tax. Not enough assistance like last year. Changed in getting help. It is not as available this year and I am not comfortable

Blew it again -- one-word names are legal TurboTax and IRS still cannot get together when a filer has a single name (no last name). Software has yet to be fixed. After I e-file, IRS rejects with NO LAST NAME. If I switch my name to be the last name, then it's rejected by the IRS because of NO FIRST NAME. Somebody in this chain-of-responsibility must have a bulb burned out, and nobody seems to care, because this happens every year. I always end up having to print and mail my return.

column1: Regards-
Hrothgar (one-word name) Rejected by IRS for third year in a row

column2: Demand Prefilled Tax Forms Now! Demand that Congress provide prefilled tax forms now! Intuit and others in the tax industry make massive amounts of money due to the confusion and obscurity of US tax forms and tax law. They also lobby congress to maintain that confusion and profit from it. People should demand prefilled tax forms to simplify the process of paying taxes and remove the stress from the the annual mid-April deadline. none

Health care blip almost cost me 1000s I was experimenting with changing my dependents to see which would give me and my ex the best tax write off...WARNING. You MUST skip to the health care section and re answer the questions which changing dependents or it can cost you 1000's due to ObamaCare penalty. Should have a pop up when you change dependent to re-visit healthcare section which is in a completely different place. Need to have warning about heath care penalty

Not as advertised I filed using TurboTax last year, it was completely free. I tried it again this year and got all the way to the end and had to pay $29.99 to file. Real nice TurboTax, I will not be using this again to file. Wasn't free

Big Con Game When Filing wth State While Turbo Tax makes my own tax filing easier, I think it is a big rip off when I file my college student's taxes. Since she goes to Princeton in NJ, I have to pay close to $50 extra to do her state taxes. Then I am charged $28 more dollars to e-file them to NJ. It really is expensive and a ripoff. Ended up paying about $75 extra to file my daughter's NJ taxes.

Good product, but too expensive now. I have used TurboTax for over 10 years. However, next year I intend to use another online tax service due to cost. I had to use the $79.99 service this year because I had a meager earning from a partnership. I could have saved half (or more) using another of the many services available. My return just is not complex enough to justify paying that much for online filing. Sorry, but you've lost yet another (previously) loyal customer. Fees have increased to beyond justification for my purposes.
Misleading price always Very bad way to handle the pricing of the products. never know how much you be charged!

Easy to Use - Pricey to Choose! TurboTax, as always, is very easy to navigate, provides plenty of helpful information and suggestions on lowering your tax burden. I wasn't happy with the increase in pricing this year. I paid over $90 to file my taxes and could have done it for less than $40 elsewhere. The premium price just isn't worth it.

column1: Goodbye, TurboTax. It's been good knowing you! Pricey.

column2: Turbo Tax Online is not Great I've used Turbo Tax CDs for years but used the online version for the fist time this year. ONLY because I could not buy and download the business version from the website.

column1: It was easy enough to use, very similar to the CD version, but you can not do multiple returns. Also navigating the website itself is not intuitive. Can't do multiple returns

column2: Hidden Fees Turbotax takes every opportunity to nickel and dime its customers. I will never use it again. Cost $130 to do my taxes for "free"

changed a lot this year I have used turbo tax for the last 10 years and always felt good and confident about it. This year much less. It did not explain many of the terms I did not understand in their context such as "at risk" Also I had trouble this year with information from last year not carried forward such as closing inventory last year and ending mileage from last year. Overall it was just not the easy fill form it used to be. Seemed very confusing this year

What a waste of my time i will never ever, ever use this service again. Importing was/is a joke. I went from a refund to a serious I OWE THEM. Deleted imported data....reinputted data. Deleted it 2 more times and still had a mess. Worked with a tech and they didn't know what to do. Wanted to e-file couldn't. Had to go buy a new printer cartridge. Then had to pay to have all my investment docs, tax docs, etc. copied at 10 pm. My husband is out trying to find a place to copy everything and get it to the post office by the deadline......NEVER AGAIN!!!!!! Importing investment data what a joke.

Illegal charges I liked everything about TurboTax except for the ending it asked me if I wanted to have the Max added to in case of an audit I said no thanks it was added anyway. Not Cool! The added charge at the end! That I didn't ask for
TurboTax was more expensive than my Refund $85 tax return. TurboTax was more expensive. $85 would have been nice. TurboTax took my whole refund, and I paid more to have it done.

THIS ISN'T FREE! I went through this FREE filing and then was told I would have to pay $35.99 for Deluxe because I had one extra form. I ended up having to pay $94.89 I have no idea why. I didn't add on any extras! I just went from FREE to $100. Last time I use Turbo Tax. If you have anything out of the norm you have to pay. ALSO seperate fees for state and federal.

Taxes I guess TurboTax is as good as any other online tax service out there, but something about paying in order to pay the government money seems absurd. Shouldn't it be a government function to record this kind of information? Seems like a lot of unnecessary clicking

Unhappy I am going to be calling in what I'm assuming are business hours and asking for my $34.99 back . This was a simple return and I don't need any audit protection.....The Don't Agree brought me to the screen where I unchecked this $34.99 and yet when push came to shove it was still there. In order to file on time I went ahead but this is a scam part of what I have believed for years was a reputable company. Continually, and I mean REPEATEDLY removed the $34.99 option from the bill and yet in order to file the taxes on time..

I enjoy the simple questions, explanations of the sections, and that the software does the calculations. I've used the product for many years but the ease of the interface and intuitive navigation that I've learned to expect in the product took a step back this year from previous versions. For example, it was frustrating when I needed to reprint a form to be sent in that all of the documents had the Preview Only watermark with no option to remove it. I had to search for a workaround so I could print my own document; I ended up having to reopen a new state filing. It had to be anticipated that users would have to go back and reprint these documents, why wasn't there an option to turn this watermark off or on? I also did not like having to go through all of the questions of a section if I only needed to go back and update 1 item. Once a section is complete, the user should be able to select which item they want to update within a section. I was also not able to download my information entered into turbotax from last year, apparently because I had used a CD version previously and saved my information to my PC and not online like this year. This was easy enough to retype, but was annoying. I'll use the product again next year as I still think it is the best there is on the market, but I hope the software takes positive steps forward with the interface and navigation with the 2016 tax version. 2015 version lost past software interface and intuitive navigation ease

A step in the wrong direction I have been using TurboTax since 2009 and had always had a great experience until this year. To begin with it took longer to install and I was having issues with MAC OSX, it prefers Yosemite +. While I know I need to upgrade to Yosemite, I would have expected TT to still work well with older OS versions, especially considering that those of us who have used software for many years have older electronic returns somewhere on our hard drives that we may need to access, and you would think someone thought about that. Once I was able to install and I worked on my taxes I encountered a major and severe delay when trying to enter the information for my healthcare plan which is a new requirement under the Affordable Care Act. I tried to restart and did not work, I found a note on the TT website that suggested to restart, but first erase all turbotax/Intuit content from Cache on the browser and that seemed to work. At least after doing that I was able to enter the information from my 1095 form, however it froze again after I entered info and as I tried to go to next step. It did save the information, but I had to go through same process of cleaning the Cache and restarting laptop since I wanted to make sure all I entered was saved. The weird thing is that while it seemed to hang on the health insurance information tab, the software could still work on the other areas such as deductions, income etc. My last beef was with processing a NOLA on my return, this was a first for me, and while TT does allow you to do this, it does not have a lot of information on the implications of NOLAs, which is important since you only have one opportunity to make a decision to carry-back or carry-forward a NOLA. This was one time where professional help would have probably been best. I am not sure if I will use TT again next year. It had been great in the past, but we shall see in the future. Encountered some bugs, especially in the healthcare information area. The program got stuck in processing this area.
Taxes in a crunch  Too many fees

Less user friendly that last year's version This year, the TurboTax user interface seemed to less logically follow the standard method of reviewing and editing topics in an orderly fashion. Once in a topic, the path(s) taken by the software could be different depending on how you entered the topic and whether you had been there previously. Once filled out, it was difficult to navigate back and forth if something needed to be modified. It would help the user greatly to have a pictorial of the summary values in each topic that are editable, rather than having a single number and forcing the user to click through menu after menu to try and find the info needed. Some of the forms ask questions that were already filled out, but don't show what was previously entered and prompt the user to fill out again. It is too easy to enter something different the next time. And if the user has to do the return offline to keep track of what is entered, maybe it's just as easy to keep track of it in another software program.

column1: One of the best things about the TurboTax software is probably something that could be said for many of the tax packages that are used year after year - the ability of the software to remember the returns of last year, pull up recently used forms to be used again, and use previously entered personal information, saving significant time filling out the more mundane forms.

Deleting forms from the previous year that will not be used can be a challenge. The forms are automatically created, but if they won't be used, the user must know and actively search out and delete. Fortunately, instructions for this were contained in the help section.

Anything that causes a problem with the forms, and are out of the menu for filling the forms will cause the program to hang-up and not allow the return to be filed electronically. Although I understand that this needs to be this way for the appropriate submission of returns to eliminate errors, it leaves very little to no flexibility for filling out the forms. One common example is if the EIN of a dependent care provider is unknown, immediately, the form is unable to be electronically submitted. This can be very frustrating. Have to overtly delete forms carried over from previous years. More difficult to navigate than in previous years.

column2: Quick and somewhat easy Return was going well until the end where I see I was charged $94 after expecting around $40-45. This was unexpected and clearly structured this way so people simply click and 'whatever' I'm in too deep now...and TurboTax gets extra fees. Really too bad because I've been a customer since 2007 and fully trusted them until this return. I will be looking for an alternative site to file next year. Hidden fees, intentionally misleading pricing.
Expensive Expensive, Expensive, had to pay for both federal and state

Never sure I paid 6x this year what I paid last year. But my year was pretty much the same. What changed? Did I enter something wrong? It would have been nice to see why the difference. Plus it costs too much to e-file the state return. Cut it in half and I would be so much happier. I'm just never sure I'm getting everything right. Getting the best deal

To be honest, as you have asked, I don't think that it is fair that I was due only $26.00 from state and I was charged $29.99 to file my taxes with VA. This is crazy, it seems that if you have to charge a fee, that it would be parameters with this , example if you made less than ...there would be no fee. I am filing my taxes for the first time, and this is very disappointing for me as I an technically in the hole for my tax refund. As an example above this review where it says rocked my refund, my refund feels ripped, ,no rocking here...feel sad.

Lawsuit comin down the rail! The latest turbotax system is EXTREMELY REDUNDANT and the Software is faulty. this is the third year turbotax made me change my password after ive put in the same password every year. WAY TOO MANY useless pages, you guys gotta dial down asking the same exact questions endlessly and them reviewing endlessly. out of 106 pages there was to click through (carpel tunnel, thanx alot) only 16 of them was where any real filing was done, in the end it hurts your company the worst because of all the useless data flow turbotax should have to spend funding on. the login stage is bugged, tell the source file programmers they still didnt fix last years problem, or the year before that (mind you, i did all 3 years' taxes on 3 different computers, thats why i couldnt use turbotax last year.

Make sense? if not, ask and I'll explain fluently, just call, and ill wave the lawsuit. id type in my number but you guys already have it 30 times over, so FIGURE IT OUT!!!! and dont have a helpless intern make a sympathy call, i wont drink it, i want the call from man in charge (if there even is one behind this). otherwise, ill hand you over to my attorney, he understands and RESPECTS efficiency very well.

Stop listening to focus groups and listen to Your People. call me, you got the number Too many reviews, too many pages of the same questions, not quick like Advertisin FALSELY suggests, oh just read below

column2: Surprise fee The Green Dot Bank "Processing Fee" at the end was an unpleasant surprise. Enough that I won't use Turbo again. For about the same $$ of that fee and the state filing fee I could have gone to H&R Block.

column1: 'Free Federal' my hind end. Added fee

column2: For the price of Turbo I could've just gone to H&R I paid the initial purchase fee of $45, then midway through they charged me another $45 for state filing, then at the end they charged me $25 for e-filing. Had I known it would've been this expensive I would've just gone to a tax professional and let them do all the work for the same price... hidden fees

It will get you through It is pretty simple to use. But all tax prep services this year lack any good guidance on the Health Insurance part. Nothing seems to want to show a simple FAQ for this. Keeps requesting you to upgrade to a paid service. Doesn't answer questions beyond basic.

column2: Pretty Easy Overall pretty easy. Better than paying outrageous Tax Preparer costs, Although, when TT says 1 FREE State Return they only mean filling out form, you still have to pay 24.99 for filing, which is bogus. Figuring out proper categories for business expenses is sometimes a challenge, even though they have helpful hints, and finding your way back to detailed Business Expense list can be frustrating due to vague category headings.

column1: Also, when trying to contact TT consultants I had success 1 out of 4 tries. Sent an email and got a response in 30 minutes

but could not login in to send a second message. Called the 800 number twice, waiting approx. 50 minutes but was disconnected both times on TT end. Arrrrgh! Pathways back to Business expenses confusing. Tax Help lacking

oh my I am upset over the lack of up-frontness of the cost. I paid a Pro to do both of my returns two years ago for $100. This year it was about $140. I think doing it online should be considerably cheaper, not more expensive, and yes, my filing is not more detailed or complicated, it is the same as that year.

column1: Last year I used a different online service and it was much cheaper. If I can remember, I will use them again next year. However, I will say TurboTax's information in helping you decide what to choose in certain instances was quite helpful. Very expensive

column2: Once again, extra charges This is the second year in a row the promised free state return turned into an extra charge. Very frustrating to say the least. I would have been done at least 5 minutes early otherwise. Each year when it says I get a sate return for free it doesn't happen! I pay extra!!

Also, the fee to file a state return is higher than the other free online program I used. I would re-consider using TurboTax next year because of this. Fees

problems Not happy with the last minute stress I just went through The webpage locked and would not let me continue where I left off 15 minutes before it was due.

I will think long and hard before I use Turbo Tax again next year. It's just getting too expensive when there are other packages available. column1: TERRIBLE CHOICE GUYS. PUT IT BACK REMOVED FORMS VIEW FROM ONLINE VERSION

column2: Hidden charge in "Free Federal Tax Return", Fraud I was charged $29.99 ($31.97 with tax) for service that I didn't select while processing "Free Federal Tax Return". The $29.99 was never shown anywhere and never confirmed before making payment, it was charged while I was placing my payment information for tax return. This is extremely unprofessional and sneaky way of charging hidden fees by TurboTax. I talked to the customer care for refund but she refused to give any solution and hung up. To sum up, before Turbotax charges its customers, it needs to show clearly what are the charges/fees then proceed with payment confirmation; not the other way around. Turbotax is a FRAUD! Hidden fees, poor customer care, Fraud business practice

. Tried to persuade me to pay for an extra state return I don't need.

column1: However I have a number of concerns:
1) Turbo Tax for Mac does not allow importing data from Quickbooks for Mac. It would make things easier. There is definitely a bias against Mac.

2) Turbo Tax does not take into account where one divorced parent is deducting the children but the children are on the other parent's health insurance. The worksheets keep showing the kids on my insurance.
3) Also, it does not take into account married but filing separately and the health insurance. Needs to take into account divorced parents

column2: sorry i used this This is the second time I filed with you and those tabs that cost money like upgrades seem to add anyway when I clicked on the tab that said do not add.

column1: I only used the program because I don't know anything about doing taxes and it said that it walks you through it but I feel like it walked me into a brick wall. suggested tabs cost money

column2: Not as good as it was I guess I've been spoiled by the old help system because this version was the least helpful version I've used in years. Not helpful like it used to be.
