Slippery Slope Sure, Turbo Tax works. I've used it for the last couple of years because my info was already set up and convenient. Not this year, now there's this b.s. "Plus" service - for a fee, to keep my info and expedite the filing process. Hopefully this will be the last year I need to use Turbo Tax. b.s. "Plus" services option to save your info - for extra $$, charging fees for direct deposit

How the he** are you going to make me sign on 4/18/16 and in the end say that I filed my taxes on 4/19/16 at 12:14am after taking my money. If I get hit with fees, I will make sure you pay them. Don't you dare cheat me.

Last minute surprise I paid for deluxe service due to my tax needs. Your software told me it had thoroughly checked my information and found NO mistakes or issues. I made my decision to upgrade and continue based on THAT. Then, after I had already paid the upgrade fee and entered all my bank information - it ran a second final check and amazingly found a mistake that completely changed the picture. Seriously? Talk about bait and switch! Shame on you. What the heck was the first "final" check for??? That was misrepresentation saying that you had checked for mistakes and everything looked good - "you're ready to file". BS. I want a refund of the upgrade fee. Found a state tax mistake AFTER final check???
extremely displeased I tried several times to pay for Audit Defense Service, but the system would never take any of my cards.

column1: I finally cancelled that order in order to do my efile.
I would REALLY like to have the defense, but your system simply sucked. could not pay for audit defense.

column2: Expensive to file I'm use to this partner and still would use, because I trust the source, but many of my friends would prefer to use a CPA for the value. tripled in cost from a couple of years ago

Thanks again - miss expert views I've been using your tool for years - i wish there was an expert menu that showed (e.g. on the left side) with an outlined list of pages/items & status with the ability to navigate directly to a specific screen for a type of item or a specific item in that list ... having to figure out where something "is likely" to be then navigating through several screens to get to it is frustrating and OK only for novices. If that option is already available, pls let me know - it wasn't obvious to me. At times had to redo or check items, not always clear where to go

What a piece of junk! Where do I even begin? This is the worst experience I have ever had with tax software. The health care section didn't work AT ALL. I essentially had to file an inaccurate return which I will have to go back and file amended later when I get my ACA exemption number. Two years to prepare for this and someone posted this exact problem to the help center four months ago and it still isn't fixed. The program insisted on including a schedule C with my return even though I didn't need it. It took forever to figure out how to print file my state return. (I'm guessing Intuit REALLY want that $24.95 fee!) And when I tried to print it, it kept telling me there were errors in my return after it cleared me to file through e-file! Is this a glitch? Am I going to get audited? Or is this another trick to get you go pay the fee to e-file? Honestly for $45 the state e-file should be free. What a rip off. If I don't get a phone call from someone offering to fix this, I won't be using this software again. Ugh. Program contains MANY errors

Great tool, but tricky state tax filing process I wish they could be honest upfront and let you know that they will try to force you into buying their services when filing state taxes. I understand they are providing a free service to file federal, but honesty regarding the payment for state taxes would be nice. This would prevent the person from wasting time filling information for state taxes to later find out you need to pay to file state taxes. I don't appreciate this at all. Next year, I will look for an alternative solution to file State and Federal taxes. Tricky filing process for state taxes

Not so Sure! I've used Turbo Tax for many years, but the past few years by level of confidence has really decreased. I no longer feel that I am getting the best refund and I always worry that something is wrong. There have been several simple mistakes in the software the last couple of years. If I can spot them why can't your SQA group detect them? lack of confidence in calculations and if I am getting the best refund possible.

Ehhh. Brother said use turbo tax, but honestly its not so great. You say everywhere you can import last years taxes from other software or a PDF, but it never asks. After two hours trying to get it to ask and trying every menu I could find, nothing, So I had to enter every last bit of it again. Had I stayed with Tax act, I would have been half done in those two hours.

column1: Also, you never show the forms.So when you ask questions with odd references, (and i am a person who has done taxes for years) and I can't see what form and line its referring to, its useless. You guarantee no mistakes, but thats bogus. If I answer no to a question that you don't clarify or explain, then you just blame me. After all I said no, right? So.....
Lastly, you charge alot of money for all that. And my return isn't any higher through you guys that others.
So again, not impressed. especially considering the $120 price compared to $35.
Thats my input.
Oh yeah, your printing app failed so now my return is late.

column2: Highway Robbery! I am very unsettled to discover unpleasant changes to this year's edition. After declining the ridiculous add-ons multiple times (No means NO!) they somehow sneak on ALL of their add-on services at the end? If I had the ability to file on time this year, I'd have just hit the cancel button and filed by paper. Thanks for nothing Intuit. I will NOT be giving your company any money next year, and would NEVER recommend this software to anyone who can handle a paper tax return. Sweet Jesus this is a joke now. Hidden Fees you can't de-select
Forced to Delux over my address They find one reason or another to FORCE you to upgrade to Delux to have to pay to use their service when it is offered for free file on EZ.

column1: This year I have moved to another state and the FORCE had to do with BOGUS Reasons about my address being a community property address which is totally BOGUS. WTFO!
Just more BS to make you pay for BS that they don't want to give away when they advertise it to be FREE... Force or fool you in to requiring to pay for services when it is suppose to be free

column2: Slipping from previous years I've used turbotax since 2002 and I think this is my last year. To start I had to pay to access my prior year return; which I needed because it was incomplete. Second, The explanations on any given page are much shorter than they used to be and don't point you to any particular reg or code section. In many cases hand calculations were needed when in years past they would've been auto calculations. Finally and most importantly I can't see whats happening with forms until Im ready to file. I did a whole lot of work that I had to change because it showed up on the form wrong. no access to forms, locks you out of prior year return files without paying extra, minimal explanations, some hand calc
State taxes should be able to be deducted from total refund. Rather than bank account or check.

Long time user I love the ease of the program but prices have went up way to much, price to download then pay to send for federal and state, school tax info never comes up on screen to alert what is going on, have to print to get. I could have taken this and had it done somewhere cheaper than I paid for this , this year. No incentive to continue Price gone up to much, first have to purchase to download then pay to send both federal and state, addition of to many o
DouglasKF  Too Expensive
Extra mile I loved the ease of the program and the quickness in which it took to get done. The downside is the hidden fees. After they help you out they rob you....smh The hidden fees
Please add menu feature For example, I skipped over my car registration fee because initially I couldn't find it.

column1: When I did find it, I couldn't find where to enter that information in.

I went to "search" but of course that only loads up information about it. It doesn't point me to "where" in my return I could enter the info. I kind of had to start from the beginning all over again and a billion clicks later, I found it. Couldn't find spots within return easily

column2: Increasingly Disapoointed I have used TurboTax for MANY years now and I am sad to say that this will most likely be the last. The price is just too high. I understand that in this country, everything gets higher but TurboTax has priced themselves out of the market. I admit, I haven't done extensive research on other options but the small amount of research I have done has turned up some cheaper options that I will be exploring next year. Expensive

Got the Job done, but Glitchy upon final purchase I've been using TurboTax for a few years. It is usually a helpful software. The last two years I had issue finalizing my e-file payment and had to wait 2 hours on the phone to resolve the issue. When I finally got to the final page, I kept getting an error for a form I never filled out (that was unnecessary for me). I like the software, but intuit has some serious bugs to fix. Would not Accept Credit Payment unless over phone, glitchy added forms

1st timer self employed havnt a clue if i got all the deductions i could and not knowing exactly what little extra deduction can be had and no suggestions of what to look for. the cost to use turbotax was more than half of what i paid last year so guess what ill be doing next year based on how much time i spent filling in the info. if i had only a couple w-2 and some interest earned with a family do i see it being worth the time. if your self employed youll pay for additional forms needed just like the pros charge which means youll make more money going to work for a couple hours and paying an accountant to fill in your info. youll have to cut your cost for me to use it again. ill look at the other software and compare next year. would like more detailed explanations based on my specific situation. nickled and dimed. cut to the cost. FREE is BS

Convenient but pricey. I think the interface was friendly and it was simple enough that I could have breezed through the whole process, had I not spent so much time trying to figure out if I was paying for the right "type" of turbo tax or not. As a part time student and cooperative worker my income isn't great so it's expected that I was a little shocked to see about a fifth of my refund go straight to y'all at turbotax. I think when I filed last year it was free or at least federal was free and I went to another site to file my state. Either way It was a huge disappointment to get charged 130 dollars american just so i could pay my taxes. But i was desperate and I'll still get money back so I guess I shouldn't complain. Next year maybe I'll find something better

Tax Prep review I liked the one-click resources, the emailed / chat questions-answers, and the continual encouraging text at every step. But when rental property income and expenses came up, Premiere had a tough time allowing me to split the property 50-50 and still handle an errant W-2 that my manager provided us. On-Line Prem version didn't handle split rental property income very well

Not as helpful as I thought For instance on the donations, it wasn't clear looking at the screen that I actually had to go into the section that said add. I kept hitting continue and couldn't figure out why the deductions were not adding up. Some instructions were vague
TurboTax Deluxe Too Expensive Too Expensive

Frustrated! I have used TurboTax for over 15 years and loved it! But this year was a disappointment. I had to restart my computer several times and delete my cookies at one point to get the software to cooperate. I'm not sure if I will be using TurboTax again next year. Didn't save some of my info. Had to clear my tax return and start over.
i am disappointed that i was not prompted of a charge that i would incur upon clicking an item to search more.
Misleading Throughout the process i was lead to believe that my tax return would be free until i finished and was brought to the payment page Price

Too Much This definitely costs way too much money to even file your taxes. What's the point in saying you get the most back guaranteed if you're just going to rip ppl off by making them pay so much in the end? Total bull.. Not using this again
Just under the wire  Multiple times the same question is asked

Hidden fees? i barely am getting a refund and TT is taking quite a bit of it lol. before i knew it i had to pay 65 dollars to file my 300 dollar tax return which is going to get taken away by the irs anyways kuz of previous debts lol. basically forced me to pay to file and added fees

hidden fees beware! The fee to file using federal tax deduction doesn't appear until the very end, disappointing and misleading for first timers! By then, you just shell out another $40 on top of $95 or regret that you have wasted your time and do the taxes yourself.

column1: I thought TurboTax could do better. expensive and misleading

column2: Never Again!!! I will NEVER use Turbo Tax again. I was tricked and then trapped into using deluxe. I was charged 94.99 at first, I agreed due to being trapped in the returned I tried filing. I gave up and agreed due to a deadline. Then it charged an extra 34.99?! What the....??? B.S.! I didn't get much to begin with. Then not one of their "service codes" to save $20 would work. Its untrustworthy and I will NEVER again use them or recommend them. Oh yeah...Id like to upload a pic alright....of my middle finger. Hidden fees

One hidden Fee after another The format was easy enough, like any other tax preparation site. but Turbo Tax felt like a total scam. One hidden fee on top of the other. Not until I got to check out, after over an hour on the site, did the actual price I had to pay show up. Much more than any other site as well. I would NEVER use Turbo Tax again. additional fees added repeatedly
OK Overall Service, But Missed A Few Call me if you wish to further discuss, you have my authorization to do so.

column1: Regards,
Edgardo Contreras Too many verifications at the end and unecessary marketing!

column2: Will not want to uzsw you again. You tricked me into paying more money unnecesarely!!!!!!!

column1: SHADY
Gina Natera

column2: good but so much money I had a 1099 that took no time at all, but i still had to buy both state and federal. Would have liked to have used what i payed for, but did not use more then half of either of them. costs so much for so little

HSA I had an HSA but the contributions were only through my employer. i got all the way to the end of the return before it told me that it was required (i don't think it was). If i want to spend 100$ i'll go to my local tax man instead. The approach used to get the extra 59 dollars was mean and i'm sure i'm not the only one whom will be upset. If you want to add value that people will pay for try lowering the price and including state and federal for 40 dollars for both.. this was pretty much the price point i recall paying in the past and it was well worth it.. 100 + after taxes is just too much. btw, i've used turbo tax for 10 years.. ouch.. asking for upgrade 7-9 times
Hidden fees A long, arduous process of working through taxes that you think are going to be free and then, BAM, you are forced to pay, and it is a lot of money. DON'T USE TURBOTAX!
hidden prices There are plenty of hidden fees. False advertising dirty
Confusing at end - didn't know why I was paying two fees
Great UI, very pricey for a simple return  Pricey especially for super simple returns

Way too expensive for a service that can be done for free, and unclear total price until the end, hours later. Way too expensive for a service that can be done for free, and unclear total price until the end, hours later.

Bad for Active Duty Military out-of-state I am active duty military. I did not need to file a state return because I am working away from my state of residence and my state of residence has no state income tax. After I filled out the tax return information for the state I am stationed at (I didn't need to do this), I could not delete or undo that entry. I did not need to file MD state taxes and the refund/payment on it was $0. I spent the last hour trying to get that null state entry off my return, but I could not, and gave up when I ran out of time and had to swallow the $50 for it even though I did not want to file the state return. Extra profit for TurboTax, but not good business practice. I had to pay $50 to file a state return even though I didnt need/want it
Good Service The product itself is decent, and it is convenient to file on your own time. The information provided throughout is very helpful and helped me understand most of my tax situation.

column1: On the other hand, I had to pay just as much to complete it myself as I did when I went to a tax preparation service (H&R Block/Jackson Hewitt, ETC.). The system said I could not use the free edition, but did not provide a detailed reason why. I have always completed a 1040 EZ, but this year it said I had to complete a regular 1040, but I do not have any deductions and have not changed the way I file over the past several years. Price/Had to do the work myself

column2: Extra Costs are Crazy High The software itself is fine, but the additional costs to add a state, and to E-File any/all States seems excessive. EXTRA $$$$$, Can be cumbersome and repetitive
Disappointed this year :0( I've used Turbo for 10 + years. I was some what disappointed last year and then more this year. The price and no 1 free State efile, help section takes to long to search

Easy to use Be clear about how much it costs from the get go please. Feels like I'm being tricked into overspending. Don't understand why I needed to spent extra money to use different parts of your software to file. annoying expenses keep popping up

very disappointed I have used your service for a couple of years now but being charged for doing both my federal and state does not make me happy or want to use your service again. You advertise free state and when I tried to file my state yes, you charged me again. So tax season next year we may have to look around. being charged for both state and federal

Quality goes down every year I have been using Turbo Tax for years But I have noticed that each year the usability goes down. The worst this year is the "Smart Check." It is about the dumbest check ever. It identifies errors in a vacuum with no explanation as to how to correct them. Example: the "Principal Business Code." It states it needs to be entered, but there is no hyperlink to the codes to fill it in. Instead, you're supposed to go back to the form and run a search. But see if you can ever find a search button.

column1: After all these years of using Turbo Tax, I'm switching to a competitor's product for 2016. Less user friendly every year

column2: Not thrilled, had better experiences in the past. I usually don't mind doing my taxes and enjoy using turbo tax because I feel confident in my tax return either because I had the previous knowledge or turbo tax provided a clear explanation. This year, I felt like it was much more confusing and there was far fewer descriptions; that is, there were less readily available as they had beed. I have been using turbo tax for maybe 10 years and felt I have learned so much about the process and always felt confident in my returns. In the previous versions over the years, options were included to easily and readily expand upon nearly every term, statement, or question in order to clarify any terminology or request for information, this year I felt like the "learn more" option left much to be desired as far as explanation or clarification. Further, once the search tool was open, there was no way to continue functioning within the tax form simulatanously. Previously, the browser allowed for both the ongoing tax return and search/help window to concurrently, therefore both could be open at all times. Currently, the browser only allowed one window to be open at a time, the tax return turned grey and to return to working the search window had to be closed. In addition, I should add that my rating should be even lower because my last return was a disaster when I requested part be put in a amazon card and never received the card. The issue with not receiving a card was a fixable issue, but it was the disastrous experiences with customer service that really earned turbo tax a much worse rating. Although up until recently, I always had good experiences but I never needed extra assistance and the complete disaster that was "assistance" makes me incredibly wary to continue doing my taxes with turbo tax or recommend the product to anyone else, in the case I ever needed actual help with a tax return. I'd have to urge Turbo Tax to do some revamping. Unclear, less explanations, awkward wording

2015 Tax Filing through Turbo Tax I found the Turbo Tax software for tax year 2015 much harder to follow and more complex. My tax situation changed this year but I do not understand why. Historically my state refund correlated to my federal refund. This year I got my typical Federal tax refund but had taxes due to the State. I do not understand why. The "counter" moved the Federal owed/refund but the state "counter" did not change for some entries. I would not recommend Turbo Tax if you have had a significant change in events that affect taxes. However I would recommend for more simple tax situations that do not change year over year. Also did not explain the more complex and new issues as well as in the past, i.e. HTC, AMT. For the first time I had to call customer service to try to explain why the State "counter" was not moving when the Fed "counter" moved. I did not get a good explanation. If I had more time I would likely have called more often for other issues but was running out of tax deadline time. Also it was hard to look up and locate various items, such as my AGI. Overall I was not as happy with this year's Turbo Tax software. Not easy to understand differences from prior year

Taxes isn't fun but this site makes it worrysome Going back and forth with turbo tax is okay, as long as I get different result from what I originally expected from information I already inputted. This site has the tendency to rehash what you already said no to previously. And I had to make an installment payment I had to search for it. That was annoying. It was fast.
Easy peasy  100 bucks for basically standard taxes... thats silly come on now
State Refund rejected two consectutive years My state refund was rejected for Tax Years 2014 and 2015.

column1: In 2014, after multiple state rejections, TurboTax finally determined they were using the incorrect revision of the tax form. The rejections, investigation, and waiting for TurboTax to correct the form delayed my filing 2-3 months.

In 2015, after the first rejection I determined the problem- a required text field was left blank when TurboTax completed the form. I called customer service and after 30 minutes of discussion, they stated the only possible way to fix the problem was to remote into my computer. I declined and eventually TurboTax corrected their software. This cause me a 2 month delay in filing. State Refund was rejected two consecutive years

column2: TURBO TAX SUCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! TURBO TAX IS USLESS NO SUPPORT WHEN YOU NEED IT. CALLED AND THEY HUNG UP ON ME THERE IS NO HELP IF YOU NEED IT

Need more help info Not all the explanations on the forms are answered. There should be full instructions starting from #1 on for each form. Sometimes more answers are required when asking for help. Not all the explanations on the forms are answered. There should be full instructions starting from #1 on for each form
TOO MANY ERRORS  too many weird errors on smart check that i had to look up myself to fix.

Too much time spent on a simple return Where do I start...I called early this morning when a very nice woman advised me that I didn't need to complete a form that the program continued to tell me I did. She advised I would need to delete my return and start over from scratch. Needless to say, I had to start over 3 times at the suggestion of the "Tax Experts". Finally on my last call the woman said she thought I could bypass the required form. In addition, she was having issues with the impersonation system so she wasn't able to view my screens that stated I was required to upgrade to the deluxe version for an additional $54.95. All for one simple form. This is the part that makes no sense whatsoever. Supposedly my return was too complex and not a simple return anymore due to me contributing to a company sponsored HSA account. I asked for her to waive the fee or a discount and she said that her supervisors wouldn't allow her to waive the fees. The representative agreed with my reasons for being frustrated but said she wouldn't lose her job for waiving the cost of the program. A company that doesn't empower their employees to help their loyal customers. Now I remember why I went with a competitors product last year. I will not be using TurboTax in the coming years based on my poor experience and wasted time. Everyone was nice but nobody could provide an ample resolution. Customer support was not very helpful
Opps to select Plus over the top  It took 3x as long to repeatedly decline Plus benefits than do taxes
forcing a customer to use a product they didn't want to use. it was supposed to be free
Difficult - Home Office Feature, Not Intuitive Home Office Deduction - cost me 7 hours of time to remedy. Boo!

column1: PROBLEM:
Program allows multiple forms to be created.
Experience:
'Got all the way to file before the problem revealed itself, after of course I paid. Turns out - repetitive forms are not explained, not viewable.
PROBLEM:
Sch C Worksheet, form 8829, Form 2106 - do not match.
Tell me why.
Program should suggest, or not even allow multiple forms to be created if "Only one office" is selected from the q&a. Goofy to allow otherwise.
Was totally unaware that I'd created multiple schedules
PROBLEM STARTED BECAUSE:
The problem started because TurboTax read my POBOX as a home office, in addition to my physical address. Goofy!
PROBLEM:
You cannot view which form you must delete, prior to deleting.
TurboTax response: Here is how to delete...
Customer response: Got annoyed, started deleting forms blindly. Nice.

If TurboTax does not respond to me and let me know that the problem is fixed, offer me some kind of a discount for the enormous amount of time this cost me, no, i will not use the program again. I think there are others out there that would be worth trying. not interested in paying $150.00 plus all the extra frustration, time. Used to love TurboTax. Allows Multiple Copies of Home Office Work Sheet to be created

column2: didn't like how you charged me for the max benefits when I didn't want them. went back several times to try and remove it but couldn't. kinda like stealing

Past versions more helpful This year it felt like I was much more on my own than in the past. Past versions had online help and posted questions from other users that helped since my same questions were often already asked and answered. Even the online help was more accessible. I just didn't know where any of that stuff was in this revision. In spite of this, TT was still somewhat helpful since I was still able to get my question answered. TurboTax 2016 was less helpful than normal

Dissatisfied Normally, I think TurboTax is helpful, however, this year, I found that at the end of my tax-doing session, extra fees had inexplicably been tacked onto my costs. I started with the Free version, and ended owing TurboTax approximately $150. All in all, I feel I lost money by filing my return this year. Next year, I might try H&R Block. Tacked on extra fees at the last minute.

Not Typical The program offered a free option which I use every year and love. After moving to a new state last year the great state of Colorado charged state taxes and now turbotax won't allow me to file for free.... at ALL. $180 later... so glad I chose a "Free" service. wouldn't allow me to file free before the deadline

Don't do it Turbo Tax needs to communicate more regarding their pricing. I had a simple Ez form which was supposed to be free for federal and 29.99 to file state electronically. When it was all said and done I paid almost 100 bucks for a simple return with no itemizations. Additionally when I filed for an extension without reservation or warning, I then needed to upgrade to the deluxe addition. Bogus!!!!! I am so ANgRY about this" Got roped into paying for more software or I had to delete my return and start again

THE OLD GRAY MARE: SHe Ain't What She Used to Be Not as good as she used to be. While Turbo Tax gives a lot of good information in pop-up boxes, you can't search around in it or see your returns in work the way you used to be able to do them. My guess is a lot of people are now balking at the outrageous cost of using Turbo Tax (even if they get a partnership discount) and have tried to use the service to figure stuff out, then gone and done the forms the long-hand way, basically robbing Turbo Tax of its profit for providing a service to them. But, it's aggravating to use, much more than it used to be. Harder to figure out how to correct something (or what exactly it is that is being corrected or why it needs correcting and when you get those, the pop-up explanatory boxes are not there anymore, so you can't learn what it is all about). Just no longer all that happy with TT, but I think it still beats the competition for having a product that actually works and can file your returns at the last minute if necessary. Can't see the returns anymore til you finish; more "BLACK BOX"-ish

Expensive I have used turbo tax online for several years as it was cheaper to process our taxes myself however over the last few years it would have been easier and cheaper for me to take them to the local accountant or tax service / preparer vs. paying what I paid to do them myself with your software. Expensive

Misrepresented I have used turbotax before but the only way I could file state was if I paid for it.. I am upset with this program because it is misrepresented. I couldn't e-file my federal because I didn't earn enough and I couldn't file with state because I was to broke to buy the software. Filing State Tax is not free

not to great When I called in for help as they we're trying to help me 10 mins on hold trying to figure things out when they couldn't they transferred me and drop the call. We purchased the home & business when we e filed we were charged an extra 25.00 to file !
GREAT Product Until the END-GREENDOT Killed DEAL Don't do it. You feel like you are in a SCAM with your TAXES; which is nerve - wracking enough for anyone.

column1: The software is very user-friendly, why I chose it. However, there is no indication of the multiple of fees they pile on you at the end, of course when you are the most anxious; and you have no choice. it says you do, but there is no access within the Disclaimer to get you where you want to go, only to the "Payment/Continue" Tab. pretty shady. the hidden fees you don't know about until you think you are done....you are NOT. You feel like you are in a scam.

column2: sucked twice as bad as last year sucked twice as bad as last year. and still had to spend 1 1/2 hr on the phone wit them just to pay for it sucking. wont use it again sucked twice as bad as last year
There was an extra $29.99 deducted from my refund and it does not give a reason, or any place to click to read. What is it for? extra charge applied

Turbo Tax Premier I have been using this since the late 1980's. Had a few problems early on, but no longer keep up with the tax code like I used to, so don't know if there are problems now. No longer use easy step for the 1040, but it used to work pretty well. It should allow free filing for the state and it is too expensive for what it does. It's too expensive & not sure it is as good as it used to be

Oversold I had a simple return. It should actually have been free and cost close to $100. There should have been an option for more detailed questions upfront to determine exactly what needed before I got hooked into one of the more expensive packages. Further, I was notified when all was said and done that it would cost another $40 to file the state taxes unless I backed them out and did it all separately. I also expected you to import all tax docs from fidelity or at least give the option. You go Intuit! It was smooth in more ways than one
Overpriced and overpromised Promised picture uploads of W2s, never saw that as an option. Just paid 3x more than TaxAct for nothing. expensive

Quick I appreciate the east of TurboTax. The only thing I wish I could be certain of is that I got the best refund through you all. That's the one thing keeping me interested in talking with people at H&R Block. not sure that I got the best refund possible
Refund  You charged me extra fees for services I had denied and I wasn't able to negate that effect. I eventually became fed up.

Spend twice the time and $ for the same results! I did not like doing my taxes this year, between home and business I spent over $500 and several days doing them when I could have spent about the same and saved myself dozens of hours!

column1: Thanks but no thanks. Good riddance turbo tax! Takes a long time, taxes are complicated cost more than going to my CPA!

column2: Screwed me again Bait and switch pricing When I needed audit support for 2013 that I paid for, hand wringing unhelpfulness

Need to fix bugs in software!!!!!!!! There are problems that need to be fixed. The software kept re-inserting data in random locations, such that the final check caught the errors... but when I returned to the affected section and fixed them, the errors returned: the software was entering random values in different locations. Took me three times to finally delete it all and keep it out! This is the first time I've experienced this in 5 years of using TurboTax, so it seems they are getting a little sloppy with their work! Bugs in software!!

So unhappy with Turbo Tax this year I have used Turbo Tax for years but this will be my last. We had a system issue with my computer. I called and the 1st representative was amazing. I called back and she could not help me. When I called back tonight...not only did I pay for the same state 3 times in the process of getting my taxes filed, but the man on the phone was rude. At the end, when his system died and he had to hope it rebooted correctly...he was a little kinder. Overall....worse tax experience. Poor customer service and over charged.

Annoyed by mobile app I've used turbo tax a few times before and I've always had a good interaction with it. I thought I'd save myself some time this year by using the mobile app to do my taxes since I had heard it was easy to do. The main reason I wanted to use the app was to upload my w-2 as I could do the rest on the computer if need be. At no point did it ever ask me to enter my w2 and the entire process I kept wondering when it was going to. I had seen ads about snapping a picture to make the process easier and I never could find the option for it. I got to a point in the app eventually that had squares where I could enter my w2 information but I wasn't able to click on anything, I couldn't move around hardly to see anything, it was impossible to zoom in or read, and there was no way to go forward back or get more information. I reset and reloaded the app a few times and got the same issue so I eventually just went to my computer to do the rest. Part of the information transferred over but there were major holes of things it said I hadn't reviewed. I eventually got everything cleared up but the disconnect between the app and the site was large enough I still completely regret using both mediums. I feel like I coulda missed something and with these being done last minute it really does make you regret using turbo tax this year. Also with all that being said, the website never did give me the opportunity to take a picture of my w2 or import it via another medium. Not a huge fan this year turbo tax... mobile app confused and annoyed

Filing made easy Great way to safely and easily file your taxes. Things are simplified so anyone can understand. Only con is that they seem to be nickeling and dining you for everything. If you are filing under the free return it would be nice to upload your previous information but instead it deletes all your information and makes you start from scratch. Nice service, but i will be using a different company next year that gives more benefits for the free returns. Reducing benefits for free filing
What the? Seriously, another $25? Why is state e-file not included with purchase?

column1: Why is state e-file not included with purchase of additional states?
Because you are terrible. If there is any justice the taxpayer simplification bill will pass congress this year and your racket will be defunct. You will be charged an extra $25 several times.

column2: Disappointed in state tax filing Much to my surprise, turbo tax tries to collect a $24.95 fee for filing a state tax form. In the past, 1 state form was included in the cost of Premier. Premier charges for filing 1 state form

Not Amused I chose the free edition of TurboTax, as many of my friends and family did this tax season and was more than displeased when the page came up to pay and asked me for $29.99. Not only that, but it would not let me go back and change it anywhere. I paid it so that my taxes would not be late but I will not be using TurboTax anytime again. Making me pay
The price is starting to be too much. Will review other software options next year. Price is too high

Easy to Use But... The program would "think" too long in between loaded. Did it will I finalized everything and hit submit....very scary when you only have 20 minutes to file and your software is shutting down. I kept needing to restart which cost some time. Also, not as intuitive as I thought it would be. Would like for the program to make suggestions about deductions, etc. Kept timing out

Not so comprehensive My IRA includes after-tax contributions. TurboTax program used to "remember": this and open form 8606, transferring the basis from the prior year, asking me the 12/31 balance, and calculate the taxable portion of my IRA withdrawals. Didn't do this last year, and when I looked also for the last two. So I've paid unnecessary taxes. Hasn't picked up carryover items
idk... I was aware of the 50 plus

column1: then the additional insurance fee
...but late in the process there is a $35 fee that is applied---
why wait to spring that on at the end - the sneak fees -

column2: felt like I didn't get all I was suppose to  tricks you into getting more expensive package
This was fairly straight forward but still a bit confusing. The commercials were a bit misleading. The price was also more than I had expected. Don't know if I will be using this again.

Hidden Cost I've used Turbotax for years and have always been very happy with their services up until this year. They charged me an additional $30, which I spent over an hour trying to figure out how to remove the charge with no luck. I will never use Turbotax again! Hidden Cost at the end.
Get less back every year  Charged me $29.99 when I did NOT choose Plus help!!

Bait & Switch I qualified for the free tax filing, but you put up these different plans you have that cost and say the deluxe is better for your situation. After going through the entire process, its the same, but I have now selected the deluxe package. Then you hit me at the end with a bank filing charge, really? I'm done with you guys. n/a

mediocre -and slipping Cost keeps going up -while it still advertises "Free". Not clear directions for side business incorporated into personal taxes -and having an adult disabled child at home. Misses clear direction

2 hours wasted trying to beat TT software glitch for 2 hours tried to fill in blank on my Okla State return form 561 asking for an "Oklahoma Location" or "Federal ID" for about 75 entries on capital gains deduction. Finally googled and found advice from a helpful person in cyberspace, who said just put an "X" in the blank and keep hitting "Review". Took some time but finally finished, after TurboTax was satisfied with "X" for the location.

Some good, some bad When it came time to save the entire return, the Turbo Tax system wouldn't let me save it to turbo tax because last years was already saved with the same name. Last year's had so many problems after filings it was extremely difficult to retrieve the information and print it. don't like having to continuously put in 2 passwords and answer a question to save

Turbo Tax Troubles This program is a complete rip off and I will not use it again. I am dissatisfied with the outcome which was that my Return was rejected due to Turbo tax telling me that my return was wrong because I was claiming my daughter and she was also claiming herself which was absolutely false. I couldn't efile because of a Turbo Tax problem and had to make a late night trip to the post office.

Prices for required packages getting too high. I would probably be considered low income. I have a traditional employer, but I also have a small income from freelance work. In order to report that income, I had to upgrade to the Home & Business package, for $104.99. That seems like an exorbitant fee increase, especially for something which used to be included in much lower cost packages. Next year I may have to consider other filing options, as the cost may not be worth the convenience. The expense of the more "complex" packages is too high.

I have been using turbo tax for at least 10 yrs but it still has problems for the average person. I have a college education & am a retired teacher & there are things I don't understand & can't find the answers to when I'm doing my taxes. It would have been nice to have been able to imported my Vanguard info when I first started my return & been able to have seen my info on the spread sheets! It's so frustrating not be be able to see the whole form but just a small window! JBE
hidden fees Turbo tax is quick and easy to use but they dont tell you which forms are covered by the different price levels.

column1: If i knew I was going to be forced upgrade to the largest package just to enter my income i would not have even bothered.

if you have 1099's to enter then be warned you are going to pay just under $100 to efile your taxes. they forced me to upgrade to deluxe just to enter my income. does not tell you what forms are covered under which packages

column2: suck it let me downgrade from business to regular without erasing all my info. either its poor design or ruse to get more $. either way if I dont hear its fixed I wont be back upsell trick
Error with no explanation I received an error when filing that had no explanation on how to fix it. I wasted three days.

Greedy Pigs Turbotax allowed me an outlet to get my taxes done. They charged me half of my already small $480 refund. It takes a special kind of company to charge so much. Thats food from my families mouths!

column1: I will never use turbotax again nor reccomend it. Extremely over priced, very greedy

column2: Hmmm... I've used Turbo Tax for over a decade through various stages of my life (college student, marriage, job change and children). I have an accounting degree and would always advise people who asked me to help with their taxes to use Turbo Tax when doing fairly simple tax returns. However, now that I've filed my 2015 taxes, I realized that the Turbo Tax checks didn't see that I missed the sales tax deduction for 2014. I would have expected the final checks to highlight this omission. I fully recognize that this is something that I should have noticed myself. However, I am definitely less likely to recommend to my friends and will be filing with a professional going forward. Doesn't really check everything

This is the worse program I have always used turbo tax and starting last year it started getting bad. I purchased turbo tax deductions & homeowners and it did not work on my laptop because it had window 10 on it. It let me put information but it showed VOID when printed and it would not let me e-file. I paid 496.98 from Sam's Club and couldn't use it. I thought that was bad. This year I saw turbo tax free filing, only to put in my information using turbo tax deluxe and as I put in information the program changed to turbo premier and transferred last year's information but would not allow me to open and work in the program, causing wrong information on my return and then charged me $79.99 for the program. What a rip off. This is my last year using turbo tax. the program started using deluxe and ending using premier

ripped me off started off free and then added unnecessarycharges. Iwas supposed to pay 34.95 i marked not interested in 54.99 but you charged me that fee anyways. Rip off, ever again!!!!!! everything never use your service again

Disappointed Consumer This is my first time filing my taxes by myself and at first it said it was free and would not cost me a thing but throughout the whole process it kept trying to force me to upgrade. My tax return was as simple as they come and I still was required to upgrade and to pay 49.99. I am very upset at the deception of this program after inputing all of your information and then it forces you to accept the upgrade. I would appreciate it greatly if a consumer representative would call me about this matter because I am very unsatisfied 423 833 1514 Price Deception

Hidden fee trick I like using this because it's quick and easy. However, getting asked about adding more protection several times is annoying. There was an extra 39.99 fee that I did not agree to, so I expect to have all of the protection that was offered because i got charged for it anyway. The reason behind the second fee of 39.99 was mot covered
absurd price 29.99 for nothing... state fee at the end
upsell / BloatWare / Slow click to continue. click here and we will show you another button to click. ready to start? click again. click again. one more time.

column1: its so fake "importing old info, please wait 5 minutes for the graphics to pretend to make the database load"
at the very end, if you dont pay them more, they will delete your state return.

i got stuck at the end and it would not let me E-file even tho i had to pay more to e-file them together (and they already had my money). some prob with the "worksheet", clicking a bunch of times fixed it. but i had to do it 4 or 5 times. "fix State Return", again and again and again. expect to pay 60 bucks even if they dont tell you right away.

column2: too exspensive federal was not free, even though I am a returning customer. continued to have to pay state at a high cost. additional 30.00 to fee with turbo tax rip off.... will reconsider next year whether I will use it ever again too exspensive

not as good as before Crashed on windows 10 all the time. Had to install to another computer. There are multiple choice questions presented as single choice, e.g. 1) have a employee stockplan 2) you know 1099-G is not correct 3) none of above.

column1: Also, in many cases, "none of above" is a choice and you can skip it, which also means "none of above", which doesn't make any sense. crashes on windows 10, multiple choice questions presented as single choice

column2: 2manyfees/IDverifySUCKS!!!!!!! Fees are too numerous and too high. ID VERIFY IS UNFORGIVABLY BAD!!!! Fees are rediculous, ID verify took 5 or six attempts though I did it correctly each time. THIS IS UNFORGIVABLE!!!!

Shady ways of over-charging. What the heck is the extra charge about. I did not want any "special" services. They gave them to me anyhow, and without my consent. Your explanation for the shady extra fee is...oh, wait! There was/is no explanation for why it appeared. To top it off, you can't remove the extra $39.99 fee. You Can press the remove button and it will (seemingly) remove the premium fee, but when you get to the point where you're just about ready to press ."submit"' the fee reappears (I tried removing it a few times). TurboTax is great, but I won't be back unless this issue is fixed. Charge x-tra at the end (39.99).
deceving I never got help from Turvo tax and then they charge me after saying it was free, I coundnt enter mortgage interest payment because I was missing a form that.
Excessive fees Overall easy to use. I wish the fees were mentioned up front. Not a bait and switch phrase like "Start Free" Do not mention fees until close to the end of process

Misdirection The first two people I spoke with were obviously tired and confused, wasted a good deal of my time and misdirected my call, so that I waited more than three hours to speak with a tax advisor The tax advisor was wonderful and understood my tricky question immediately. But we agreed that as it is late (11:30 pm EDT), and as I have already filed, we will amend tomorrow. If he calls me back as promised tomorrow, I may amend my rating. The live telephone help was confused!

Turbo Tax is terrible!!!!!!!!! Thanks for wasting my money and time. When i started Turbo Tax Free edition, there were 3 options your no-good web-site said i had, one of which was importing W-2's. Well that didnt happen, which is the ONLY reason i used your service at all. My mistake was procrastinating, because if I were not crunched for time, i would of deleted my account, left bad feedback and never ever used your site again. You also sneek a $35 dollar fee for using your federal return.

column1: I will go out of my way to show people how to use federal and state e-file services so they dont get screwed over by Intuit. Not Free

column2: very easy. most questions are answered in FAQ or search. didn't give 5 stars due to the horrible hold time to speak with a representative. i called, held for 15 minutes, was advised i was in wrong dept. then, i was transferred and system said hold time was 16 minutes. i held for awhile and then system said hold time is 35 minutes. how awful! assistance should be easier to obtain.

A little pricey This program could not figure out how to file my NY taxes properly and I was charged for something I did not want. Will try to get rectified and if I can I will change my review!!! Can't do a NY State return properly
I always use Turbo Tax!  resetting/recovery of password, did not work. even with all my info. used turbo tax for years

Expensive for no reason No instructions on how to remove fee if you don't want the added "benefits" Features added without my consent and charged for it. Included was an explanation of why I was being charged with no ins

Scam I had two choices when I first got on the web to order Turbo tax, get the software or do it online because it was supposed to be cheaper. Then when I go to file, the discount is gone. SCAM. I would have bought the software, otherwise, but now, I am strongly considering HR Block for next year. Lure you in with a discount for online filing and then take it away

Getting shady Charging 35$ to take my payment out of my return in crazy. I'm tired and done with f-king taxes or i would have gone back and let you (Intuit) charge my card, but that is what you mother-f-kers bank on isnt it? To whoever is reading this, f-k you. 35$ is f-ked up...just so that CEO can buy himself that 5 house or that 10th car. -F-k him too

column1: inappropriate language...? c0c- k su-ckers Fee's for BS

column2: Difficult time navigating I got all ready to file my return when I got a message letting me know I had to fix the federal claim because I'd claimed more than 50% of my Wisconsin income in deductions. I was then given some figures which seemed to be in line with what I was seeing on my W2s. I could not figure out how to go back and check my federal or my state returns so, with 2 hours to go before the deadline, I finally whipped out my paper Wisconsin form 1A, went through it quickly, changed some numbers on turbo tax, crossed my fingers and hit "submit". I was SO disappointed in turbo tax this year. If my federal return wasn't right then why did the stupid software say "Yep, looks good. Let's move on to the state return now."? A few Major cons

Not bad for average user For instance, damage to your home that is not reimbursed could be a deduction. There are many more that I expected the deluxe version to cover. There are a lot of items that it never brings up
Didn't expect to be paying $59.99 I wanted to use the $29.99 opinions & it only gave me the $59.99 amount to use to pay to file my taxes!!!! Bad on displaying Price opinions

Forced to use turbo tax deluxe This year I'm forced to use the deluxe edition and I think it's because I entered the student loan 1098e interest paid in my tax return, but after I did a calculation I realized the total amount I get back is less if i just don't report the student loan interest paid and use the free edition, but by the time I find out it's already too late because there are no options for me to return to the free edition.

column1: you rip 90 dollar off my refund and " hope you all choke on that money, fxxking aXXholes you betray the people who use your service.

never using your service again, like ever again, I don't mind paying a fee if it was honest, if you just be honest and charge a certain fee I still would have use your service, but no you had to be sneaky and pull bxxxh axx move to scam money, I'd rather pay for an paid-tax reporting service than using turbotax again because of the poor business ethic you have. you should all be ashamed of yourselves. you rip me off assholess

column2: ok - stressful but got the job done would recommend it takes several hours for people who don't do numbers

Easy, but watch out for the hidden fees I was pleased with my turbo tax expereince until I got to the very end and realized that they were charging almost 100 dollars for filing when direct deposit, Plus features, and other fees were assessed. Hidden fees
frustrating  100% frustrating that after finishing state taxes you find out it isn't free.

Not as Intuit-ive as Other Tax Software I prefer H&R Block's tax software. I've used both the Intuit version and their competitor and the other just seems so much easier to navigate forward and backward, when jumping forward and backward are necessary. I'll use theirs next year. Unnecessarily difficult to jump back and then forward again.
Bad Experience I was confused and repeated a lot of the steps (when I did not need to) due to me relocating out of state. Difficult to complete when moving out of state in 2015

Your shitime is falsely advertised you say it's free and it's not your a bunch a seemingly government cocksuckers lieing and taking good hardworking people's money your a bunch a con artists That you lie and advertised free fed and state returns and then it wasnt

EXTRA FEES I WAS VERY, VERY UPSET THAT AN EXTRA FEE OF 34.99 WAS PLACED ON MY ACCOUNT. ALL IT SAYS THAT IT IS A REFUND FEE, WHICH I COULD NOT GET ANY INFORMATION REGARDING A REFUND FEE. UNEXPECTED FEES

Customer Service = Lacking I do not like the way your fees work. I just waited 40 mins on the phone to speak to a rude agent, just to find out I was stuck paying $55 to file a single, simple 1040EZ. I've been a customer for 4 years. Not happy!! Fee trap and very poor customer service
They use any opportunity they can to bump up your services, even over simple stupid stuff. One number in a box (less than $7) cost me an additional $70 in prep fees. Used excuses to charge us money.

SO easy-- just ask their lobbyists why! I wish TurboTax would do right for all taxpayers and stop paying thousands upon thousands of dollars to their lobbyists to keep the tax code so complicated that people can't file on their own. It's absolutely criminal that TurboTax and HRBlock and the other major tax preparers all keep paying off our politicians so that they won't reform the tax code to make it simpler to file. We could all be doing our own taxes but Turbo Tax wants to keep earning your $100 every year so they make it virtually impossible for people to understand their own filing. it's easier than filing yourself because they paid congress!
Meh... Just meh...

column1: if you don't do anything to out of the ordinary, you'll be fine. Own your own business, need to provide more info, need to better understand where to do something... you are basically on your own. Even maximizing your IRA contributions is cumbersome... click the maximize button, we'll return to in later... very underwhelming.

Bugs in downloading banking and income docs online - if you use special characters TTax will not accept them... try using the space character in your password... good luck.. .doesn't work No guidance, no additional information. Pointers to IRS docs is useless... need help interpreting the information

column2: Wow, Really? Turbo Tax likes to pretend that they are helping, but in reality they just want your money. Admit it. ADMIT IT. HAD to have premier just because I sold mutual fund shares

bait and switch!!! Do not use this tax program its a ripoff. I waited til last minute to do my taxes and thought oh I can do them for free or a very minimal fee. Wrong all they wanna do is upgade upgrade upgrade. You will spend at min 100 bucks!!! Stay away!!!! ridiculous fees

Do it by hand. They dont expose all the legal forms to you unless you upgrade to a wastefully more expensive plan. Doing by hand next year. Taxes are not complex and you shouldnt have to pay so much just to do them online. Holy dog poo expensive
Ads Galore!!! And not in a good way!!! If I wanted to add the benefits I would. I don't want to be asked three different times if I want more benefits! No, final answer! So unpleasant. Too many ads!

Worst Tax Experience I came to Turbo tax because I wanted to save money but I ended up paying almost the same amount I would have paid one of the chain stores like HR block to do my taxes. This is the worst tax experience ever. Plus all the hours I put in doing the taxes my self.

Online product is NOT the same as the store I paid for the Turbotax software and found it easy to use BUT when I went to do my daughters return, it told me that I couldn't enter her 1099 without upgrading and my purchased product wouldn't work since I had bought it online. I was supposed to buy the disc from the store if I wanted to do more than one return for my family. Although the cost was the same, I had no idea until it was too late and I ended up doubling the cost from Turbotax. You can only use the purchased online software for one person but store product can be used for many more and costs same

frustrated for the first time I have used Turbo Tax for at least a decade if not two. never had a problem. tonight I was trying to submit my son's return and it would just sit there. I spent 3 hours over and over. ended up going on line to repurchase the state then had to do a manual download for the federal for updates that are probably nothing to do with me and it would not allow me to submit the returns without doing all this and paying twice for the state.

column1: might be looking elsewhere next year could not submit final return for my son because update would not funciton

column2: Not too happy This wasn't a great experience, I always pay back on my taxes so nothing new...however, with the company I used last year, I didn't have to decide upfront how I was going to make my payments...I was able to do it on my own after. Forced me to chose payment method

Don't Get the Deluxe When I started out it ask me questions about myself. Income marital status ect.. then it recommended the deluxe version to "maximize my refund" being that i was concerned that i already pay 35% income tax i was really hoping this was true. Well.... Didn't save me a penny more but did cost me an extra 60 buck for something that was free. Needless to say i will be taking my business elsewhere. Its one thing to be reamed by the government for 20% more taxes than billionaires or even the President but this really twisted the knife. Thanks for excellent advice Turbo Tax Suckered me into paying for same refund as free version

stressful Had a few stressful moments when I was in the process of doing the taxes at 10pm on the night they were do, but thats my fault. Most of our information pulled in but the confusing stuff did not! I just hope I don't get audited! First time for doing our own taxes. it didn't pull all my info easily

Easy to use but NOT free Was not happy with the Deluxe charge which was not explained Then another 35 for another charge that I have no idea what it was for. Just pressed send because I'm tired of worrying about my taxes. Y'all got me! Charged 55 for deluxe and then another 35???? for what?

Poor Customer Service I realize that tax and the day prior would be busy but not only did I wait for 3 hours but after being told that I would be able to talk to a tax professional I was connected with someone who had no idea what I was talking about. She basically told me I could start over or run a diagnostic. I had a specific question about a specific line item and she could not help me. She put me on hold to wait another hour for someone who could help. I just gave up and tried to figure it out on my own. I have used Turbo tax for 5 years and this is the first time I've needed customer support and it has me questioning whether I will use it again Poor Customer Support

frustrated in MN New rules for MN were not handled well by the site. They had to be left incomplete until I can get to another location to generate physical copies of my Federal taxes, and THEN perform a bunch of hand written calculations which could have easily been programmed into the software. The value is no longer there for this software when I have to manually print all of my forms and do a bunch of extra work on my own. My MN taxes were a mess.

I tried and tried to find how to file the form required to pay my $500 First Time Homebuyers Loan. Time is running out so I filed my return. Not sure now if I will have to file an amended return or just call the IRS.
Miss represented state included in Deluxe. cost 50 bucks more state not included
Some Improvements Suggested Been filing with TurboTax for at least two decades now. I have some suggestions:

column1: 1. To keep competitive with similar online tax filing systems, offer state tax filing to $39.99 for up to TWO states.

2. In 1099-R form, offer an option that exempts taxes in the situation where the money rolled over is AFTER-TAX 401K monies that employee can distribute without being taxed. It is similar to ROTH exception, but it is not a Roth. Speak to IRS to make this an option as it is quite common that employee will continue to give to 401K AFTER-TAX if they have met the IRS max limit regulation. There is no tax to distribute this money since it was already taxed.

column2: Double charged me I entered my payment info... it said 'something went wrong - we couldn't charge that card'... they did charge it. And I had to make the payment a second time. Now, after spending hours on this bs, I have to deal with getting a refund for the additional charge. I tried calling, but didn't have the battery or the will power for a 45 minute wait time.

column1: Also, there doesn't seem to be a way to tell how much it will cost (except them saying "it's free"... until you've spent hours filling out forms. Then you find out it costs over $100. Double charged my credit card

column2: Turbotax tech gave me a fix that didn't work.

column1: Transferred all my work to a laptop and all worked fine. Had error updating or downloading state

column2: This was the most horrible experience EVER I will NEVER, I repeat, NEVER use this service again. IMPOSSIBLE to reach anyone to ask questions

State continues to lag Federal I find that Turbo Tax continues to improve the Federal return filing process and corresponding worksheets (e.g., for keeping track of nondeductible traditional IRA contributions). However, there is a significant deterioration in the experience with State returns - particularly in the process of allocating income sources. In the absence of including allocations in the "interview" TT should at least provide access to the worksheets (this year they locked them down). State return adjustments not built in to the interview process

Disappointed: Erased 1099 Data I am a long term user of Turbotax and will keep using it. However, on Thursday when we finished the data input it showed taxes due of $2,600 using the laptop. When I opened it with my pc on Monday night to make submission it showed refund of $5,317. I was incredibly happy and went so far as to pay and print out the return before taking a closer look. My income was 30K too low because my wife's independent contractor 1099 income was dropped out. All the other information of the 1099 was there except for the earnings. Had I not caught it at the very last minute, it would have been a mess. I called customer support but after waiting for 54 minutes the line dropped. Anyhow, no one should expect service on the filing night. I am surprised this happened. I can't think of anything I did to have caused it. If they investigate and show that it was my mistake I would take it back. Erased my 1099 data

Costs keep going up! State cost is ridiculous compared to the federal return. You guys have to be kidding when you expect $34 to have Turbo Tax take the fees for the software out of the tax refund. Someone isn't paying attention when they chose that option. Generally disappointed that fees increase each year and that is when I look for some sort of discount to reduce it. One of these years I will choose another vendor. Stop raising the fee in the weeks leading up to April 15th tax filing deadline - if you think you need an increase do it Jan 1st - not when people are heading into tax filing and now feel pressured. Costs keeps going up.

Honestly, improve the flow from screen to screen I had to figure out when to go back and start over on various sections because of confusing sections of the workflow. You REALLY need a UX designer or information architect to come in and fix this up for next year - a serious backwards slide from 2014.

column1: For instance - income, imported a return with two W-2's. and they both show up. Click the first to fill it in, at the end of that W-2, it says "Do you have another W-2 to enter?" Well yes, I do. But if I click yes, it prompts me to fill in all the employer info. So, go back, say "No", and select the other one that is already in the system and fill it out. ???

Another instance - Try to e-file, but one state's criteria doesn't allow it. Instead of actually helping me, it tells me to go to the next screen and select "print and file". I do that (which gives me a nice red warning that it's a 'bad idea'), and then dumps me back into the beginning of the workflow so I can click through all the federal screens again! !!!
Really, you can do better than this with the resources you have. The User Experience needs serious work

column2: Was better last year Last year I don't remember constantly being requested to "upgrade" for extra features every few screens. I also qualified for free state filing but no matter what I tried they wanted my $30 bucks to file it. I finally just gave in since I couldn't figure out a way to get around it. Never had that problem last year and I still qualify for free state and federal filing.

column1: They also want to sign you up for "bonus" offers. You need to pay attention and read all the screens because they want your info to sell to others.

Conveniently when I tried to set my contact settings for them to not spam me with their marketing, it said it could not be completed at this time. I am sure they will sell my information now. Any way to make a few extra bucks I guess.
I will try them again next year but if they keep putting up the nag screens I think I will look for a different filer. Constant "upgrade" offers, charged for what should be free state filing

column2: terrrible the IL state tax software didn't work very well. very confusing. wouldn't let me put a portion of my IL refund toward 2016 estimated taxes. gave me No option for this. also strangely: during the IL e-file process Turbo Tax ask me to enter "IL 1040 line 1a" which THERE IS NO LINE 1a!!!!! very confusing and almost messed up my return. very disappointed! cumbersome

Working fine, and then all of a sudden the mouse and touchpad would move the cursor, but you could not select anything, or key from the keyboard etc. Frequently more frequent than that. Had to save on every screen, then when it happened use 'end task' to do an abnormal end to the return, and then launch it again, and re-enter the data that you had not saved yet.

column1: So frustrating. I have used Turbo Tax for decades, but I may be forced to try another vendor after this frustrating experience. For the first time ever it kept freezing and keyboard and mouse would not work - only in Turbo Tax

column2: Not using turbo anymore I've always found turbotax quick and easy and worth the nominal additional cost vs other tax prep services. It's

column1: Got all my prior years returns stored and easily accessible. But, I won't use it again. For the amount I got back vs. The fees they charge and aren't forthcoming about I say no way Jose'.
I Costs way too much money

column2: Not good compared to past years experience Several times in the preparation of this years return, I had thoughts about jumping ship and working with another product. Since I didn't use the "installed" product for TurboTax this year, it is difficult for me to know whether the inability to see form previews is only a limitation in the online version. I would recommend anyone requiring "Home & Business" to avoid the online version and use a product where forms are visible. There were several times where hyperlinks could have been implemented, but there was only text that said "be sure to visit the education section" for instance. Inability to see previews of actual tax forms and have links back to the entry is a real drawback.
Lots of add on charges Lets you get all the way then informs you of 3 different charges

Functional but pricey I'm pretty tax clueless but was able to navigate TurboTax with ease. Not happy that $124 was taken out of my refund (which was 600) for TurboTax fees. It wasn't completely clear to me how necessary these charges were and what they went towards. TOO EXPENSIVE

Buggy Product Encountered a serious issue with .TXF import. It won't take the Brokerage name while entering or editing. Just displays "No Financial Institution" as the name. Thought I could tolerate that, but when I imported the .TXF file for another Brokerage, TurboTax overwrote the information entered earlier since it thought all "No Financial Institution" has to be the same. I had to manually merge the TXF files and make it one before entering again. Shame on TT! If I need to edit anything later, makes me repeat the whole process! Buggy product
Hidden fees, a bit confusing with instructions

Swindled I was gathering my tax information at 10:30pm on tax night, and knew that buying a house and getting that big promotion would mean a full hour and a half should be set aside. Turbo Tax then explained that the Free version wasn't for me. OK, I thought, I have to itemize because of the house, but NO! This was not needed and the simple free return I have come to know and love was taken from me. I could have (after searching every google page known to man in 10 minutes, but nothing on the website intuitively(double paren for word-play)) simply started over, had there been a reasonable assumption that I could do my taxes in another 20 minutes and not fall asleep or have the internet go out on me. I was then flabbergasted to see that withdrawing from my taxes cost another $35, if only I had the time to find my wallet, woe is me. Deceptive marketing/tomfoolery

many of your review fields are very difficult to navigate. Whenever corrections are needed very little background information is given to support the needed information. I have several rental properties and whenever a correction is made I don't even know which property it is referring to and there is no way to click to find out.

column1: Some information should be auto filled. There is not reason whenever i used Turbotax the previous year that the expense of the previous years tax return isn't automatically filled it.

column2: Charged for Deluxe at the End I won't be using this again, I had no refund and just wanted a free return. I didn't use any of your automatic features yet was charged at the end to do deluxe...for what? For me to manually input my own data just to be charged at the end. Thanks for taking my money! I didn't use any features and it wanted me to upgrade to deluxe before filing

Never again After getting me to pay to upgrade to the deluxe edition and assuring me that my taxes wouldn't cost anything to file, I was charged an additional 39.99 to file our taxes! I would never recommend this program to anyone and this is my last year ever using Turbo Tax.
