report prep is free,,,,,,charges were 119.00 reported gambling wins/losses program appeared to balance to 0, however did not apply 0 to final calculations. Additionally, program placed pension as wages instead of taxable pension. truly a rip off. advertised free charged $$119.00
Not as good in 2015 as in the past Flagged items but could not figure out how to go back to review flagged items.

column1: Tried to search within my file, but couldn't. Each time I tried to Search, I was searching online help.
Help is based on other users; what are we paying Turbo Tax for? Why are they (TurboTax) providing expert advice.

column2: bad start, good finish I purchased the product (Home & Business) at a big box store; a few weeks ago I entered basic personal information, but today (tax day), on startup it asked if I wanted to check for updates. Of course I did - but the program couldn't extract the new information. Worse yet, the only option it gave me was to wait and try updating later (I couldn't go to forms, etc.). In other words, it was frozen. I called customer support, spoke to a helpful fellow named Jonathan and all turned out well. But it seems this is a known defect with Mac computers as they try to work with the CD from the box stores - so why sell them there in the first place? Turbo's Jonathan saved the day; I thank him, and so should they. defective out of the box

Not very impressed I could not believe what they charged for just adding filing for self employed in addition to my day job. And the $35 fee just to have the cost deducted from the federal return is outragous! All of the additional fees!
disappointed Really!! 29.00 to transfer my name to current return!

column1: Will use different site next year for sure!! feel ripped off in fees!!!

column2: looked for way to file federal forever should have discounted state rate of federal is free; would create life time user instead of feeling like you are getting fleeced too many ways ot tried to make you pay for a free return

support is a joke, software is awesome. wait 15 min to get redirected to another operator for 35 min. the online status for support lied, it wasnt 15 min, it was in fact 45 min I hung up eventually. I know its last minute filing but they should be ready for this.

column1: The software however is great! wait 15 min to get redirected to another operator for 35 min

column2: Good, but need to improve Federal is Good, state need to be improved.

column1: Cost need to be lowered. State is little confusing, very expensive

column2: Over charged I feel I was overcharged once I was ready to file. I never chose shy extras. This is the last year I use turbo tax after fine thus way for at least 20 years. over charged

Comprehensive, but Expensive TurboTax has gone downhill. When I first started using it, I was able to consolidate 1099-MISC income from contracting into the free Federal return. State was always additional, but it was a good deal: $40 to file your taxes.

column1: Now, TurboTax doesn't clearly explain what its features are until you try to access something in an expanded package. Then it hits you up for more cash. I ended up paying $100 for something that used to cost me $40. All for no increase in functionality.

At this point, I'd likely recommend someone go to an in-person tax prep specialist - someone who you can build a relationship and who can actually advise you on how to maximize your tax picture. TurboTax does none of this. It might be cheaper than a live prep agent, but not much any more. The savings aren't worth it for the meager functionality you get. Extremely expensive and core functionalities increasingly stripped away

column2: Pretty straight forward but... I'd really like for TT to, at the beginning, simply ask for a list of the forms I have and be able to deduce the most efficient method of entering the data. There are a lot of questions asked that TT should already know the answer to.

column1: Also, TT tries too hard to be sneaky when asking to add fees for additional 'product'. Even worse is the sly way of going thru Green Dot. It's fairly obvious that those who need to use their refund to pay for TT probably really need as much of their refund as they can get. $34.99 for this service is ridiculously greedy on the part of Green Dot. asks questions it should already know the answer to

column2: Intuit LOBBIES for more complicated filing? I've been receiving emails that tell me Intuit continues to lobby for a complicated tax code in order to protect revenues from tax filing software. I understand that this isn't a moral decision by Intuit....it is a business decision. But where do we draw the line? The IRS tax code is far too complicated and unwieldy for any one person to understand all the aspects therein. It takes hours to accurately tally and input data either onto IRS forms using worksheets, or through the TurboTax Online or purchased PC software products. Looking through and understanding instructions plus processing time, is time that is taken from GDP and personal lives. That is true for every employee of Intuit just as it is for every other federally taxed person inside and outside of the US. So Intuit is not only paid for the use of software, but also reducing GDP and personal time. Maybe we should lobby Congress to send Intuit an invoice for the burden Intuit puts upon the economy. Cost, security?, Lobby Congress to maintain complicated code/filing process

Confusion I was charged $24.95 for a FREE state return. When I attempted to contact CS via email, I was given a Support ID # and a toll free number to call. I called the number, approximately 25 minute wait. Ain't got time for dat! Didn't receive the FREE state return
Not happy at the not free, but it's done Not happy at the not free, but it's done

column1: Easy to use, don't like that I had to pay anyway and don't see that it was deductible to pay for. Had to pay for the free part

column2: Greendot "BANK" I was totally freaked out at the end when I attempted to pay my Turbotax fee via being taken out of my return only to find out a separate bank account would be created & there were all kinds of warnings that they could not guarantee everything ... freaked me out ... they should not do this corporate scam

Needs improvement I had a couple of state-specific issues that made filing my return very painful. Wife works in MA and from home in NH, and we both live in NH. The only way to apportion income is by using the tax forms; it cannot be done using "step by step". Customer service rep was awesome in explaining how to use the forms. But, it got a lot worse when I filed jointly for the federal return, and then tried to file separate for my wife in MA. TurboTax makes you create "mock" returns, and I had to do my taxes all over again for myself and my wife. It was such a nightmare that I gave up. I think that the software should automatically allow you to file a separate state return for one spouse. Filing jointly for federal, separate for state is a disaster
discount was not able to get discount cause i already started my return. What bs

Multi State I am retired and moved to Missouri, but receive funds from my prior home state. I do not owe Missouri taxes or get a refund and I had to pay $39.99 to Efile the return. I will receive a refund from my home state and paid $39.99 as well to Efile. There should have been a discount on the filing of the Missouri return, no more than $19.99. Paid $39.99 for a non-owe/non refund State versus my refund State return

Ubelievable! Installation was buggy. Had to find online help to debug installer. Software incredibly slow. As I write this, I've been trying for over an hour to efile. Sorry excuse for software and website just time out. NEVER, EVER AGAIN! Bad installation Abysmal Performance

Not Happy I selected to use turbotax because it was free..... or so I thought. At the very end after I put in all the information it forced me to "upgrade" to the $54.99 plan. When my refund was only going to be 101.00 plus it took a $34.99 processing fee. I am very unhappy. If I could have filed taxes sooner #but I didn't file till the deadline because I was pre-occupied with my 4 month old son having 2 open heart operations in the past 3 weeks# and saw this I would have went another way rather than using turbotax. I am very unhappy turbotax is lucky that its the deadline to file taxes and was able to take advantage of me, if I had more time I would have filed somewhere else. I would like a response as to why it forced an "upgrade" When you select the free its not free
TT Premier 2015 Needs software video tutorials; and informational topic videos added.

column1: I switched from H&R Block, was loving Turbo Tax, then in the middle of my taxes I missed certain features about H&R Block. The software does or thinks too much for me with minimal explanations.

column2: It's Just Okay I'll be using an accountant next year. Not that good for small businesses.

Turbo Tax Automatically Upgrades you Users be careful....Turbo Tax sneakily automatically upgrades you to their pricier versions in order to get more money from you. Its cheap and lacks character...Its not something I respect at all Automatic Upgrade

Very difficult to understand I have used Turbo Tax for years. This year I had a great deal of difficulty understanding some of the sections. It took me forever to figure it all out. Thanks also for charging me over $100, also from last year, only to find it it wasn't tax deductible as I was lead to believe. Very deceptive. Not ok.

Easy and Convenient but Getting Pricey I've used Turbo Tax for years and I love how convenient it is having everything stored year after year. The software is easy to use and provides good explanations along the way. But in recent years the program has started forcing me to use a more advanced version and charging me more. I was especially frustrated this year when the regular website price I saw was lower than the affiliate "discount" price I received when I went through the affiliate websites. I couldn't remove the affiliate and then ended up having to pay the higher price. I will likely try a different service next year and see how it compares. Pricey (especially state returns)
Tax vague definitions/explanations of what certain definitions are some of the definitions are really really vague

Hidden fees They said the state filing is free with purchase of 2015 federal turbotax. I had to pay for filing to the state. The worst part is, you cannot contact the company to ask about this. Where is your customer service? Non-existent! No one to talk to - inherently confusing - hidden fees

Almost a perfect product It took me 45 minutes to find out how to find how much I paid you for last years return. I called as well but ended up finding the info. Why can't you just have the link on that page or Autofill.

column1: If you had that on the page you would have earned a 10! I didn't like that I had to search to find out how much I paid for last years return.

does NOT make it clear if the price package changes till they hit you at the end!

Inexplicable charges when filing AFTER paying $60.00 for the Deluxe program (which I didn't end up actually needing) I called for assistance which was supposed to be included in the package. To my surprise....the wait time was over 60 minutes and I was never helped.....so what did I pay for again? Not sure either.

column1: Also, after shelling out the cash for the Deluxe package at checkout it informed me that because I agreed to pay the $54.99 for Deluxe I also had to pay $39.99 to file my state taxes...oh AND I also had to pay $34.99 to file at all because I clicked on Deluxe to deduct from the refund. SOOOOOOO my question is, why weren't these fees told to me when I clicked that I would pay the $54.99? Not sure either.
Signed,
FRUSTRATED ALIEN Wait time, unplanned charges

That's an extra $150 I had to pay due to moving and having to file two state returns. I find it very excessive.

column2: using turbo tax for many years and now feel gouged i had a very easy return this year, I feel like the amount you charged for what I received this year to be extremely high. Great Idea Poorly Executed I used to prepare taxes at a CPA firm, so I feel I am pretty aware of what is needed with tax software. Therefore, if you are really focused on the entries you are making and forget to save, it will only recover to the last section finished. This was very irritating when entering my business and rental expenses. Normally, I don't mind using Turbo Tax, but this past year was not impressive to me. Freezes every 5 minutes

Review of Turbo Tax for trusts I'm fairly new to doing trust taxes and using form 1041. Your "easy step" for the 1041 is basically useless. It assumes you already know exactly what you are doing. If I knew what I was doing I would not need easy step. The easy step for the 1040 is better. Easy step is not helpful at all, other tax guidance not much better.

Blood suckers $60 for a very easy filing procedure. I must be very, very lazy. Program sort of tricks you into paying more. Free federal actually means $29 to import last year's data and $29 to do state taxes and if you want to deduct fees from the refund they CHARGE YOU ANOTHER $34. It took me forever to figure out how to change that and pay the fee with my credit card. If it wasn't 8:00pm on the last day to file, I'd go print it and find a post office. I keep forgetting this is a bit of a racket.

column1: I may have a different opinion if I had a more complicated return but for the simple stuff I am an idiot for paying $60 just to save an hour of my time plus a trip to the post office. Expensive, difficult to change

column2: worst TurboTax filing in 10 years just the worst filing I've ever experienced and I've been using turboTax on line for years. State tax filing wrongly listed as free Both the federal and my state's websites say my state e-filing through TurboTax should be free based on my status and income level. However, at the end of the TurboTax process it wanted to charge me $29.99 for state. I waited over an hour to speak to someone at TurboTax. She said the free offer expired two weeks prior to the tax deadline and she will email me a special code to over ride the fee since I pointed out that an expiration is not disclosed anywhere in writing. Turns out the code didn't work either so I'll do state taxes the old fashioned mail-in paper way. Very disappointed.
TurboTax2015  Answers to questions could be improved with screen shot examples rather than just text.
Poor service Final forms printing with "X"s in the wrong boxes. On the 1099Q, page 2, 2nd section, #1 "No" should be checked and instead, the box on line 2 is checked (see attached.)

column1: After contacting support online, I was supposed to get a call back in 95 minutes. Several hours later I still had not received the call and checked my email. Six hours after my initial contact, I had gotten an email telling me that there was a problem with the phone system. I followed the instructions to call back in and the recording stated that there was a 15 minute wait. 55 minutes later I am still waiting for a human being to answer and have e-filed in the meantime due to the deadline. If the IRS has a problem with this return it is all on TT. I want my $ back for this so-called service! No support and inaccuracies

column2: Just buy Stuff just trying to file my taxes at the last min. but wait all my tax return was eaten up by not having health insurance but pay 30$, 50,$ or 70$. I did it for free but i had to click 17 decline buttons first. buy stuff you dont need

additional fees additional fees adds to the sickening experience of filing taxes!! Is an extra $30.00 worth ripping off honest tax payers, just can't make it fast enough. TURBO TAX SUX!! see you next year--lol

Disappointed After completing my draft taxes as married filling jointly, I felt that I needed to verify whether filling separately is the better way to go. This is extremely challenging using turbo tax to the point it's likely more easy doing the taxes by hand. I am thoroughly disappointed in the user interface for this option and I will not be using TurboTax in the future. After going through the arduous process I discovered it did indeed save us more money to file separately (even though TurboTax supposedly guarantees the best savings). Without an overhaul to the option for this filing I will not be using TurboTax again. Very challenging for married filing separately
Sheesh! This software gets more annoying every year. I think I'll just send the messages to the spam file after today. all the darn whining for $30 despite saying its FREE
Yes, it is easy to use. I will be trying another system next year due to the annoying CONSTANT prompts pushing the user to "upgrade". Just greedy and annoying. Expensive and constant prompts to...

Sneaky Extras It took me a while to go through and enter all the information and at the end of it all, as i'm ready to file, turbo tax tells you how much you owe them, it is advertised as (free federal, or free state) what they dont tell you is that they will tac on extra charges here and there that add up to $100! I chose Turbo Tax because i'm a young newlywed with 2 vehicles as our only assets. I did not expect it to be mor thatn the advertised 29.99, it was just so frustrating that after all the time i spent on the taxes i had to go back and try to find where they added on these charges so that i could eliminate them. all the little add on's they try to get you to purchase
Rip off Charges a ton of money so you can print out your own tax forms and send them in yourself. what a waste of effort and money.

column1: Won't send in both state and federal forms without charging you extra, good luck if you have to file in multiple states. Also, won't send in state taxes at the same time as Federal taxes when they charge you to do it yourself.
More effort than it is worth and cost me more money. Had to mail in by own return myself and paid Turbotax a ton of money for that privilege.

column2: 2015 Turbo Tax did not import my 2014 information.

column1: I could not find where to deduct my $18,000 of health insurance premiums. for this reason I already know i'll need to file an amended return.
Very unsatisfactory this year. The product has changed.
I was unable to access the schedules until it was time to print.
not good. Failed to import last year.

column2: Customer Loyalty There are so many new, easy ways to file. TurboTax should reward long-time customers with discounted prices. It's too expensive. too expensive

Extra Hidden Fees I am disappointed in the extra fees. I received an email from TurboTax saying I could file my federal and state for free, I had to pay for state. Also pay another fee to allow them to deduct all the other fees from federal return. Plus the fee to file my 401k which I have already paid penalty on!!!! Fees Fees Fees

Terrible Service and System I logged on to file my taxes, I get to the end where I have to pay the fee. I go to enter my card and it says it cant verify the card. I try another card, it says the same thing, I try a 3rd card and again doesn't work. I call and wait on hold for 50min+. This women gets on the phone and seems to have NO IDEA what she is doing, I spend another hour waiting on hold after hold with her trying to say its my internet. In the end still didn't know what was happening or how to fix it. I am never using Turbo Tax again. I will be sure to tell all my friends how terrible it is. System and Customer Service
UGH Although Turbo Tax says there is a free edition. It's not! And if you all are going to charge that $30 then just be upfront about it. Please and thank you. It's not actually free

I did these taxes for my multiply disabled son who is in a day program. It cost me almost $100 to file for an annual income of about $1600. Really! There must be another way or at least exceptions for people who make such an incredibly small income.

column1: I paid for my Turbo tax return also - expensive day cost

column2: Could always use improvement I would like to see the tool be able to review the answers I have entered without having to answer them again. If I click on something it should be there when I go back to it. Better forms management and selection save

Some pros and cons The new credit card fee this year is ridiculous. I guess they want you to sign up for that new card or else. If I hadn't waited so long to file, I would have looked for an alternative. The rates and hidden fees

TOOK TOO MUCH MONEY FROM MY TAXES Too expensive, please stop adding such pricey fees! I had no idea what the $34.99 ADDITIONAL FEE was at the end??? TOO MUCH MONEY< LITTLE DETAILS OF WHAT THE "FEES" were. TOO SNEAKY

Premium benefits? Not a fan of getting hit with a $39.99 charge at the last minute. Obviously, I waited until the last minute to finish my taxes but my costs more than doubled and to have the ~$40 charge added is not how you keep customers.

Do not file online I was so upset when I had to pay for federal, state, and then without stating they charge to take your fees from your refund 34.99. You can buy programs or use other online programs or go to H&R block for cheaper. Next year I am back to paper and pencil. Its not worth the cost to have to take a little longer. They charge you without your knowledge
Absurd price to buy and file 1. Huge price increase last year.

column1: 2. Why $25 to file state returns? another ripoff?
3. There is nearly free tax prep software now. Buy it instead. not enough detail in some areas, overpriced

column2: i really hate that you use money to lobby to make paying taxes harder for people who have basic filings.

column1: its a real bummer.

column2: Too Much All said and done I spent 100.00 to file. I could have taken them locally for 59.00. I should have done just that, but I had already spent an hour of my time filing. Too many fees

Government Rips me off--Turbo Tax does the same Way too expensive; and deceptively so. $34.99 for Federal, $54.99 for State, then another 39.99 to electronically file!! Outrageous!! Had I not waited until the last minute I would have continued your highway robbery scam!! Way too expensive when all is added up
Gave me a headache YOUR FORMAT LIMITS ME FROM WRITING A CLEAR REVIEW When I entered my tax exempt information my AGI jumped about $700 and I couldnot find the reason for that jump.
SCAM To the MAX HORRIBLE stay AWAY use a CPA it is probably the same price. No really help provided and horrible state application

simple but pricey once i was almost finished completing my return, it told me I HAD to upgrade to deluxe $49.99 and then charged me an additional $34.99 to take the fee from my refund....outrageous. Going back to taxact. fees

corrections this is the 1st time in 20 years that I have had issues with this program. as with many thousands that have mineral rights, your program gave little or no clear direction in entering. Had to look up on IRS site. and when I entered something wrong it was impossible to go back and correct. I turned it in wrong. so.... if it get questioned... thanks.... maybe help would be nice in the direction in how to correct. does not let you correct a address on the 1099misc

Fees While fees are expected, federal is advertised as free. I feel the fees for an ez form is too high for a simple form. You get caught up in the free federal and feel you have to go ahead and pay for the state. High fees
commercials swear its free but i ended up having to pay over $60 to file, screw you turbo tax
Way too expensive. I found out that at my income level i could have filed through NY's H&R Block free federal and state

somewhat ok could not go to form to review info. Very difficult to sign in had to change passwords numerous times even though I wrote them down. very frustrating. this has never happen before and I have used turbo tax for years. even checking remember me never worked couldn't edit or find worksheets or forms. same with state return

Poor experience I have been using your product for over ten years. This is the worst version yet. It was clunky. there was no way to get immediate help. There was no online tech support. to get assisance. After I filed electronically, a very very tedious processthis year. I was told I would still have to print, sign, and maila copy to the "government" It did not specify whether it meant fed or state gvt. The print function did not work. I was able to print on a subsequent page. The instructions did not give a mailing address for the forms to be sent. Idont know whether the return has been properly filed. Over all a very unpleasant experience Very clunky this year. Did not convert to pdf properly,no way to get personalized help
Easy but sucks This thing takes wayyyyyy too much money that should not have been taxed in the first place. I do not recommend going to this site. takes all of your money.
I feel like I might as well have paid someone to do this with the price charged by Turbo tax. Turbo tax falsely advertises and I will not use this service next year

No longer like this product I only know what my forms say, so when you ask specific questions I do not know the answer, i.e. which Morgan Stanley, it is no where on my form 1099. Had a great difficulty understanding the foreign investment part, based on Morgan Stanley investments. Can't find things. I want a help that will take me to a specific place, i.e. car registration tax for Colorado, etc. The harder my tax return gets, the smaller the advantage to using Turbo Tax is.
good and bad i like the program, but since I am somewhat familiar with taxes I found the walk through a bit slow.

column1: Also, I would prefer to be able to see the actual tax return once a section is completed. For example, when all income has been entered I would like to see the income section of the actual 1040. This may help me remember other income items. Never shows the actual tax return form, Would like to have more "tips" or explanations of tax return sections.

column2: Awful for Seniors Found an error in Turbo's way of dealing with Social Security. It would not let me efile with my corrections. Had to file the wrong way and pay more taxes. Since this is the 11th hour I will have to send an amended return at a later date (done by hand). How AWFUL!! Will not let you e file a return unless it is done Turbos way.

What Happened?! I have LOVED TurboTax for years - so I was appalled and very disappointed at how greedy and difficult this year's new format was. At multiple steps throughout the process, it forced me to purchase higher costing tax filing products, giving me no option but to pay up unless I was willing to start from scratch with all of my information deleted. To add insult to injury, as I was submitting my final taxes - after everything had finished being reviewed and was approved - it did it one last time, forcing me to either upgrade to Deluxe or delete everything that had already been completed. That's slimy behavior and not one I am interested in experiencing again next year. I am extremely disappointed to see a great company succumb to bad business practices and greed.

column1: Bottom line: I have recommended TurboTax for years to all my friends, but after this experience I'm telling them to go elsewhere. So disappointing! Extortionist

column2: Payed for Turbo Tax for no good reason. I filed and was rejected and then I went to re file and it said I then had to pay $29.99. Called to try and figure it out and the guy said there was nothing I or he could do. That the only thing I could do is file and pay the $29.99. So I did. And because of that I will not be using turbo tax anymore. Thats just not good service to someone who has used your product for the past 5 years. And I will no longer be telling people to use turbo tax. Its a shame because I used to really like your product. Had to pay and the guy said he could not help me.

Not pleased this year This year I recommended Turbotax to a friend. He is a real estate agent . I relied on TT to pick the correct format for him and it printed two different filings, one nearly ( but not completely) blank(????) and I was very confused and frustrated at which to file. Being as he owed nothing... we filed the complete version, and then .... TT charged him for a more expensive version, so he paid more than he probably had to to efile a return that he owed no money on...still scratching my head....... worst part is he is hoping we chose correctly. Several of the answers on the forms were not posed directly as a question....does TT extrapolate the answers from the questions they DID ask??? If he owed money...I would be very scared right now. This is why I will probably go with someone else next year and for sure will not recommend this product. It used to seem so easy and TRUSTWORTHY ( I have used TT for the past 8 or so years). Confusing

Nice sneak Was loving everything, until the $34 bank fee for processing a direct deposit request. Really felt like I was being messed with and like you were trying to sneak one by me. Not cool. Bank processing fee for direct deposit
Like my taxes to expensive I won't use again, more expensive than all other online solutions. expensive, excessive charge to direct deposit

Could be better The program is easy to use and explains things well, but there shouldn't be a separate fee to file state taxes. Make it all, one upfront cost. Otherwise it feels like robbery on top of the taxes. Way overpriced

Disappointed loyal customer I have been a loyal TurboTax customer for nearly 30 years, basically from the PS2 3-1/2 floppy disk days. And I have been quite satisfied in general by the program; tried others but always came back. But until this year I never felt that I was being ripped off by TurboTax. I made the mistake of buying a Deluxe CD, not realizing that it did not include the 1 free state tax prep as had been the case with all the other previous TurboTax programs I have ever used. Instead it seems that there are two different deluxe versions, one with the free state and one without. So I was blindsided by the $45 charge to download a state program on top of the federal program I had previously bought. $45!!! That nearly doubled the cost of the program for me, whereas if I had been smart I could have bought the combination CD for far less than the total I paid. That to me is just greed on Intuit's part, catching the incautious customer in a bind and then making them to pay a ridiculous premium price. This on top of last year's messing with the files and taking forms out of the Deluxe federal tax program that had always been there. So what's up Intuit? Have the bean-counters taken over to the point that you have to gouge us customers with whatever means necessary?? You have come very close to losing a loyal customer with all of these shenanigans. Please cut us a break and offer more moderate and FAIR prices for the state download! Ridiculously high charge for doing a state return

meh When you attempt to upset me, it shakes my trust. Also, there are were several times when I was not allowed to enter information. Fields would be missing, I never entered my rent for instance. hate the upsells, confusing and unethical
shouldn't exist http://www.warren.senate.gov/taxday/ shouldn't exist
Not over impressed. May use it again but need to find a state return system that I am not charged to use.

Disappointed at added charge I was very happy with my service with Turbotax in the past and have been using this service for many years. This year while filing I was offered the Max Defense multiple times which I declined. After working on my refund many times I finally logged back in to pay for my refund and only saw the charges for my federal and state. I entered my account info and paid then when I read my receipt I realized that I paid an additional $50 for a service that I had declined many times. If I somehow approved it that was totally by accident and when you search for help on how to get it removed the answer is that you can't. This is very disappointing to me since I have been a loyal customer for so long and am not happy that I paid $50 for a service that I never wanted. I love the ease of use but will not be using this service again if I have to worry about the potential of accidentally being charged for something I had previously declined and then not having the option to have it refunded. Added fee

it sucked The sad thing is that I couldn't get any help. I tried the help link and it really wasn't helpful. Your company really needs to look at how it operates. I wonder how much business you've lost out on. this prossess was so difficult

Expensive and didn't have the advice that I needed $104 is far too much to pay for a do-it-yourself solution. I needed the most expensive version because I had stock purchased in an employee stock purchase plan and the company was acquired by another in a stock and cash transaction. Turbo Tax did not have the advice that I needed - I had to find instructions for adjusting my basis by hand. At that price, I could have gotten a professional to do my taxes for me. This is probably my last year filing with Turbo Tax. Not a good value
Pro:Easy Online process

column1: Con:Price increased this year

column2: Unfairly expensive, but convenient. After finding out that I owe the IRS nearly 700 dollars, the last thing i wanted to see was that I needed to spend $145 dollars to file the taxes in the first place.

column1: Just because I'm self employed, I have to pay an extra 105 dollars to file, and because I was getting no federal return there was no option to take from that to pay for it. Expensive, preys on people who don't know how to file

column2: Software and service Software was easy to use, but my tax situation was a bit more complicated. I contract with an outside company who handles my payroll, work comp, etc. My employees aren't leased; they're shared, so I don't have an EIN number. What category do I put this under???? If I enter them as am employee, then I need to provide my EIN. If I put them as contract labor, I need to send them a 10-99. If I put them under miscellaneous expenses, does that increase my risk of audit??? Those were my concerns on the Federal side. On the State side, I employ a veteran, but the payroll is managed by the third party. Do I still get the State tax credit???

column1: I'm not sure that this product was the best fit for my business needs. What made matters worse was that when I needed assistance figuring these things out, I couldn't find a phone number anywhere! Without any other recourse, I put in a "ticket" for customer service via TurboTax Home & Business. I received an order number and a message stating that someone would contact me with-in 45 minutes. Well...4 hours later and still no phone call! NOT GOOD! Especially on April 18th!!!
In their defense, there was one other time in March that I requested support for a assistance and this was provided in a timely fashion.

lastly, when my tax return was declined due to a faulty entry of a Social Security number (my bad), I was appreciative to receive an e-mail, but disappointed at the lack of guidance. Of course, the e-mail boasted assistance at no additional cost, but even then, no phone number was provided. I walked myself through the editing process, which was not nearly as intuitive as one might hope.

I got the rejection e-mail at 9 pm on 04/18. I mean, is there still time to file by mail?? If so, do I include a check, or will the electronic payment I requested still go through??? And what if it doesn't go through? Do I get penalized? Help!!! How do I fix this issue??? The answer: figure it yourself because TurboTax isn't going to help you!!!!
At the end of the day, I made it through...At least, I think I did. I think. I am still waiting on the second attempt at processing the return, so I guess the result is still unknown.

Overall, the software was great for uncomplicated situations, no so good for more robust scenarios. Also, don't' hold your breath for help that may never come. File early, or don't use the program. That's my advice. Customer support

column2: Pricing Deceiving when you first start they should tell you how much they are going to charge you at the end its ends up being triple the price price decieving

I hate taxes I always feel like a complete and utter moron when filing taxes. Last year with TT I felt pretty smart, but this year I returned to idiocy. Last year, TT told me what I could deduct and they encouraged me to list things. This year they didn't, but they did compare my deductions this year to last, with a difference of $250! What changed?! Why didn't TT help me figure it out. I feel bummed that I'm paying so much more this year, when my deductions should be the same. That's not really TT's fault, but I'm bummed regardless. For some reason I didn't have as many deductions, and TT didn't tell me how to change that.

More Expensive Every Year! Over the past two years, I have had to use a more complex tax return due to contracting work. I am very unhappy with the site's treatment of this. They are maximizing their profits even though they are still only filing one form. Also, there is little warning that there will be an extra 34.99 charged when you pay the amount through your tax return. I had to go back through and change it to pay now. I will be filing my taxes With another site next year. I won't be wasting my money on this website. You have lost a customer! The price of the product and the lack of improvements of the site over the last 5 years.
Taxes! I choose not to get the "extra help" but when I got ready to pay i was charged charged for something I didn't want

It works, but could be better Every time there is an update, the software wants you to start over from scratch. Your previously entered data is still there, but you have to find your way back to where you had previously left off. Every update takes you back to square 1.

dishonest The website says file your taxes for $29.99, somehow by the end of it I paid $94 and change. WTF?! I couldn't change the pricing options once I got to the page with pricing, so DOUBLE WTF?! 2015 will be the last year I file taxes with TurboTax. Go straight to H3LL. deceptive pricing

Only useful for simple returns I have an unusual type of income and TurboTax made it almost impossible for me to enter it correctly. It also misled me as to how to file patent income, which has cost me hundreds of dollars over the past few years. If you have a simple return, just do it yourself. If you have something complicated, pay someone and avoid the headache. Almost impossible to use for unusual tax situations

There is no such thing as free Just start with the deluxe. They will make you pay any ways and it will be a huge waste of your time. They design it so you can get your taxes done without at least paying $60 for federal and $30 for state. pricing games, non working discount codes

Don't Trust It You would think that spending $125 would get you a program that actually functioned. Not only are the instructions so bad that you have to go off the Turbo Tax site to get help, but even if you figure it out and follow the instructions all the way through- up to and including being told that your return has been submitted successfully - don't believe it.

column1: An hour or so after you file the return (and have taken any envelopes to the post office and mailed them) you'll get an email from Turbo Tax saying that your return has been rejected.

In my case it was a pin number problem and the website that TurboTax sent me to was "unavailable". When I returned to my file, and went through all the steps that the Turbo Tax "help" center (what a laughable term) said to go through, it just double filed my federal return. Waiting now for the second rejection. Thanks for nothing Turbo Tax. Not accurate

column2: Much Improved - Not Worth the Cost This product has GREATLY improved over the previous editions of the "Deluxe" product. A much better process flow has been implemented that asks simple questions which better explain themselves when trying to evaluate what data to enter. The "more info" sections were also effectively helpful. I was never stressed or scream in frustration.

column1: However, at a cost of nearly $150.00 to process a standard deduction return without any bells and whistles. I find myself reaching for the telephone to make an appointment with H&R Block next year. These costs were also assessed in an underhanded manner by non-disclosure until the end of the process with the only options to accept or destroy the return created.
Thanks, but I'll be taking my future business elsewhere. No information import, Cost

column2: TurboTax rocked me Turbotax was fairly easy to submit a return, but at every turn they sure did want to add pro advice for money, which in the end was useless. Every 5 seconds they wanted to add something for $54.99
There was a hidden fee of $35 to deduct the TT fees from the return that I was not expecting. Cost me $135 after FREE

First and Last Time Using TurboTax I've used TaxAct to file my taxes every year for the last 10 years and have never had a problem. For some reason, I decided to try TurboTax this year and it was a horrible experience. I will say that the first time through it was pretty easy to input the data. However, it started adding random things that it wouldn't let me remove, like an additional state return and a form for a credit I received in the past and both were completely unnecessary. Making changes to the tax forms outside of the wizard is so unintuitive that I had google how to remove them. It also messed up one of my children's SSN's and caused my return to get rejected. Somehow the information on the actual tax form that I saved was correct, but it managed to change one digit in one of the SSNs in the data that was submitted during e-filing. And the kicker...all of this cost me $145!!!! WTF??? I've NEVER paid more than $50 to file both federal and state, but to have paid this much for a horrible experience is completely unacceptable. The only reason I didn't do my taxes over in TaxAct is because I was in the process of moving and doing a lot of traveling during tax season. I will be ACTIVELY encouraging everyone I know to stay far away from TurboTax and migrate over to TaxAct. Insane price, corrections buried in menus, random errors
Overpriced, been a loyal customer this is THE most I've paid to do my own taxes. Very verpriced will be looking for another way to fil next yr.

Misleading Misleading signup page and constant prompts to purchase the *Deluxe* or *Premier* versions. I ultimately purchased the deluxe package because I had $5 in capital gains. After discounts I paid $45 for that.

column1: I had to fill out the forms twice, because I must have hit the premier version at some point and there's apparently no going back from that.
I now have a splitting headache. I bumped the stars from 1 to 2 because I guess it's done? Misleading tactics, time consuming

column2: Questionable Turbo Tax should be amendable as for as the payment is concern...if I'm asked to use Premier, but, at the end, it was not worth it, I should not be charge to use it. Amount to pay
Expensive Likely last time I will use this site. Just too expensive. For the price, why not just pay someone to do it for you?
Pretty simple to do. It is fairly easy to do, but was not happy to see an additional $34.99 charge once I got to the end. Too late to back out after you went through the whole process.

column1: Not very good customer service approach. hidden charges once you get through the wole things

column2: Ridiculous Fees When someone ends up owing money, having Turbotax add on an additional $90, just because I was legally obligated to file certain paperwork, the fees are just a slap in the face. Takes Advantage with Fees

Good information provided.... Buuuutttttt!!!!!!!! I liked that it was very step by step and very intuitive... but I felt like you really socked the fees to me... I actually tried going on to another site to file once I saw how many fees you tagged on. Absolutely insane!!!!! I WILL NOT use this site next year!

not as good as prior years I didn't get the same feel of security this year. there were several hints that made no sense. The were a couple links that went no where. I just didn't get the same 100% secure feeling that I normally get. I'll give turbo tax one more year. I hope that secure feeling comes back. This year, I got less of a feel that everything was taken care of,
It's the 21st Century - This should be easier I've been using TurboTax for 16 years now but some things are driving me up the wall. I'll focus on AMT and Filing Status.

column1: I paid AMT for my 2014 taxes and for 2015 TurboTax is saying I might save on my taxes for this year if I recalculate my 2014 AMT - seems easy enough but it requires TurboTax 2014 to be loaded onto my computer. I lost my 2014 disk so I can't do that so my alternative is manual which really means I'm not doing it. Here's how I see it, I paid for 2015 and if recalculation of 2014 AMT is part of 2015 filing then that should have been included in the software by default. I shouldn't need be asked by the software if I want to do this calculation, it should be done automatically - it's the 21st century...

Second issue and in my mind an even bigger issue. TurboTax made the wrong recommendation for filing status. It recommended that I file married filing separately where in reality I saved almost $200 by filing jointly. The only reason I caught that is because I manually calculated my taxes and my wife's taxes with different filing statuses. I try it married filing separately, married filing jointly and alternating our son as a dependent between my wife and I. Here is what I expect from software in the 21st century; TurboTax should take all of our information for my wife and I, run every permutation automatically and ONLY AFTER I submit all of the information tell me what my tax liability is for every single permutation and make a recommendation based on those results. Don't worry, I don't care if it's 400 permutations, I will read them all if it's laid out in a nice tabular format. Poor job determining filing status & AMT

column2: Will no longer use Turbo Tax I have used Turbo Tax for over 12 years. You have grown. Your customer service has not. Your inability to respond to your failure of credit card processing is a huge failure.

column1: There was a glitch in your system. You did not own it. Your customer service team was rude, unprofessional, and simply stopped answering the phone.
Huge, unbelievable, FAIL!!!
I doubt that I will use Turbo Tax in the future. Technology has failed. Can not process credit-card for e-file

column2: FREE ends up costing $130, for a simple return Gave 3 star rating because overall you can file your own taxes from home, but in my opinion should be an option for simple return. Take a simple thing like transferring information from one paper to a computer and make a 2 hr ordeal because of 1mil irrelevant questions. Would recommend to people with half a brain, just make sure your using right half or, oh the butterflies... 1 million irrelevant questions that ended up costing me more money
decent I didn't like how I felt tricked into paying 40 bucks because I wanted to pay using my federal refund, then I noticed it charged me 39.99 for this service. cost
Not clear on how to file an amendment. Too much time spent trying to figure it out. Makes me what my accountant back. No 1040Ex at the end of the proceee
Easy, but almost as expensive as paying someone... Getting Expensive

Hidden Charges. NOT WORTH IT! It said it will cost only $29.99 and I end up paying $59.99. I absolutely do not recommend using this due to the dishonesty and hidden fees they don't disclose upfront You will be charged at least extra $29.99 and no way you can escape it. And they don't tell you in advance.
Mediocre I believe your products are way over priced Ex compared to Tax Act your pricing is doubled Wish I would have discovered that before I completed on your site Pricing

Extra Fees That Feel Sneaky... I've used Turbo-Tax for years- and it's pretty much the same general user experience except: They've gotten really good at sneaking in "extras" and not really explaining if you need them or not. However, when you're in a hurry, and you just want to get through this (and I have a feeling they know this) well, Turbotax has become like that shiney new car you want- the next thing you know, you're paying A LOT more than you set out to when it comes time to signing on the dotted line.

column1: I believe next year I'll be giving the competition a serious look. Add-on Services with High Fees

column2: OK'd this tax thing Why do I have to do this, this is the worst CON!!! No E-fill for state

I had to force it to file Schedule C I had to force this software to file Schedule C. I had to go back and force it to file Schedule C, then erase all of my expenses and retype them into the Schedule C by hand. It doesn't do complex tasks unless you force it.
wont use again I spent over 20 hours inputting my tax info and it cost more with less reassurance than H&R Block This is my last year of Turbo Tax pricing more than H&R block
Meh... I've used all of the return software. This was not the best. Not as quick and easy as I would like.

Overselling I wanted to file my federal income quickly. Had to make a call to the help desk(took 20 minutes) to remove one of their upsales. Would be nice if they designed it in such a way that it was that it removed and not distracting during filing. Overselling

Turbo Tax and Home Ownership Hint/Explain buttons could use more detailed explanation for first time homebuyers. It would also be helpful to list required paperwork in advance of completing this section. Confusing for 1st Year Homebuyers

Hidden Fees!!!!!!!!! You state that it is going to be $29.99, then do not give me an option and say in order to file my federal returns correctly, it's going to cost me an extra $54.99. You also ask me if I want to pay the fee through my returns but don't tell me it's going to cost an extra $34.99 until the very end. This was A LOT different than last year. This was not done to me then and will not be done to me in the future because I will not be using your services again. The hidden fees were ridiculous Hidden Fees!!!!

Recommended A+ previous yrs, 2 complaints this yr I used to highly recommend Intuit TurboTax, especially the online web-based service, every year since I started using in a decade ago. Most parts of the service are the same or improved. However, a new disturbing trend has emerged: bundling of questionable third-party products you cannot easily opt out of and the requirement to give out sensitive personal data to said third parties. Specifically: Audit Defense is unavailable without agreeing to sign up for IDNotify and share your private information with them. It is advertised as a positive feature, that users are being "given" a free "bonus" for signing up, however it amounts to selling the user's personal data to a third party at the user's expense. IDNotify is not a bonus, it is the lowest bidder contracted to provide compensatory services to government employees who had their identity stolen from government servers in that recent fiasco. You can read the reviews from dissatisfied government employes online. This would not be a complaint, except that users are required to sign up for IDNotify to purchase Audit Defense. Intuit, please stop abusing your loyal and paying customers. If it weren't for the previous years of good service and respect for the Intuit founder, I wouldn't even be here writing a review, I would just have stopped using TurboTax products and gone with competitors or a CPA.

column1: Other minor complaints:

System requirements state plainly that Safari 5 on MacOS 10.6 is supported, however it gives the browser not supported message when partway through preparing your return. If I didn't have another system handy I would have been stuck, but many other users might not have that luxury. True that it gets harder to support more and more systems, especially older ones, but good service shouldn't just be for the wealthy and technically-inclined. Mostly this complaint is about the page that says it isn't supported linking directly to a page that says it IS supported. Strange coming from a company known for its good user interface...

Also, seems to be less and less support for downloading older returns and the associated paperwork. Used to be everything was available, but now seems only PDFs of the return itself for previous years. The whole point of choosing the web service over the desktop version (for me, at least) was I could get to my records any time, any place, even if a catastrophic event wiped out all my hardware and backups. If you want to amend a return or even just review the calculations used to generate it (which is ALOT of information that doesn't make it onto the return, but can be needed later), you must download the desktop version (again, with similar system requirements problems listed as in the complaint above). This, to me, defeats the entire purpose of having the web service. Why not just use the desktop version from the start if you're going to be stuck with it later no matter what?

I used to trust Intuit with something as sensitive and mission-critical as tax information because they were consistent year-to-year, provided intelligently chosen services, showed a long-term view, made visible effort towards security and privacy, gave attention to quality and efficiency in user-interface design, and all around behaved like a reputable and built-to-last company even in the face of rapid technological changes. I hope the above problems are corrected, not just because of the problems themselves, but because the pattern suggests a transition to the fly-by-night, short-term thinking that has infected other industries but really isn't sustainable when dealing with something trust-oriented like tax preparation. Bundling 3rd party privacy risks, and undocumented browser requirements

column2: See cons above. I am a 16 year old student. I got $2.00 back and had to have my Mom pay you $60.00 to file. Not good.

Disappointed in online purchase of tax program I have been a customer of TurboTax for over 6 years. I usually buy a CD, but last year I purchased the software online. I always purchase Home and Business, which allows me to do the tax return for our small business, as well as my 3 kids tax returns for no extra charge.

column1: This year I purchased the same program again, but the way the software was sold I was under the impression I was purchasing the download version. Unfortunately, it was just the online version. After I prepared and submitted my daughter's taxes, I was unable to do a second tax return. That was when I discovered that the "online" version only permitted one tax returned. I called customer support and was told since the taxes were already submitted there was no way to switch to the download version. As a result, I had to pay for the same software program twice. That is completely unacceptable. There should have been a warning at the time I chose the product that it only allowed one tax return. Hopefully next year the software purchase page will be more clear. Online version does not allow for multiple tax returns

column1: That aside, I really, really wish my friends at Intuit would either put this product on the Web or port it to Mac OS X. Of the four hours it took me to prepare my tax return this year, about a third was involved in getting the TurboTax Business product running on my Windows 7 virtual machine under VMware Fusion. Indeed, this is about the only thing I require Windows for - and every year, I dread installing the new version (but not as much as I dread visiting the accountant). TurboTax Business is only for Windows

column2: State form review unsatisfactory. And other items If I were able to actually view my state form in TurboTax, I would have paid for the state form preparation. But I will NOT submit a state tax return if I cannot see it first, so that I can check on a few details. In my opinion, NO one should do so. TurboTax should advise the taxpayer of this situation BEFORE beginning the state tax process. Another thing, below you ask for more details. For "Your Family," TurboTax asks "Do you have kids?" That question needs to be more precise, in order for me to determine relevance. I have two kids, aged 40 and 42. Who cares? But if I answer "No," then I'm denying the existence of my (adult) kids. You should define "kids" or explain the relevance. Finally, I think it is ridiculous for you to provide the option to upload a personal image along with this review, because there is absolutely no value in doing so. Waste of time and ill-advised. Turbotax does not let the tax payer see the state form before filing.

Spent well over an hour on the phone with a really incompetent tech help who kept putting me on hold trying to get help. Then after an hour of making no progress she disconnected me while I was on hold. Had to call again and start again. This time the tech person just purchased it for me with my credit card information. Solved the problem but the solution was about 20 years out of date - give my personal credit card information to someone over the phone and let them manually do it for me?! What kind of technology company is this? Then this evening I am submitting the taxes online. Of course, I need to pay for two states for the e-filing. The TurboTax software sent me to pay for the state filing and the same thing happened again. A window pops up immediately telling me I have "timed out" and does not let me have online access to pay. I called in again but this time the recording told me I would have to wait for over an hour! The only alternative was to pay another $34.99 to have the funds withdrawn from my account. INTUIT SHOULD DO THE RIGHT THING AND REFUND THIS ADDED $34.99 WHICH IS AN INSULT TO INJURY. I am so disgusted I am going to look for another way to do my taxes next year. A glitch in the software meant a loss of time and money!

column2: Grrrrr! Your pricing is ridiculous. Every year your cost gets higher and higher. I kept declining the extra services but ANYTHING outside of someone who is SINGLE with no deductions ends up paying $29.99, and if they want to add State, it's another $29.99, and then if you happen to wait last minute to do your taxes, like a LOT of people do......you find all this out at the END of doing your taxes. For those who don't have almost $60.00 at that point, TURBOTAX will offer to take it out of your tax return, for ANOTHER FEE of $34.99!! You guys CHARGE YOUR CUSTOMER to PAY YOU out of our own tax return. I was annoyed with the $60.00 at the end, but when I saw you charged $34.99 to for me to allow you to take your fee out of my return.......that.......well, it's pretty greedy IMO. A lot of people depend on their tax returns for financial relief, or go on treat themselves ONCE a year, and for you to rake them over the coals with charge after charge, it's ridiculous. Anyway, a little ticked off on the surprise charges but outside of that.......your software is simple and convenient to use. Expensive

I went on-line and Googled TurboTax Suport. 800 number worked, but 3 hours from deadline and an estimated 30 minute wait. This did give me time to calm down and explore the intereface. I had gotten back to the payment method on the menu bar, and changed payment method to a credit card. No More Problems.

The no option part is extremely low on ur part..... get the customer to the end mislead them up to that point then f... em with another 35 charge which they have to pay or all the work that they just di is useless. Screw turbo tax.... I use someone else's service next yea

I was tricked into paying an upgrade fee that i didn't sign up for and there was no confirmation of what I was paying for so thinking I was paying my actual taxes i entered my credit card info. But I was actually being tricked into paying an upgrade fee. Without completing any other transactions I called turbo tax to get a refund and was told I couldn't and that i could enjoy the benefits of the upgrade I didn't want for a year or so. I should've been given a refund and next year I won't be using turbo tax or any other tax system I'll be using a pen and paper. Shady

Not Satisfied FREE! Not free! Just because I wanted to also file my state return they told me I had to pay for my federal return as well! Almost $100 total! I could have paid a better professional for less or the same! Cost not disclosed

Bait & Switch Shakedown I would have been better off just buying software...No free e-filing at all...in fact, serious fees for that free to turbotax filing! hidden mandatory fees that quadruple the costs

First and Last time user So I got this through Uber, was told by turbotax it would be $65 +$36 for state filing, ended up being $85 + $40 for state filing. Right off the bat this obviously irritated me, but I was still in it to win it so I kept going. The first part made sense but then the software kept moving my w2 information into 1099 categories. It did this 4 times, then merged both into one completely new business (that was named something I've never even heard of before) fast forward 2 hours and I finally fix this. Another hour and I'm done. This isn't the worst software I've ever used, but for something that costs money it's a huge FU to consumers. Charged $20 over the already high amount it claimed it would charge me, poor flow

Left out many details I had been very happy with turbo tax, however, this year I am extremely disappointed. I had to have a tax payer id because of fraud, and nowhere in the run through did it ask for one. Than I attempted to file with mine - again all the program asked for - and rejected again. I had to add my wife's taxpayer number.... Than I was rejected again because I haddecided I was going to file my daughters 1040 ez by mail in lieu of additional fees - and because she previously filed - I was reject again and had to send by mail. Next year I will print my own forms on Irs.gov and forgo turbo tax. Skipped details which delayed my returns
The process to do the taxes was quick and easy but the overall price to tell me I owed the IRS was not very good. Price to expensive

Nickel and Dimed to Death! I only use Turbo Tax because there's no better option. Every year they find more ways to get even more money out of this poor college student's pockets. $40 for this, $55 for that, $35 to process my return. Where does it end? Last year they didn't send in my state tax return and I had to pay hundreds in late fees. After speaking with numerous foreigners who have no idea how the US tax code works they refused to even admit they were wrong with picture proof that I had paid for my state return to be filed. This year was just as frustrating. The rest of the process. I am charged for every little thing. I paid over $130.00 in fees when my return is under $400
rocked my pocket book i have used turbo tax for several years and always feel like its too expensive, One tax year I will switch. pricey

Hidden fees Did not give the option to receive a check. Only option was to complete direct deposit. Then there was an additional fee to have the transaction completed. Deceptive and manipulative practices Not very honest

Jacked up the price at the very end! I got to the end of the program and it states e-filing is free but with the Audit Defense costing $59.99 and with this fee deducted from your refund it will cost an additional $59? Expensive and will not support my operating system anymore?

Buggy for 2015 Software was so buggy, had to keep going back to delete forms. Whether it was issue transferring from 2014 or starting it with the Personal version and upgrading to the Business one... don't know. Navigating the various sections was a pain too, just let us go into specific areas instead of doing one question at a time and having to go through a bunch of them just to get back to what we need to change.

column1: When it checks the return at the end finds issue in various forms, just have a link right there to delete the form or jump into the section where we can change the values. At least then if transfer didn't work well we can go through the prompt. Right now you have to manually go back to personal or business and find the right section to redo. Too many bugs and difficult to find sections

column2: FEEL RIPPED OFF! - JOBBED BY GOVERNMENT AND INTUIT I HAVE BEEN A LOYAL TURBO TAX CUSTOMER FOR TEN YEARS. I WAS REALLY DISAPPOINTED WITH THE FEES CHARGED THIS YEAR. NOTHING LIKE FEELING RIPPED OFF BY THE GOVERNMENT AND INTUIT. THANKS FOR THE DOUBLE JOB INTUIT. I NEVER FILE MY TAXES AT THE LAST MOMENT, THIS YEAR I DID, AND WAS HOSTAGE TO YOUR FEES, WHICH BY THE WAY ARE WAY NEAR YOUR TELEVISION ADVERTISEMENTS. I NEVER THOUGHT ABOUT LOOKING AT OTHER TAX PROGRAMS, I WILL NEXT YEAR NO DOUBT. CHARGING TOO MUCH FOR STATE AND E-FILE FEES

bait and switch Work on itemizing for an hour only to be met with a message saying all of the info you input will be deleted and you will start from scratch....unless you buy turbo tax deluxe for 54.99.

column1: Get a refund then hope to just use refund for payment of the "turbotax deluxe" because I refused to go back and re input information that took me so long. Skip through the fine print (mistake) so after I basically finish the e file process it shows my receipt and there is a 34.99 charge for using my refund as a payment method....So I would have had to go alllll the way back to when they ask what payment method to use and re input more information or pay the 34.99 and keep all the info I just spent time putting together.

So, I paid $90 to do my taxes this year....be more clear about what people are paying for, if the free version which I selected at the start does not include "itemizing"...then dont start the prompt getting you to itemize all of your credits and deductions if its not included in the first place.

Im not expecting to get a reply to this but from someone who isnt very educated on taxes I really wish I didnt use you guys again (this did not happen last year). You tricked me into paying $90 more than I should have, that is disappointing considering how large of a company you are.
And why would you not make the $34.99 charge for using your refund to pay for the "deluxe turbotax" more noticeable and advertised? hidden charges

column2: It was okay  hidden fees, different upgrades
The price for the service I accepted increased when I went to file.
disappointed Very disappointed to get ambushed with the extra $34.99

column1: refund processing fee plus the $24.99 for state
should disclose that fee well before the final transmit page
I'm sure i am not the first person to take offense to this tactic glitches trying to add equipment in such c

column2: Costs too much!!! This website is wonderful minus the yearly increase in charges over the last 5 years. i was appalled to find out that i was being charged to take my payment out of my refund, $60 is NOT free! constantly asks me to upgrade my package and charges too much for simple conveniences

not very blind accessible This is probably my last year using TurboTax. It was not user friendly for me and my speech software. also it often only asked one question per screen when it could have saved time and effort by asking more. Not user friendly for blind people

rip off i will never use you again. i have been using you for over ten years. Never again, i have never paid this much to have my Taxes completed by Turbotax. i promise you that i will never use it again. RIP OFF Crooks. have a nice life at the expense of others. none

Great service but very pricey While I did enjoy the simplicity of using TurboTax, I'm not sure the service would be worth coming back to the next tax year. The price option for small business owners and self employed professional is ridiculous. I think I will opt for services like TaxAct next year. Very pricey compared to other services

Really, that much? It seems like I'm playing a freemium game, not filing my taxes. My laziness is the only reason I used TurboTax this year. They seem to get more expensive, and want more money every year. Cheers. And honestly, what are they actually doing? really nickle and diming us now

Hidden Fee I'm not even sure why I bother to use your site. I think...no wait I know from this point forward I will use the services on the military base. At least they look after military members and vets to ensure that we don't have to pay to file taxes. I mean we only serve our country so that you can charge us to take our hard earned money from us. Thank you for that. Hidden Fees of what it cost to file taxes

Talk about shoving added stuff down your throat. Very disappointed that I had to start over and even when I did, the entire time I felt pushed into upgrading. I didn't know I had to pay $30 for importing W2! I found out when I went to efile and pay! When I didn't want it, I had to call to find out how to get rid of it. Turns out I had to clear and start over! TERRIBLE PRACTICE! Will look at other programs next year. NOT COOL TURBOTAX! Too many other folks offering same tools to put up with sneaky tactics like this.

column1: p.s. DON'T call customer service! Talk about rude! Too much sellingNOT telling you importing W2 means you have to pay $30 or start over!

column2: TurboTax got my identity stolen TurboTax sent me an unencrypted email with a direct link to my account that held all of my personal information. Someone filed their taxes using my account and my social security number. That person will now have my social for the rest of my life thanks to this company. They were incredibly unhelpful and uncaring, saying that it was my fault that my identity had been stolen. They were supposed to provide me with resources including a free year of identity theft protection. They have not done so. I will never file with them again. I am so disappointed. This has been a horrible, stressful situation. My identity was stolen due to TurboTax's poor business practices

Couldn't figure out why my federal tax went up Turbo tax was not at all helpful in determining why my federal credits were negligible this year resulting in a much smaller return than last year. This was in spite of having significantly higher donations and significant capital losses. Couldn't figure out why my taxes return was cut in half

Bad for Out of State Rentals I have used Turbo Tax for years with no problems. I have had to work with rental properties and HUD settlement statements for refinancing or purchasing a new home before. This year is the first year I needed Turbo Tax for an out-of-state rental. I needed to list my expenses and assets for depreciation using my final settlement statement. Turbo Tax totally disappointed me. There is too much confusion when it comes to deductions for a rental using the HUD-1 settlement statement. The Turbo Tax Community was pretty much worthless because everyone gave a different answer. When I called for clarification I stayed on the phone for over an hour and got no answer so I hung up. The wait time was supposed to be 50 min. I won't be using Turbo Tax next year! Poor explanation of HUD-1 items for deductions

Worse than previous years They change things up every year which makes it more difficult for the non accountants out there. I itemize every year but this year and last was much harder for me to do without help. For roughly $125 (Filing fees and price of turbo tax included) i could just pay someone to do my taxes for me and save myself the grief. Not as easy as it used to be.

Very Frustrated I cannot believe how many times I needed to sign about an upgrade. Now I have to check by credit card so I don't get multiple charges can't believe how many times I was asked to upgrade

Very sloppy This program use to be a lot more precise, accurate, legitimate, secured etc. Granted how many times it advertise how improved and better it is. Regardless of me using this program for a couple years in the past and now this last use for my 2015 return has really disappointed me not seeing the refund I am use to seeing. I don't feel secure using it as far as the security of personal info is processed. This program would process big bird and mickey mouse and then tell you it reviewed everything 100% and everything looks good but if you upgrade to max, we will secure your info but max has the exact same benefits as the recommended standard. My taxes have become a little more intense this last year so I would not recommend this for you. This program has become very sloppy, (Be careful). by the end I ended up paying about $100.00 just to file when I owed which was a H&R Block rate. This is definitely the last time I will ever consider using turbotax. I am sure there was an error or two with my returns but my time has exceeded and had to file

Better than HR Block but still needs work Last year I used TurboTax Online and it was expensive. This year I went with the CD-ROM version which is cheaper than TT Online and is the only non-online version that supports both PC and Mac.

column1: Filling out the federal tax return was mostly a breeze, except for entering my K-1 info which is never explained clearly enough in the software and requires referencing IRS documents.
E-filing the federal return went smoothly.

Unfortunately, the state return was a nightmare. It imported incomplete information from the federal return and did not properly guide me through the missing info. I ended up getting prompts that had blanks which were not filled in, like "Is this for?" I'm not sure if it was referencing a year or a person or what. Even worse it only prompted me once total, not once for myself and once for my wife.

When I clicked all the way through, it said it found errors but it wouldn't guide me through them properly. I ended up having to switch to form view instead, which pretty much made the entire exercise of using the software pointless because I could have just as easily filled out the forms by hand, and would have felt more confident that everything was filled out correctly. Still had to reference IRS website for K1 instructions, State return did not properly import data, prompts were broken

column2: good tool . there could still be some simplifying  At the beginning, I was confused by the format& started inputting in info in the wrong place & it really threw me for a
first time filing my taxes by myself I thought to file taxes was free, but at the end, I was charged $29.99 + taxes for state taxes. i am unclear why it wasn't completely free
YOU SUCK  Make up information, no option to edit incorrect info

Seriously? I purchased Turbotax Deluxe at the local Costco. Shame on me for not reading it now does not include the state tax form. Boom I get charged $44 for the state tax form which I could swear said at the time it included state eFile. Boom I go to eFile my state and you want another $25? Seriously... over $100 to purchase Turbo Tax Deluxe, the MD state form and an eFile for state. WOW... I feel so violated. Nickel and dime me to death
not goodnone We will never use this again! everything sucks

Couldn't efile because healthcare area is wrong! Healthcare questions are incorrect. There should be an option for a person with dependents to claim one person as having healthcare under Obamacare while the dependents are covered by their other parent under a work place plan. They are still my dependents but their insurance is provided by my ex-spouse. No option to indicate that so everyone had to clumped under Obamacare and the social security numbers did not match the 1095-A form. This prohibited me from filing electronically. No way to get around it. Healthcare area is not correct

Gets the Job Done Overall, it's a quick easy process to file your taxes. Getting deeper into it, it will ask you to upgrade to the non-free version every other page. Last year i paid for the lowest level and saw no difference in my tax refund compared to the free version. There are also some parts of the US tax code that are not exactly clear when going through turbo tax (re: ira contributions). self-promotion and promises

Beware of price!! The price was way too much for my basic taxes with no way to make changes. I have used Turbo Tax for years and this is the first year I needed to use the simplest form but didn't realize the price until the end. Very deceiving and disappointing! I will NOT use TurboTax in the future. Overpriced!!!

Home Business Difficult To Use I bought home and business because I purchased a home this year. The documentation said I could deducted loan origination expenses, but the program had no way I found to do so. In business for the schedule C there is no way I found for the program to allow me to deduct the simple home office deduction on form 8829, There is a space on the form, but Turbo Tax doesn't allow for its use. Would not let me go back and correct some errors
Fock turbo tax Waited an hour on the phone, never received last years refund. Bad service

DECEIVED!!! It says free but after you spend a great amount of time entering all the info it tells you that you must pay $54. I did not want to upgrade to deluxe but they would not let me file any other way. I'm a single, student. There shouldn't be any special, difficult tax forms. It should be simple filing. They lie and deceive when they advertise free. They couldn't stand not to get a piece of my income tax return. Will use H&R Block next year. Same price and they help me. You get nothing for free!! You spend hours trying to figure this out then they tell you that you need to upgrade $54
Too too expensive!!!! Turbo Tax is VERY expensive Too expensive

Had a problem Usually I'm very impressed with the software, and things go one without a hitch. I tried TaxCut in the past, but it didn't handle my K1 as well as this software. But this year I had a problem with the California tax return. I accidentally clicked the wrong choice the first time through, and it kept charging me the "California Use Tax" (for people who bought things online and didn't pay sales tax). I went back and fixed it over and over, and that tax would not go away. I tried calling the help line, and the wait was between 60-90 minutes. Somewhere around 40 minutes it disconnected me. I just filled out the 540 by hand and left the Use Tax out. Annoying. Met a bug on tax day, wait for help was over an hour
Good but not so for AMT questions Giving 3 stars because of poor way in which it addresses AMT AMT questions being asked without any help

Works okay, but... This year TT posts only X's on the Federal return and leaves the State return blank. There is no way to get a hard copy or PDF of the return with the bank numbers. Tech support was no help. Last year TT left off the bank numbers from my State return and I had to pay a late-payment penalty by the time I figured out what had happened. The penalty was more than if I had gone to a Tax Adviser to prepare the return where I could have gotten relief for this error. I will be extremely upset if this occures again -especially if TT screws up my Federal return also.
