Which i point out again, there is no way of knowing until it is too late -- that is, you get a late payment penalty letter. Issue with bank account numbers, answers unavailable

It works Overall my rating is average. The software gets the job done, but it could be improved. I am an accountant, and it is hard to get to a specific place in the return to adjust a number without going through the same questions again and again. The 2015 software did not populate the prior year data. I could never figure out how to populate the Tax History Report information for prior years, even though I had the data from the 2014 paper return. Also the SchA 5b, general sales tax calculator is not user friendly. The IRS website has a much better and reasonable calculator for determining whether to use Income taxes or general sales tax. This is an area I think you need to improve. I will say that the cost of the software (CD) is reasonable. We purchase the software every year from Costco and the price is very competitive. It is great that the efile for Federal is included in the cost of the software-Thanks. It is hard to get to a specific place without having to go back and answer the same basic questions again.

Extra useless fees for everything - waste of money I'm so sick of the hidden fees and extra money for every possible feature. In order to pay back money I owed I needed to pay TurboTax 39.99. In order to deduct the payment for their service I had to pay another 39.99. By the time I was done any refund I got was tied up in fees to TurboTax. Next year I'm going to file sooner and have it done by an accountant that I trust and pay them for less hassle. I'll keep the money local and not spend it on Intuit. They are a waste of money!!! After using them for a decade or more I'm fed up!!! Hidden fees at every turn
PASSWORD CHANGES!!!!!! why do i have to change my password evertime i logon. i have used tt for over 10 years,today i hate you everytime i login i have to change my password..this sucks!

Program works well Overall, the program works. It walks you through the process and you answer the questions. It's quite simple. The navigation is challenging and makes the process take longer than it should. Navigation is cumbersome, some questions repetitive

what a ripoff I had an easy tax to figure with just a few uncertainties. Used TurboTax last year and it was easy convenient and free. Decided to use it this year instead of the local free tax places I used to go to because using TurboTax was easier and much more convenient.

column1: To my surprise, TurboTax was not free this year and full of ads for its products! They didn't tell me that It wasn't free this year until all the forms were done and it was time to pay. To top it off my taxes were EASIER than last year. I ended up having to pay more than my tax refund for something I can't even deduct from my taxes next year. I was charged because of 1 item NOT put on my tax form (because it wasn't needed) but the IRS required on a 1040 form according to TurboTax. I was so angry and frustrated that I stopped several times to see if this was some mistake, did I miss something? I couldn't go some place else to have it done free because all the time slots were already full. When I finally came back to finish, THEY RAISED THE PRICE!!!!! That really made me angry! But by this time I was so frustrated I just wanted to get it over with. Way to make easy money TurboTax!
I still don't know why I just didn't send in the forms I had already done myself.I always do my taxes by myself and then have them done elsewhere to check my work.

I used TurboTax because they sent me e-mails reminding me that I had used them last year. I don't recall seeing anything in the e-mails suggesting policy changes. Nor did I see anything on the site when I first signed in from the e-mail. They could have asked questions up front to let me know that I didn't qualified for free taxes. They also could have posted that the policy had changed on how one could qualify for free tax prep.
I am pretty sure unless TurboTax changes its way of doing business I will not pay them to do my taxes again. kept raising the prices

column2: Great software... But... First time user of Turbotax. Great experience... But....

column1: I was a bit late on my return as I was waiting for a HSA deduction form. Turbotax credit card payment gateway decides to break down as I am submitting my tax return forcing me to pay an additional 35$ to deduct from federal return.
Additionally, the "State Preparation is included" in the product description was not clear. Ended up paying an additional 25$.
Besides unanticipated charges... Great Product ! Credit card payment gateway broken on tax filing date. Forced me to pay an additional 35$ to deduct from federal return.

column2: Should not have to pay for upgraded service Turbotax is a powerful, user-friendly set of tools. I have used it for multiple years running. Due to a change in circumstance for 2015, my return was simpler than in the prior year. I started using Turbotax "Deluxe", believing that my situation with student loan interest would require forms that take me out of the 1040EZ or 1040A categories. When I was totally finished, and after having been made to pay $55 for "Deluxe", I was able to actually see my return, and noticed that it is a 1040A. So, in fact, I could have used the free version. But I had tried to exit the unfinished return and couldn't "get out" of it. Since I was logged in with my profile, the program would not even let me start over (even though I did not want to, I would have, to save $55).

column1: Word to the wise: always start with the free edition. If your circumstances require you to file a more complicated return, the program will tell you.

column2: Too Expensive I will pay someone 2 do taxes/ not worth hassle. Way TOOOO Expensive
E-file fees are too much After spending $60 on TurboTax Deluxe I still had to pay $24.99 to e-file state taxes. That is crazy. State e-file should come in the initial price and not as extra.

column1: I have used Turbo Tax for years but looks like I will be changing that next year because of the extra fees you charge to e-file. Too expensive

column2: Works great, but pricey. For something that requires me to do some of the work myself, HR Block is looking better as someone else would do it all for me at a slightly lower price. Price is high.

Faked out As a veteran user, I was comfortable using the software like several times before. This year though, I apparently didn't finish the process when I was printing the return and wrapping things up. I just happened to check my bank statement today, looking for my rebate and couldn't find anything. So then I checked my return and it was at a status short of actually filing. Not a pleasant surprise. I realize that I am ultimately responsible for completing the process and I was probably too comfortable with the whole thing, but I would appreciate a stronger prompt to work through to completion next year. Didn't file when I thought it had

I was put on hour long holds twice without ever getting assistance. Twice I left my number for a call back, waited over an hour for a call back, missed the calls by seconds and received a message that I missed my turn and there was no number to call back to, I had to start over. There were glitches in the system that I had to work around - as confirmed the one time I did reach a helpful human. Could not get an answer to a simple question (why did my property tax deduction not appear to transfer from my federal to my state return). ……... Contacting the service for assistance

Nearly sank my boat! I'll know for sure later... It would be great to let us know how much more we have to do before finishing it up (after we've put in all the info!) due to time constraints and having to pay for more computer time. Did not allow me to enter 1 more bit of information without charging me another $55!
had to pay $50 to get $160 I had to pay $50 for the premium version so I could add $150 to my deduction for a solar install

column1: also did not support the forms I needed for NC state tax, so had to file an extension.
will NEVER use again. my taxes are too simple and there are many alternatives to explore. did not support NC forms, fees too high

column2: efiling Although the written information is great and very user friendly.

column1: i called support and it was horrible. After waiting 15 to 20 mins to be connected. i was greeted very unprofessionally and when i asked how i pay my owed state taxes. She seemed disoriented and put me on hold twice before she supposedly transferred to someone who could better help me, when connected, a recorded message gave me another number to call and disconnected before i was able to get a pen and paper. I didn't bother calling back. I would have given a better rating had the call gone more amiably. poor phone support

column2: Bait and switch Software worked well but my costs increased drastically from my initail sign to e-file. I have used turbo tax for years and this is the first time I have had an issue. Pricing changes

Good product slowly but surely going down hill I've been a TTax user for since the 90s -- including working for Intuit for a few years. What was once a great product although a bit painful to use, has now become a mediocre product that attempts to sugar coat everything. There's basic issues they've never figured out (like too much white space on pages leading to unnecessary clicking and scrolling, breaking up simple topics over multiple pages leading to unnecessary clicking and scrolling, or forgetting to default standard questions leading to (well, you get it)). But the more fundamental issue is they've hidden all ties between entries and forms. Knowledgeable users used to be able to dive into their return at any point and understand better what was happening -- understanding a series of white washed questions can't deliver in many cases. Its this white-washed UX that is the fundamental problem as it leaves the user feeling disconnected from the process. Your only option now is 100% trust in the product. This may work for many, but its not what knowledgeable people want. Do little to prove it anymore

Terrible Support and Glitchy Software glitched. I caught the error, but struggled to fix. Phone support was terrible. 60 + min wait times, and 3 times call was disconnected. Will be looking into cost of simply hiring an accountant next year When something goes wrong its incredibly frustrating

Nope For some reason, I thought electronic filing would be convenient. Nope! I had to re- enter information several times, it was VERY misleading as far as price- I was told 39.99 and ended up paying 101!! That right there is a "NEVER AGAIN." THEN you also have to mail forms?? No one told me about this! It's 7 pm the night of the deadline, everyone just got off work, no one has seen a stamp in five years... this is ridiculous. Nope, back to insanely expensive H & R. They might rip you off but at least they don't dick you around! Everything.

Hidden fees for "Free" edition It's very telling that the reviewer is first advised to avoid "inappropriate language and attitude." I do not remember being charged nearly $65.00 upon completion of the free edition last year. It is my fault I waited until the last minute to file.

column1: I sincerely hope we can do our tax returns "on a postcard" in the coming years! See ya, Turbo Tax. Won't be returning in 2017. 34.99 charge to process refund

column2: Very disappointed While doing taxes the application "unexpectedly quit" numerous times and lost data. In addition, I completed the return and then went to open and file electronically and was unable to edit, file, see, etc. anything in the file and had to redo all of it. I had such a horrible experience and used up so much extra time that I will not be using the product again. Unexpectedly quit numerous times, could not reopen file after complete

I Miss You 2014... I personally liked the old version of Turbo. This new version was glitchy and the sales tax portion wasn't operating correctly. Additionally, I found it oversimplified to a point where I became concerned about getting audited. However, the oversimplification did allow for speedy filing, though I'm still uncertain as to whether or not this is a good thing. Thus, I ended up just taking the standard deduction even though itemization was a higher deduction for myself. I miss the old version as I felt it allowed for more detailed entries as well as provided more detailed explanations. Perhaps this is merely perceptual, but I preferred it. As for TurboTax in general, the rates are too high and I feel as though if your signed up and you've filed your taxes through them then they should have this on record always regard less of filing free. Most any website allows for this is you frequent them or have used their services. I'm to the point that I'm considering no longer filing my taxes with Turbotax, seeing as how I end up paper filing state anyways every year bc of the cost. If I were going to pay $30 to file state, I could just go to H&R Block and have them do everything. Glitches, New Format, Poor Explanations, & Costly

Successful e-file There used to be a link to see your entry on the actual form. You could make modifications and enter data there as well. Plus, my 2014 Tax info wasn't even close to what I actually filed. I have no idea where Turbo Tax got that info.

column1: There should have been an "import last year's return" prompt before I got started. Couldn't see my return in progress on a form

column2: turbo ghjhvhj everytime I sign on it does'nt reconize my password

FREE!* For the sake of my argument, let's say our tax return is $6,000. I will not be surprised if our deposit goes in and it is for $5,500 for the use of your FREE!* service. I am highly unlikely to use Turbotax again. Fees

Ground through TurboTax Intuit can't keep their hands out of my wallet pocket. It seems like every time I go to a different part of the program they want more money. Last year they suckered me into buying a state return I didn't need and wouldn't refund.

column1: If it wasn't for the ability to import my old data which saves me a ton of time on my, and my mother's tax returns, I would switch to a competing product.
If you haven't used Turbo Tax before, try the competition first Inconsistent methodology for input & poor handling of different investments

column2: Not nearly as good as prior years I have been using TurboTax for years. This year TurboTax was only for the simple tax person not the advanced. I started to just do my taxes the old way because Turbotax was so hard to use for me this year. One person at TurboTax was helpful. With much difficulty for both of us and much time, I was finally able to see forms. The next person was not helpful at all. I had already tried all she said to do without luck before I called.

column1: So, Good Bye Turbotax from me. I went ahead and filed with TurboTax but will amend my return on my own with IRS forms. Very difficult to go to "forms". You cannot edit nor add in forms.

column2: Good service, too expensive Let me also add that Intuit's lobbying in Washington DC means that I won't use this service any longer. There are cheaper services that don't spend millions of dollars paying Congress critters to keep the tax code complicated in order to further their own profits. Too expensive

Annoying and No Help Available I remember TurboTax being a lot easier and user-friendly than this. For instance, it said that I am not qualified for the Child Tax Credit, and when I hit "Explain Why", it didn't tell me anything as to why I didn't qualify. I had to look it up online to find out that since I had made less than $3,000 this year (stay-at-home parent), I wasn't eligible. There was no explanation like this on TurboTax website.

column1: When I was filing state, TurboTax automatically entered in 2,100 in itemized deductions from last year, when I had zero itemized deductions. This could really screw someone's taxes up. Get it together, please. Your product used to be amazing. Now, it's as if the Basic customers aren't worth a darn because we're not shelling out money for the "better" options. No help available for Basic customers, deductions and whatnot aren't explained well at all

column2: Easy but way too expensive Can't believe I just paid $100 for this, such a rip off. My fault for procrastinating I guess. Super expensive
Turbo Tax makes you feel like you've been had- they lure you in with a low price, then try to upsell you on a more expensive version after each section.

column1: I wonder how much research went into the rolling up numbers for the refund- look how much money I made! (I mean, how much money I overpaid the government throughout the year...)

The NC tax return charged 35$ to efile, but did not make clear that efile did NOT include a payment option. Instead, I was directed to an NC DOR website only to discover that once I've filed with turbo tax I'm out of luck- there is no online payment option once you have filed. Guess I'm writing another check. Thanks Turbo tax! too many click through screens, too many requests to upgrade

column2: declining customer support I started at least 7 years ago using turbo tax and have always been a fan but my support is fading. MD help links simply took me to a MD tax prep book which is confusing at best. Worst is your pricing structure has continually increased and now you add ~$35 to efile and erefund. It has gotten to a point where for the first time I am going to shop around for an alternative. This year it was $270 to file using tax softward....no longer seems like a bargain. pricing structure and add ons

Confusing and repetitive. Not enough explanations First time filing in Wisconsin, filed Federal for 20+ years last 10+years with Turbo Tax. Gripe 1--There was not enough contrast to the rules of Federal vs. State. How am I supposed to know if I need to enter in an adjustment to the state if you don't tell me how it is different from Federal? I had to go to the Wisconsin website to figure things out. I am not paying money (2x) for not having the explanations readily available about how the state treats items differently . Gripe 2- Also it seems like I had to fill the state forms out 3 or 4 times. Granted I was switching between my kids forms but each time I logged back in I had to go through state information I had already entered and some of the information was gone. I am still not confident they are done right because the explanations weren't there. Hopefully when I go through them in the coming days I won't realize I need to do an amendment. Gripe 3--I hate that I can't see how Turbo Tax has filled out the forms until I am ready to file. Maybe I'm missing something but it seems like you are getting further and further away from the forms just to make it impossible to check them. Gripe 4-- Also filling out my kids forms who only have Interest and Dividends used to be free and this year they charged me. This will be the last time I use TurboTax online. Can't see any part of the forms until paid
confusing cost structure not completely clear until the end when its too late to start over with a different service.

Pushing additional services like a street hustler. The near constant re-asking to purchase the +Plus or deluxe features was VERY irritating. At the beginning of filing when declining to pay $29.99 for the +Plus service there was a cheap fear tactic in taking the user back to the previous page and having to watch each individual benefit and past saved info disappear/fade away. To think that some web designer specifically created the page to make a person watch and feel like they're loosing something is low. The convenience of online filing is great but I'd very much like to be treated like a sound headed adult, not an unsure idiot that needs to be re questioned on their decisions. Fear and regret tactics to push additional service purchases.
Spent the whole day trying to e files transmitted and state will not send. Keeps saying intuit is having internet issues! Cannot get state e file to transmit!!!

CAUTIOUS Won't do this online version again. Interface is too confusing and circular. Couldn't do what I wanted to do. Probably have to file an amended return. Tried to file an extension -- kept going around in circles. VERY FRUSTRATING. Not sure my state tax return got filed.

Was free last year Almost the same as last year but it charged me for it this year. In the past it was free. Whats with the pop up buy more stuff. i feel like it conned me into a not free tax return. If i don't get a refund of my fee i will most likely just go to H&R Block... If I'm going to have to pay might as well have someone else input the data. active military and charged me this year

Confusing TurboTax had me start through the Deluxe option before telling me that I had to pay for the service, then pay for filing both federal and state returns. When errors were found in my filing during Smartcheck, it didn't tell me how to fix them, and there was no help button. I had to research most of the questions I had on my own. I should have filled out the forms myself. Expensive and confusing

Way Too Hard This is my first year downloading to my macBook Air, so maybe it's just that TT sucks with these vice a PC. Anyway, not only did the software miss errors (obvious things like duplicate dividend downloads from my bank), but also would not allow me to BUY a state e-file option. (did you get that TT? I don't expect to have to BUY e-file when I already pay a chunk with 'state included.') So the TT interface would not allow me to buy the e-file for state, thanks to some glitch, which wouldn't even let me log in to my TT account. I went to online support - nothing worked from that. I waited on the phone for 40 minutes, and I got hung up on. Just bad service. Very glitchy, very poor user friendliness, just a bad experience overall. Very user unfriendly; misses errors

Disappointed with pricing Pricing is getting out of hand. Though I thought my price had gone up quite a bit, it turned out to be only $4 but the price tag of your product vs. a CPA is getting darn close. So, if this continues I'm going to explore the possibility of doing my takes with a CPA.

Easy to use, but hides fees All though it was easy to use and to file, I really felt like the system was hiding what I was actually going to be charged, had I known it was going to be so high, I would have filed with someone else. However I waited until the last minute and you had all my information from last year. I think next year I might file with another company. It kept adding fees as It went on
when did the price triple? Way too expensive. When did it jump from $50 to $150?
Turbo Tax - Expensive to E-file The 1099B and the international stocks were confusing. Other sections were pretty straight forwards.

column1: I just can't believe CA state e-file cost is $29.99 and you are forced to buy turbo premier for $39.99 to e-file federal tax. This extra cost is a total rip off after you spent $70 for the software.
I'm seriously considering this year as my last year using the turbo tax. confusing on 1099B and international tax charges, expensive efile charges

column2: Quick and Easy, but... I've used Turbotax for years. This year, there was a magical $29.99 fee for PLUS that was not removable if you imported your data from last year. This was NOT mentioned before I imported, or I wouldn't have imported - convenient or not, it's not worth $29.99.

column1: Use it and enjoy it, very quick. Next year I will just use paper. false advertisement of free

column2: Less and Less simple retiree return but $30 to import data? really? no loyalty for long time users
State  Too many things need to be entered manually.

Confusing and ended up with almost nothing It didn't really tell me how or why it was deducting so much from my refund. I am single and don't have anyone claiming me, I usually get over $1000 and then I got left with less than half of that this year. I just wanted an explanation on why but couldn't find it anywhere. Explanations
not that simple! you have a simple system. don't come at me at the end and change the price. either there's a charge or there isn't one.

column1: also, there's this round and round circle game i felt like i was a part of. i hated not being able to scroll up or down pages to see what i've entered or could easily be corrected-----that's faster than BACK sometimes it's free---sometimes it's not---either it is or it isn't!

column2: endless hours mind numbing questions Good if you have a simple W2 and a couple 1099 with little to no deductions, assets and expenses to write off. I like that its thorough but it took about 16 hours to finish. I couldve saved a couple hours if turbo tax would automatically move suggested expenses that were input into assets so I didnt have to go back and re input the expenses. first time user with many deductions/expenses/assets from small business...my 16 hours could've been utilized elsehwhere

Unhappy with $39.00 Premium Services Was not happy to see I also have to sign up and pay an additional $39 fee if I want to use part of my refund to cover the cost of filing my taxes thru your service. I may go with a different tax preparer next year if you plan on nickel and diming me to death. Yes, I did get a refund but it's not like it's free money. It's my money. What was once the best part about your site, has now become another hassle. I can see charging a small fee, but tricking people into joining a year long program is not cool, guys. $39 "premium" service

I would like Making the status of the various tax forms available on-demand would significantly improve the process for me. I would like to view the status of various forms at any point along the way and this is not possible.

7yrs with Turbo Tax has ended I would have been a lifer with turbo tax. They made it ez and simple. This year I geared up to file my taxes online with TT and they informed me, with no warning, that I would no longer have access to past returns unless I paid 29.99 for their "Plus service." I continued with my 2016 taxes anyway only to be hit up again at the end with a 29.99 charge to file my state EZ tax form. 30 bucks for an EZ tax filing. No grading scale. Other tax prepares will do it for 14.99 for an EZ and one even offered to do it for 7.99, but you have to file your state (for Ga) with whoever files your federals. If ihad started a little earlier I would have been able to mail both for the price of a stamp. I have to say unless i hear from TT about this, it will be my last year with them. Loyalty means nothing to large companies anymore. They want $60 for basic services and with the way they pulled this next year you may have to pay $50 to access last years and $50 bucks to file state. overcharge for state EZ filing, Surprise 2016 over charge for access to past years.
Pricey and pain in the butt I would rather pay someone to do my taxes for the price i paid turbotax expensive and timely
Upsell Upsell Upsell! over expensive and annoying. next year I'm going to a human constant upselling, even after you've already upgraded. arbitrary divisions between softwares

CO Turbo I got charged for a State e-file and never was able to use the free e-file with the program. This happened because the State e-file triggered as used when going through the program the first time and editing my state taxes. I then decided to file a joint return with my wife, but the State e-file was already claimed. Not a good system and I paid $24.99 more than what I should have this year.

column1: Process at the end for payment was very tedious. Suggest you improve that overall. Got charged for a State e-file when I never used one.

column2: FEES For being free, WHAT A RIP OFF! This cost $129.97 for what could really have been done on a 1040EZ. Thanks for NOTHING! The fees you now charge are horrific. I will never use you again!

Tired of being prompted to spend more money There's some bait and switch going on here unless you read the fine print up front. For example, you've got to pay extra to file taxes in some states, like California, $40 extra!

column1: The instructions for certain tax situations are as clear as mud, e.g., married but separated, how do i file (head of household if you've not lived together for 1+ years)? Some instructions confusing, don't tell you up front state tax filing is extra

column2: Paid too much I really thought filing my taxes would be free. I had to pay $95 to pay the government $445. I had to pay to pay. This sucked some major butt balls!!! I paid $95 to file and I thought it's free. #gotduped
Disappointed Having been a TurboTax user for over 20 years, I am very disappointed in this version. Moving back and forth was tedious at best and frustrating at worst. Navigation and visibility

I couldn't add 1099c insolvency I don't really even know how to do this and I'm kind of frustrated that I pay for this software nearly what I would pay my own tax consultant for the same thing and you don't offer this as a standard service. I'm not sure why that would be so hard. That worksheet could just be allowed to be without any sort of checking the characters. If it's need which, it is, I should be allowed to enter it. Thanks. I love that I can do this online. Although my bottom is sore from too much entering taxes I'm happy to be done. Caveat, sort of. Couldn't enter insolvency form addition to 1099c
Feels gross Turbotax works great, and feels slimy as heIl. Put the prices up front, stop trying to upsell me a service multiple times when I've said no, and stop animating every step for emphasis.

column1: The whole "oooh, look at all this data! now... $30 or retype it! muahaha! watch the animation of your data going away!" is so slimy I refuse to buy PLUS regardless of price.

column2: my refund overall good but seems like a face to face may offer more of a return for the same filing price price of fileing fee

Free Service?? If I had known from the time I first opened the Turbo Tax link that there was a filing fee. I would have chosen another service. Honestly, I don't mind paying a fee (it's much less than H&R Block and other tax agencies.) However, I had gone through the lengthy process submitting all the required information, only to be hit with a fee at the end. There is a fee

Surprised by IRA You indicated I could open an IRA to save on tax payment. I went through the process of doing that then found out my MAGI was too high and could not. I then had to contact Fidelity and cancel the bank transfer for the IRA then remove the IRA deduction in TurboTax. Very disappointing. Since you already knew my MAGI, please tell us up front if we are not eligible!! see review

Unfortunattely, a bad experience this year. Due to Microsoft 10 updates, I kept getting error messages and crashes. I was half way through, when I had to uninstall & reinstall the first time. The second time happened just as I was trying to e-file, which caused me a very stressful "Tax Day." I've used TurboTax for years with very easy returns until this year. Had to uninstall and reinstall twice.
Not ideal It did not provide any help on stock grants taxes.

column1: It walks you through the stock, options sale but no stock/option grants.

Does not explain how the tax is calculated. I had to research online why my Turbo Tax Tax liability was greater then IRS table suggests. Upgrade to premier promised support from an accountant and greater detail for stocks transaction. I paid extra $30 and did not see a difference. Complete waste of money on the upgrade. I used turbo tax for the last 7 years and as my tax situation becoming more complex the more disappointed I am in Turbo Tax. Does not explain how it calculates tax liability. No stock/option grant section.

column2: Sneaky fees at the end I paid to have the version that is one step up from the free so that I wouldn't have to put in the info.. then when I got to the end there was a random fee that was double that amount that there was no reason for having. Don't claim to have a free service, and then tack on fees at the end.. i will be going to H&R Block next year. I didn't like having extra fees at the end that were not explained

Bait and switch I made less than $6000.00 and qualified for a free filing. When i got to the end I was informed that it would cost me 29.99 if I wanted the file my state taxes along with my federal tax return. Very bad form on your part. Bait and switch. Would think you all would be a bit more classy than that. I was lead to believe that filing taxes would be free ... had to pay 29.99

Expensive The help option wasn't available on every page. I don't want to spend the extra time using the contact or searching for my help topic. It would be easier if I could hit the help button on any page and it would be specific info for the page I'm on. Expensive

Extra fees added, no option to contest Okay tax service. Simple to use and stores your information. Watch for the prices, it is all about selling and dollars. Adds extra fees, no option to review prior to getting charged
In the middle I like how easy the steps are and how it has explanations along the way.

column1: Downfall is that it cost way too much if you can not use the free version! The three discount links from 3 different organizations that I am a member to did not work. I called and they told me I had to take it up with the website company. No help. :-(

Also, I have really bad phone anxiety and I tried calling 3 different times but got hung up on. If you can't talk on the phone (especially if you are deaf or mute) you are out of luck. I tried the online help (where you submit a question and you wait for someone writes you back) but they just told me to call. :-( COST! Only can call for help.

column2: no space for K-1 fiduciary name & not expain. why ss not taxable

Pretty good, but a little glitchy Does a good job of keeping it simple and easy for the user, but it kept either freezing up entirely on me, or stopping mid animation until I moved my mouse pointer. Cursor wouldn't appear in certain text fields on click - had to tab to them in order to type. rather glitchy, kept freezing
taxes  got all the way to the end- then after i had only check the FREE trial ... tried to charge my almost 100$

Please be more MAC friendly I have used Turbo Tax for many years now and like the programs. I have been using Deluxe and Premier for personal use so when I needed the Home & Business this year I bought it at the end of December 2015. Months later when trying to install it on my MAC, as I've done for years, I discovered that it is not supported by MAC systems and had to borrow someone else's computer with Windows to do my taxes. Not cool Intuit!! Please realize many home and small businesses use MAC and fix this for 2016! Home & Business not supported on MAC systems

Turbotax Screwed me up on my Fed filing Have to use, stuck with it as I need it for business filing. Two years ago thought I had filed my fed return, but found out it was not, even though my state got filed electronically!!!!!!!! Another year had problems paying for "Audit Protection" spent way too much time getting THAT resovled! (see review)

Minnesota resident The complications made by the MN tax laws made the state part of the process extremely cumbersome and nearly impossible to do. Making the customer use the desktop version of Turbotax, print actual forms and transfer the numbers to Turbotax was uncalled for and completely opposite of what Turbotax was set up to do. I really do not see why this couldn't have been taken care of just like the rest of the program. The complications made by the MN tax laws

Toughest tax return ever! Lack of explanations throughout. Darn near have to be a tax accountant to use this software! It has never been so hard for me before, and I am a fairly intelligent person! Cost is too high. Not enough of the info is easily explained to the average person.

Turbotax Declines with each year. SLOPPY Turbotax Can't allocate Rental Income on Multi-State Return w/ State Indicated in address. Turbotax Included ALL Rental income on Non-resident state allocation schedule, even though address of rentals clearly indicates rental income belongs to resident state. Only K-1 rental income rightfully belongs on the non-resident return. Had to override turbo tax amount to correct the issue. :o( Basic taxes 101. Can't allocate Rental Income on Multi-State Return w/ State Indicated

Feeling Slighted I have used your site for several years to file our taxes. My husband is ill and on disability. Every year I carefully keep my information together and enter everything in your system. Every year you tell me that I should file the EZ form and that my deductions are not enough. I still pay the fee for itemizing, but, I get a minimal refund and am thankful. This year, I choose not to pay the additional fees and just file an EZ form. Amazingly, I suddenly need to itemize or I will owe. Therefore, i have no choice but to pay the additional fees and to itemize. Nothing has changed in the past year that all of the sudden I should owe. I feel that I have been slighted and may not use this site again. all about the fees

Annoying, frustrating So in filing my state taxes this year I discovered there was a credit available. In order to get the credit I had to enter in specific information from last years return. I couldn't access that info without upgrading my account with Turbo Tax first. I understand that, but the website wouldn't let me get to the point where I could pay this fee. I saw the option to deduct it from my return, but to pay the upgrade fee and receive last years return info was an exercise in futility. I ended up forgoing the 500$ credit because Turbo Tax was taking hours of my day and I just went around and around with this stupid website where they try to sell you every little thing. Annoying and frustrating.

column1: Obviously the lesson is to keep all your return info, but if Turbo Tax is offering to help with that I'd take it. However it wasted 4 hours of my day and I walked away from a nice credit, because it was driving me insane.
F - Turbo Tax in their crooked little holes Poorly built website , annoying

column2: Repetitive questions Very difficult to use when last year cpa filed and didn't supply PW/PIN info. Did not have printer available and unable to print but couldn't eFile. Therefore tried to use extension but that was a joke also. Only thing it did was cost $54+ dollars really for nothing. Felt everytime I did something turbo was looking for a way to get money for supposedly "free filing"! Simplistic repetive qyestions

mostly ok but the additional 5$ left a bad taste after going all the distance. I didn't see any additional charge notice. You hit my account for my federal taxes and get the use of those funds for two business days and tell me how great you are.

column1: d how did the state 19.95 charge become 24.95????? bad

column2: beware someone filed a return using my social. so i was unable to efile my fed return. And if you cant efile your state if u dount efile your fed. so they charged me for me state file before they told me that. now i have to mail in both returns and still pay turbo tax 30 bucks for nothing....thanx for nothing too took my money

Meh....Not as good as it was I am not so thrilled with the software anymore. I find it does not "assist" you with easy step by step question and answer as it did in the past. At the last step of reviewing my federal form it found an "error" in a 1098 form but would not allow me to correct it or re-start my taxes, just an endless loop or error and not being able to correct it. Very disappointing to say the least. I had to call customer service for a refund! I will never use TurboTax again. Not so intuitive, Had some bugs
Ripoff For a college kid to file from school, the expense of Federal and State returns are a ripoff. Expense

Too much confusing advertising I don't think i'll use again. Sneaky advertising. I'm not 100 percent sure I didn't pay for some features, even though I'm 99 percent sure I said no to every advertising. too much advertising

Too Many Additional Fees I will not use Turbo Tax ever again. I spent over $129 to prepare my taxes!! One fee for state, another for adding a 1099, and one to have my money placed on a card. Ridiculous!!! I purchased the plus last year and still was not able to see my previous years tax return. I will not recommend turbo to anyone ever again!!!!!!!! Too Many Additional Fees!!! Not competitive to other sites available

what's up with state? Once I saw the $24.99 for filing state, then an additional $34.99 for refund processing fee, I promptly withdrew this return and filed direct to California for $0. I'm a student, so these fees are onerous. I will never use Turbotax for a state return. whopping fees for state

Free version isn't free The whole bait and switch of calling the product free then charging a 34.99 fee to get an electronic refund deposit is almost as dishonest as Hilary Clinton. This is the last time I will use this product. 34.99 fee to recieve refund electronicaly

Additional State Fee 2.49% to pay with credit card. paid for the software that has the state and I am still being charged if I file electronically, really. NOt liking all the fees. Why am I being charged another fee to file my state tax, double fees, plus a 2.49% to use my credit card.

Next year I will use tax professional, Turbo Tax is very easy to use however too many additional fees such as extra fee to e-file state tax, fee to have refund deposited in bank account and so on. Too many additional fees
Too much going on  Too many additional questions, I prefer last year's format

Paying for Lobbyist to Keep Taxes Complicated & $$ Firstly, I only used Turbo tax b/c they offer deducting filing costs from refund only to find out that they charge $34.99 for the service! Really?! How can you reason that?

column1: Additionally, I despise the fact that Turbo Tax Intuit is spending millions of dollars to send lobbyist to DC to sway Congress from simplifying the tax process! I was desperate so I used Turbo Tax but never again ...you are a greedy, greedy company and the $34.99 fee for paying with my own refund money is proof. Being charged and add'tl $34.99 for have filing costs deducted...really?!

column2: No separating the federal and state returns I feel like TurboTax reeled me in. They had me go through all the steps to prepare the federal return and then they automatically transfer the information to the state return, but I don't have to file my state return until May 2, so, therefore, I didn't want to go through the entire process with the state and have no choice but pay the fee for filing the state return. Didn't have the option to not also prepare the state return.
Incorrect Refund Turbo Tax pulled in the information from my Fidelity account twice, and did not catch the mistake when it ran its checks.

Extra hiddeen fees I hate the extra hidden charges that are tacked on. You do not have much choice. Price is too high. I will reconsider using another tax software next year. Extra hidden charges in teh endthat you cannot get rid of

Fees The longer you wait to do your taxes the higher the fees are and I don't think that is fair. For instance there was no charge for state when I started and finished my daughter's taxes, I waited till the last day and I am being charged for state. Last year I claimed money made from baby sitting services and was being charged one price but waited to submit and the price almost doubled! fees
over priced The entire time i was filing i was under the impression that the preparation of my federal taxes would be free, it costed me an extra $50 incredibly overpriced, innacurate advertisement

Gotten very greedy and less user friendly Lacks intuitive thumbnail tips whether you should go thru the trouble of entering so many answers and then just get standard deduction. For price I will just use private preparer, and get credit card miles without taking the fee that most vendors pay themselves. 2.5 percent service charge on credit card tax payments, not told how much until after you enter your information,

Good Product (A bit pricey)... I participated in a research project in 2014, but not 2015. The product would not let me delete the previous year information and would not let me file my taxes electronically because of errors caused by this portion of the software. After 20 attempts I got it to file, but it is not correct. Please fix, so it doesn't cause future problems. Poor research participant income portion of tax software.

Hidden filing fees and manual steps for states Corporate greed is making Intuit hide fees for state filings - you get state tax software, then you pay again for e-filing. When you e-file (I filed to NC) - you have to pay separately using State website or mail a check.

column1: It is bad enough paying uncle Sam through hidden taxes... hidden fees

column2: Some good, some bad The "Cons" screen cut me off after only a few words...

column1: continuing with cons: too hard to tell where I was with filling out actual tax form lines/numbers. I couldn't get a handle as to where my answers were being inserted. the help menu info wasn't helpful - didn 't get the answers I was looking for. Tried asking for phone/email assistance and no one ever responded. Got a message that my state tax files were rejected, so I followed your "fix" prompts (a little vague what actually is done to fix the problem) and resubmitted, but don't' know what was wrong and if it was fixed. misleading info regarding which forms I should be filling out, incomplete information provided, too difficult to tell wh

column2: Could not see the actual forms, for review or change.

column1: Do not like the changes that have been made. can't see the forms

column2: Gave me a migrane... I don't know what happened this year, but my experience using this product was Terrible! I have been using this product since 1993, when it was called, "MacINTax". I found the software so user friendly so I would buy it every year.

column1: This year although I would save the data I entered, when I would open it back up, the data wasn't there. I'd have to re-enter it two or more times. YUCKY!
I hope you can fix these glitches, because I'd like to stay loyal to the Intuit Turbo Tax product. There were so many program glitches this year, it made the experience terrible!

column2: ok but lousy for LLCs If I'd known how worthless it was for LLCs I'd have probably just used paper to file. Does not handle disregarded entities well, absolutely fails on important state forms for LLCs, it assumes LLCs have rentals (which is common but far from the only case). It should explicitly ask more about the entity and give better guidance into where to enter income, and should fill out the state forms (ftb 568, 3522, sch k-1, etc). does not handle LLCs worth a darn, esp in CA

The worst service Spent 2 hours on the phone waiting for an agent, the first agent just hanged up the second said you can't start over you already paid, but I can delete some section for you and then hanged up, the agent had access to my file and contact info but never called back, I paid twice to file once
On Line program sucks Been using TT since 1998. Always got a disk. This year no disk for some reason even though I am set up for automatic renewal. So I filed on line. Rotten program.

column1: almost impossible to navigate. Way too expensive for the trouble. I'll be going to H&R next year On line is soooo user UNFRIENDLY

column2: Turbo Tax Horrible! I was very frustrated this year that marked as estimate cells can not be unmarked (none of them). Available help for a solution was lacking in any real expertise. My federal tax form was complete and ready to file, so I had to start from scratch to be able to file on time. It was also recommended that I delete my state tax form if I did not want to file it at this time, but it would be permanently deleted. What has happened to your once great product that I have used for years with minimal problems? Very disappointed in your lack of customer service! Not the great product it once was.

refund is finished The steps for the return went smoothly for the most part. I have used HR Block's product and Taxact and this product is comparable in terms of usability. I like how easy it is to return to a particular section and make adjustments when the realization happens that some number was supposed to be entered in a earlier section.

column1: Got to end and had a error in my state tax that referred to a sheet noting business expenses when I am only filing as an individual. The link to the tax forum was helpful but it seemed there were several others with the same problem but no real solution. I found a workaround however and was able to efile. incessant error that I had to find a workaround in order to file

column2: 2015 version flunked  Horrible when compared with last years PC version
Sucks I've been using turbo tax since you started, I have always liked the product. I no longer feel this way and I will no longer use your product. Good Bye. lots of them

My Way I wanted to file my taxes without having to pay almost $100 but, when it was time to file, I was only allowed to "upgrade" to the deluxe product when I CHOSE to use the free version. I believe you should get what you ask for and I think you "suckered" me in. I am VERY unhappy with this and WILL NOT use this program in the future and will tell my friends, family and anyone else who asks NOT to use this program.
issues my taxes should be easier but the are issues with clarity in IRS's and rollovers. Information lacking on why something is not add to return even though it been requested like income

column1: to long on support lines this year and questions not answered should have been easier

column2: Telemarketer for Taxes You don't deserve my review, but I'll give it to you, just this once.

column1: I fully support making money in this country. I think it's great at hastening innovation, obviously only second to a great catastrophe. But to systematically reduce features year over year to make more money is atrocious.
Secondly, obfuscating the price of $34.99 for being able to deduct your state fee from the tax return? Whoever you paid for that well planned string of clicks, I hope has a catastrophe themselves.
I have used Mint through a majority of my adult life, and am never going to recommend it to my friends again. The second I can get off the teat with a competing business model, I will.
TL;DR
I don't like you.
Sincerely,
Austin Tyler Dean Pinnacle of Malignant Business Practices

column2: Getting Expensive and confusing I bought the version that SAID it included both Federal and one state for free....only to get charged to file for the state and get charged another 45 dollars plus another 25 dollars for the second state. So I spent about $200 dollars which is more than I paid an accountant last year. This will be my last year with turbo tax. Which is sad as I hate driving an 40 minutes to the accountant. I could have hired a person for the amount it costs this year.
capital gains Using an Apple computer! LINDA GOT DIFFERENT ANSWERS ON HER PC! 4/18: Still having trouble with Capital Gains. Working with Linda.

More trouble than its worth + unpleasant surprises You got me once and never again, I was told the one figure included both state and federal then had to pay for both, extra charge for paying with a credit card and I only found out after everything was done. To much trouble to stop then. When I needed help ridiculous long phone waits and then disconnected repeatedly. Never will get taken again. You don't care but you lost a customer for life. Bad choice on your part since I do volunteer work on public access tv. Guess who will get slammed on my consumer corner show. Lied to about additional charges, long phone wait only to be lost

I am really disappointed at the price this year, I have NEVER paid this much for filing my taxes on a simple form...I had to upgrade to the deluxe or I couldn't file, all because I had a early withdrawl. I have been using turbotax for years, and I have never had to do that before. Exptremely disspointed that I had to pay $150 to od my taxes, next year I will not use your service.
State return is way too expensive! $44.95 for a state form that took me 10 minutes to do by hand is rather excessive! State return is way too expensive!

Pricey This Year I remember when this service was about $30. It's good, but it's not worth $89, even with inflation. Next year I will be shopping, or buying the CD's if available any longer. The price to use has doubled this year. Almost 100 dollars.
Great product, costs are hidden until the end Very thorough. Excellent interface and navigation.

column1: Waiting until the end to discuss the cost was a BIG negative. The service was listed as free for Federal and State. It was free for the Federal file and $29.99 plus tax for the State. Let's see free is zero, anything more than zero is NOT free! Charges for a Freefile?

column2: Free....I think not! Received a variety of "Free" copies of Turbo Tax and decided to use the one from T Rowe Price. I was blown away by the $39.99 fee for State and e-filing. For some reason my daughter's was cheaper at 29.99, despite having two states. I probably would have been better off buying a copy of Turbo Tax at Costco and paying a smaller fee for e-filing.

column1: Perhaps next year, I'll try a different program. repetitive final steps.....surprise fees!

column2: Can't eliminate paying for additional services I couldn't figure out how to take off the additional "PLUS More Help & Tools" package for $29.99. It didn't actually seem possible. I feel like I was suckered into paying for additional services that I neither wanted or needed. Very Frustrating!!! Being suckered into paying extra
Awful for reporting Business Expense, especially mileage. It so complicated a usually easy process. Even the answers that were specifically for Deluxe were not correct.

column1: I used this last year, but I didn't have a 1099.
You cannot get to the forms to see them easily. Very difficult to make sense of. I was just trying to put in a 1099.
I will not trust Turbo tax next year.

column2: Last Year Using Turbo Tax I've been using Turbo Tax for as long as I've filed taxes. It's become harder, especially for the state tax side. We pay so much money for the software, why is it so difficult to pull in the state return. Why do I have to download an extra piece of software? Shouldn't it just be seamless. If I go somewhere else, there is not this much hassle to do the state return
free version cost $65, doesn't tell you until the end. not happy at all. will be finding something new next year. had to pay $65 for a "free" version of turbotax
SIgnature page If you live out of State and file with IL you must have your IL pin #.

column1: I used the AGI and License info as TT instructed only to be rejected 4 times. I have yet to be able to alter this and put in the IL #. TT techs said I would have to continue to file by snail mail from now on. Why can't TT allow users to correct State signature pages. I spent 2 hours on the phone before they told me I could not use TT for IL. I paid for IL...... Terrible for IL

column2: Turbo Tax Tips You should be more upfront about the cost of Turbo Tax. I thought I was getting a deal buying it through Costco but in reality, I got charged an additional 24.99 when I went to file the returns for "e-filing" which is ridiculous.

column1: In addition, I don't have a cd drive on my laptop but knew that they could allow me to download the product online -- this process took over an hour and the download wouldn't initially work. This was frustrating.

The only real positive I see is the depth of itemized deductions. I wouldn't think to deduct some things that they ask about. They didn't state that I'd have to pay a fee on top of paying for the cd product for e-filing.

column2: Really need to bring back ability to view forms I've used TurboTax for probably 15 years. It used to allow you to examine individual forms, and even delete them. That feature no longer exists.

column1: This year, TT generated spurious forms for stock sales that were "empty" - they were for sales of zero shares. I have no way to look at the list of forms generated and delete those.

Also, during the "check your return" phase, TT said I needed to fill in additional information on those spurious forms. But it was impossible from the "fix this error" dialog to determine *which* stock sale the dialog was referring to.

Bottom line: I need the ability to 1) see the list of actual forms generated, 2) go to a specific form and be able to edit it and 3) be able to delete spurious forms. Messages during return check are cryptic and useless

column2: In-excusable Performance How could you let this happen? For two days now I have not been able to get access to your online order entry site to place an order to e-File my State return and to download my second state preparation file. I am trying to send you more money to get my taxes done and you won't accept it. I tried reaching you by phone today twice. The first time I got a return call pretty quickly but the man I talked to was no help. He admitted that you were having web site problems but offered no solution. I tried calling again later to talk to a supervisor and I never got a returned phone call even though I was told someone would call me in 50 minutes, So I have been chained to my computer all day trying to get this task done and now it is too late for me to get an extension form to the post office since I don't live in a big city. There also does not seem to be a way to file for an extension electronically if all you want to file is a state return extension. Fortunately I was able to file my Federal return electronically on time. I just can't believe that you did not do a better job of preparing for your peak season. There are all kinds of Internet Service Providers out there that would have provided extra capacity for you to be able to handle your heavy workload on tax filing day. Lord knows you charge your customers enough that you could have afforded to prepare for this day better! I have been a loyal Turbo Tax user for years but if this is how you treat your customers when we need you the most, I am looking for another service provider for next year. Abyssmal Web site performance on your peak days!!
refund  some sections were difficult to complete, i.e. Intuit

Mixed feelings The 50 dollar fee for having to upgrade to process a very simple form (1099-R) is ridiculous. Had it been a more in depth form, I could MAYBE understand. But not for mine. Also, when it asks "did you make money in another state" style questions, and I just entered that I did when doing my federal portion, that's quite redundant. It should already know that I did and import and adjust accordingly. I have never had a problem with turbo tax, but for the money that I payed to do it all myself basically, I will definitely be paying less money next year for someone else to do it. Charging 50 dollars to process a 3 second 1099-R
filing 2 states need help not showing a filing in state of Alabama where I worked and lived for over half the year in 2015. Need additional help. not filed in one of the states

upgrade fee I have used you product for years, makes doing taxes very easy I just regret paying for the upgrade when it didn't find anything I didn't deduct last year, my taxes very simple and the statement you can deduct the cost I realize means from your refund owed if applicable, not from the ttaxes owed or as a deduction. no new deductions found
I like turbo tax, it makes it easy to use but the fees are just a little bit outrageous. to many fees
Prices Through the Roof This was waaaaaay more expensive than last year. I feel ripped off. Will probably use a different vendor next year. ridiculously overpriced

Misled and frustrated Imagine my surprise when, after paying $54.99 for the "Deluxe" service and filling out all the information for the state taxes, I found a message saying that "all the work" I had done on my state return would be lost and I would have to fill out my state taxes again on my own unless I paid an additional $39.99. C'mon, Turbotax! I had been very impressed by your product and service until that moment, and now I feel like I'm covered in a really sleazy salesman's slime. I will be calling customer service to ask for my $39.99 back. misled me about the charges

Easy but not free The only thing free about this site is the act of using it. After that, everything costs money. Costs just as much for me to go in and have my taxes done. OF COURSE I want to store my information, OF COURSE I want it deposited into my account and not get some stupid debit card. I started the process online with H&R block because I've used them since 2010. They were going to charge $40 just for filing state. But in the end, it all costs the same amount, you just rearrange where your fees go. You charge for one thing but not another, and another site offers one thing free but charges for another. I guess that's how you catch people. Expensive

Too Much Trouble The first few years I used Turbo Tax, I was impressed with the site. But the last 2 - 3 years it has just been more trouble than it's worth. I get emails telling me if I log in with my username & password that all my info from the previous year will be filled in; however, this is not the case anymore. This year and last year I know for sure that I had to manually fill in all our personal info, like name, DOB, SSN, etc., again. The website needs to be streamlined - some of the steps could be pared back. I understand there are newbies, those who have difficulty with doing their taxes, or have taxes that are very complicated; maybe have two options. I want a truly quick & easy way to file my own taxes, & this service is not it anymore. Also, there have been several instances when it suggested I do something one way, but when I hit the button to do the suggested step, it will end up doing it some other way. For example, my state & federal return got rejected, & after I corrected the mistake it suggested that I mail my returns instead of efile as I'd previously done. I clicked the button agreeing to that, but it immediately gave me a "checking for the best way to file" message, & told me the best way to file would be efile. It makes the service seem inept and untrustworthy. I could go on, but I won't. I'll just end by saying that this will be my last year to use TurboTax. There are several tried & true tax preparers in my community who will file my taxes for the same amount I paid to do it myself with this service, and they'll do it quicker & with a LOT less hassle. Poor website, too much trouble

Beware Refund Processing Fee I had an overall positive experience until the payment screen when a magical "refund processing fee" was added to my bill. After about 5 minutes of toggling back and forth through the various screens, I was able to find and remove this fee, but having it pop up so unexpectedly at the end was an unpleasant experience. refund processing fee

Prices I'm not unhappy with the service that I have received from TurboTax , generally its good service. However , due to circumstances unforeseen for me I had to file on the last day. Of course, there is always fine print. Also , I usually only have to pay like 30.00 for filing , this year it went up to $54.99. Of course, I wasn't happy about that because I have never paid this price. I personally think that jacking the prices up is outrageous.

They dont make it easy Very difficult to file at the end. Tried to make it easy by doing a direct deposit , BUT THEN i had to know routing #'s and account #'s. This info i didnt have with me . So chose then to pay by debit card. I also did not like having to choose a card with confusing fees, ect. It made me afraid to ever withdraw my funds off of that gimmicky card. Scrap that option. So I opted for a good old paper check.....ahhhh deduct payment from your return= visa card headache

poor customer service Signed up for $34.99 premier version, upon completion after a couple weeks price changed to $64.99. Called customer service and was faced with very poor service. Sounds like your employees are frustrated, unhappy and results in being rude to customers without resolving any issues. That is after having waited 45 minutes to talk to a live agent. Why bother! price changes

The Ad Situation has Gotten Out of Control I've filed my taxes through TurboTax since I began filing independently five years ago. This year is the first year I've seriously considered filing elsewhere. While I understand that selling overpriced Plus and Premium services is how TurboTax makes their money, it seems extremely dishonest of a company that prides itself on its simplicity to make it very difficult and confusing for a person to file their taxes for free. I'm a pretty tech-savvy person, so I could easily tell when saying "no" meant I was refusing a product, rather than refusing to file my taxes, but I could easily imagine someone like my grandfather getting confused and thinking he had to pay for services in order to get his taxes filed. Way to prey on the ignorant, TurboTax. Apparently taking candy from babies is your new business model. The number of time you have to reject offers for unnecessary services.

Getting to hard to mover throughout liked last yea This year was way too confusing liked it better than previous years also is getting way too expensive to file TurboTax between that and quicken Last year easer
Robot Cop Overall the program isn't bad. Some the questions are not clear and the program doesn't leave room for fixing.
good service I had to figure out how to move back to the previous page.

column1: I already bought an IRA for this year, had to figure out how to record this without going to the "Mint" prodecall.
The overhang on some pages made it difficult to read the information under the overhang. need to improve some of your instuctions

column2: my poor "back door" Read pros and cons. My "back door" will never work properly from this day forth.

Glad It's Over I called for help. Held for 50 minutes the while being transferred to an expert, the call was dropped an automated voice offered apologies. I called again and waited 45 minutes. Nice lady but her email advice to address my problem was off the mark. I called again and after another 45 got through to an expert whose email was spot on. DO NOT enter the 1099R there, go back and enter it "there". Problem solved. This was a rollover not a distribution, no tax deduction of 6,500 and no penalty for the amount in excess of 6500. I'd give that lady a 10 for 10 if she sent a survey. I was at wits end. The form was complex for my meager needs and took forever to finish, I will say Turbo Tax is thorough and CPAs will love it. My rollover to a rollover caused a lot of angst and a potential tax

You added a fee for a state tax return that was not needed. You advertise that the federal tax return was free for my situation and that the only fee I had was the tools to keep my previous information. New Hampshire does not require a state tax return and no matter what I clicked you charged me, resulting in you take over $90 in fees when it should have only been $29.99. You trick people with these fees. At the end of filing you even sent me verification that my state did not require a tax return, yet still charged me for it. I would like that fee refunded to me in my direct deposit check.

You are Thieves!!!!! You are thieves!!!!!! My state return was rejected. You texted me to say you would help me fix the problem and to re-file. I paid $30 to file my state tax return with you. You did NOTHING. I never heard from you again. You are thieves!!!!!!!! I will never use you again!!!!!! You text me that you'll help with a rejected state return...then you do NOTHING!!!!!!
Great.....until Too expensive for a free program. I didn't mind the state fee, I could even shrug off the $50 fee for one number.

column1: I can't shrug off a $35 processing fee when they claim it is a free program.

I always due my taxes by February, but this year I was late because of life circumstances. I had never done a 1099-misc before so I wanted some guidance. I'll never use turbo tax again because of the processing fee.

Way to nickle and dime people. I use your app to organize my purchases, but I'm done with that too. I'll find a free one or I'll do it the old fashioned way. Supposed to be free, but they charge a $35 fee, plus I had to pay $50 to enter one number.

column2: Railroad Retirement not so clear Been using TurboTax for years and found it works well, is easy, and complete. This year the pension section was after most of the less common forms of income and the Railroad Retirement section was hard to find on the Social Security line. The real problem was that the form 1099 and the form 1099-R incomes, and federal tax paid had to be added together to make the complete income totals. There were no instructions about adding them. I'm not sure that the turbotax form "realizes" that there are two different forms. RRB hard to find and didn't state clearly the additions necessary
charged me twice for the service charged me twice for the service one for $94.98 which I did not order and the real one for $25. WTF??? charged me twice

Too Expensive, hidden fees I suspect I did not get all the deductions and credits I could have qualified for. A friend of mine used HR block and I wish i had also. At the end of my turbotax filing this year, I find out that they charged me for the deluxe addition ($54.99) when i had opted for the free edition, and they charged me the full price when i had found it for $10 cheaper on their site! Additionally, they charge $34.99 to file your state taxes, and on top of that when it was time to efile, they said that i couldnt efile unless I agreed to upgrade to the PREMIUM SERVICES PACKGE which is an additional $40! My total came to around $150 in the end, and during my tax preparation I had said my tax fees were only $34.99, because at that time i had no idea they were going to jip me like they did.

column1: I hate using turbotax, and that says a lot coming from me because I have been a loyal user of turbotax for 10 years! not trust worthy, expensive

column2: Too expensive I was unable to enter in a 1099-MISC without paying 54.99 just to enter it. It was a very simple document, had no tax deductions. Was simply Nonemployee compensation. Ended up spending as much to do my taxes online as I would have had I gone to a tax service. Had to spend 55 just to file federal, then another 40 for state

Hidden Fees I understand the fee for filing state, but with the free federal return I don't understand where the extra charge came from...surely it wasn't for accessing the little blips that explain what certain parts mean????? I just don't get it. And I am not stupid, have Master's degree etc, and think this is something that needs to be explained or let people know ahead of time that they will get charged. Hidden 29.95 fee came out of somewhere
2015 return Previous years turbo tax has been a breeze...this year did not seem to flow like past years...you've changed something, but I don't know what that is.

column1: issues...in the business part it kept asking for "trade-in" information, even though I said I didn't have any trade-in.

At the end in review...just says enter this info you missed, but no explainations/instructions of what this item was or what exactly it was looking for. spent lots of time going to the section where we thought this was at...some places said to leave it blank, yet review kept telling me i had to enter something! some areas are confusing

column2: Excellent - EXCEPT.... I do not like bait and switch. If you claim something is free, make it free. If you let me know ahead of time, before going through all the rigamarole to type everything in, I can decide for myself whether or not I want to continue. And I get it that you would probably say that the statement was 'free federal returns' or something to that effect, but you could and should make it crystal clear up front what the actual cost will be to do one's taxes. No gimmicks or gotchas. You stated "free" -- and then charged me $30

Lots of things need to be fixed AFTER you pay. The program gave me the impression it was all done and all was good. I paid for it. AFTER that, they did a final check and found LOTS of things that needed fixed. This final check should be sooner, not after you think you are done. Constantly have to re enter the same stuff

California HSA Employee Contribution Deduction Going through California HSA deductions, it tells me that W2 box 12 has code W which means employer contribution (even though I contributed 80% of it with pre-tax money). It says the amount is added back in as taxable income. Why is my portion taxed? i thought it was not supposed to be. Does not make sense

The software kept freezing while I was doing my return - took me longer to accomplish what should have been as easy task. It wasn't my computer as I was still able to open the internet and other programs. Last year I loved it since I didn't run into any issues like I did this year.

Some issues I started out with form 2441 but found out I couldn't use the deduction. I deleted the form three times and it kept coming back. It got very upsetting. In addition, I was charged with extra fees that I didn't think I requested. form kept coming back and charged for extra fees

Miss the forms views The menus and help screens are great for guiding you through the process, however, I really needed to look at my forms and attachments. The interface would not allow for that (I presume because its not paid for in advance, and I could have just copied the information into my own forms). Very disappointing, I would have been willing to pay in advance. Inability to look at forms
Turbo Tax Review - 2015 I have been using Turbo Tax for years. The software is easy to use, intuitive and has excellent help screens. I have never had an issue with a tax return.

column1: I do have one very big issue. The price of the State Tax Form has become extremely expensive. It is a simple add on. Having worked most of my career for technology companies, I understand the cost of Research and Development. Frankly, had I not procrastinated through 7:00 PM on the 18th, I could have easily completed my state return using the information compiled on my Federal Return.

If the cost of filing a state return doesn't decline, I will be making every effort to prepare my state tax manually, and take the $40 and go drown my sorrows at how much I pay in taxes. Cost of State Tax Form

column2: n/a Cost too much, I can get more return for my money with my guy. will not use you next year ! n/a

relatively simple did not have option to enter charitable contributions other than the ones listed. was not happy with that - had several. no online help with particular questions - will need to go elsewhere for review and answers

Too much and too many I could pay somebody to do it for me for less. I don't even know why I still use this. Takes way too long and costs too much. Too many questions that don't apply to me and at $95 plus $35 for deposit is way too much.

Turbotax screws you at the end with an extra fee Turbotax screws you at the end with an additional fee to a bank. Once you put in deduct the turbotax fee from my refund, you are stuck with the $34.99 fee to some pathetic bank. There is no way to undo your decision and just have it mailed to you. I will never use turbotax again.

Ok but... I've used this many years now. Still, it is a little too much of a "black box" for my tastes. For example it filled out a form that I had a very hard time finding to review. Next year, with a simplified life style I might do my own. But probably use them again. It was hard to review each form before submitting

Let people know up front that if they are going to use a credit card to pay what they owe they will have to pay a big fee to do it. At the end tp find out that on top of the money I had to pay I would be charged a fee of over 2% just for using a credit

Very infomative product! Software is very informative and intuitive. The fee has gone up a bit since last year as well. It was more expensive for State and Federal than others. Would've done with another product/ didn't want to start over!

Not very happy I was thoroughly enraged by the auto file feature being dangled in front of me like an infant. And how many times are you going to ask me if I want to upgrade? I had a w-2 and did nothing else significant. The best service in the world would have netted me the same return, (owing money) so why are you even bothering? And please make it clear up front that state taxes are 30$. I did not owe or receive any state taxes. So you wanted me to pay you 30$ to submit a page of data and take care of no cash transaction?!? I think not. quit trying to upsell me. 6 times i had to say no

Streamline Military Retired Pay questions I guess a few more examples and hints are needed for Guys like me trying to figure out how Military Retirement is to be treated. Couldn't get clear answers about how to treat Military Retirement Pay.
access and going back into returns on internet
I never received my refund from last year I was supposed to get a 1500 + refund from 2014 and in checking back I found I never received it. How can I get it?

know what your buying I work in one state and live in another. I purchased Turbo Tax Deluxe to file fed & state. Since my employer placed 2 tax id Numbers, one for each state, when It came time to download the state info I selected the first state on my w-2, not knowing I could ONLY download ONE. Well, it was the wrong state that Collects my income tax and so when I went to download my state of residence, Turbo Tax wanted another $45... forget it. I'll just go on the states website. made a purchasing mistake- unable to undo it
spend more My cost for non itemized and direct deposit $129.

column1: My girlfriend paid $119 itemized and direct deposit. State and federal
I tried a link for a $20 deduction but it did not work.
Turbo tax advertised as federal free. cost. my girlfriend had hers done by a professional, itemized and direct deposit for $119.

column2: Part Great / Part Not For a salary worker with income from that and self employment, Turbo Tax on-line asks all the questions, including finding deductions the average person wouldn't know about. Bought the software this year, am going to return it. It didn't work like the on-line does. Gave me different numbers and no assistance. I wound yup using Turbo Tax on line instead. Next year I will file earlier and maybe be able to get a better price. Very overpriced
Robbery Way too expensive especially the 34,99 to have the fees deducted from your refund. That is ridiculous. Too expensive
Ok Service, Annual Increase in Price  Answers to questions tend to be vague, price to file continues to increase every year.
