Did not function as promised We had several issues with the State return pulling in information that was not included in the Federal return. Several attempts were made to contact Turbo Tax. Calls were not returned in a timely manner or at all. Those calls that we did receive did not provide a resolution to our issues.

column1: Very disappointed in Turbo Tax this year. Prior year's have been easy to use and submit. Inflexible user interface, changes in Federal not transferred to State, lack of response from call center

column2: charged me twice I bought and paid for Turbo Tax in January 2016 but didn't file my taxes until April. When I filed my taxes in April I had to pay a second time. I spoke to several people at Turbo Tax and was told "sorry, you should have filed when you paid for it. There's nothing we can do about." I had my order # and they agreed I had paid for it but I couldn't use my order.

column1: I have used Turbo Tax for many years but this will be the last time! What a rip off!!

column2: Way too expensive for short form Electronic theft! Short form should be free! way too expensive for short form
Is this 2016? So absurd that you cannot automatically download W-2s, 1099s, etc. from the biggest banks and advisors.

column1: Your social security number should almost be enough.
Had to enter everything by hand. Didn't agree with what I know as the passwords to my accounts. Not nearly as easy as it should be

column2: pay then pay more then....  it forgets things and then asks for more money to remember.

what a rip off Now TurboTax Delux charges you for calculating state taxes and you don't find out about it until you get there. I paid this year but I will probably look for an alternative tax preparation next year.

column1: I feel ripped off. Charged double for calculating state taxes

column2: You'll pay My brother did his return from the Federal Web site and got the federal and state for free. I went directly to TurboTax and it cost me over $60. If I didn't wait until the last day I would have cancelled and used a cheaper alternative. I'll know bette next year. After the horrible stunt TurboTax pulled last year, I thought they'd have learned their lesson. Sure the Federal was Free, but the state cost me over $60

Unclear Payment process isn't clear. There's a lack of information to prepare you for how the filing process will go. I had to request a payment plan but there was no warning that I would need to print and mail in a form. I don't have access to a printer. This was inconvenient. Also, prices for the upgraded software (I was required to use) are too expensive in comparison to other sites like H&R Block. unclear

Super easy Super easy. Customer service was very helpful over the phone. The thing I didn't like was having to pay that extra $30 charge to pay with the federal return. I don't have money in my account to pay for it, so I had to use the federal return taking another $30 out): Extra $30 charge for paying with the federal return
Ignoring repeated requests for help Unable to return a phone call and required me to submit a tax return without their advice and forcing me to pay when I signed up to file for free.

column1: Turbo tax is useless when it comes to customer service and that is why I will be going to H&R Block next year. Unable to return a phone call when customer service said they would repeatedly.

column2: rocked my refund very easy to follow and will recommend to a friend too many questions

Do it yourself It was indicated that the deluxe service was required when it was absolutely not, there was no way to reverse that level of service once you accept the upgrade. This service would not allow me to not accept this upgrade - this is terrible business in my opinion. this is a ripoff

Too expensive for a FREE Tax return!!!!!! Terribly disappointed in that for such a simple tax return, that you popped the spring loose at the end and charged me $65. Next time I'll file a paper return. What started out as a FREE Return, ended up costing me $65!

ok I am self employed and only earned $12000. You want to charge me $144 to enter my earnings. I think this is excessive, since you were advertising $0 filing. My bank, PNC, who's link I when thru to use your software, will become aware of this issue. I used Turbo tax last year, and previous years info did not carry over, which was a little annoying. too expensive for low income filers
poor service  paid for plus 29.99 but never got answers from turbotax, but finally figured out on my own

Too expensive Way too expensive....I can pay someone else to do my taxes for only a little more....not worth $145 in my opinion Must have been a bait n switch, I don't remeber agreeign to $104 when I started...THought it was $79
The Worst Held me over a barrel for more than $80 (including more than $30 in hidden fees) to file an HSA form that was absolutely unnecessary. Stuck me with over $80 in useless fees

cost not good i fell that turbo tax is a great way for me to file my own taxes, but i feel that if i have to buy the software i shouldnt be hit with so many fees. its almost as bad as paying HR block to file my taxes as i provide asnwers for them to plug in. lower the costs please adding up fees not fair

Problems with IRA Distribtuion I received only one 1099R for a gross IRA distribution. Most of the distribution was re-contributed within 60 days. Some was converted to Roth IRA, all of which I subsequently unwound. Trying to enter this into TurboTax was very difficult. Prompts led to inaccurate entries. Re: IRA contributions in the deductions section, need better explanation that "contributions" are only those amounts that come from external sources, e.g., savings. Recharacterizing a distribution is not a "contribution." I submitted a question regarding the above to TurboTax. Never received any response. Explanation or IRA Contributions Needs Improvement
Go Back. I wish you would go back to last years format. You did not make it easier. I don't like the new format. Last year was better.
complicated everything  if you cant file a state return do not charge me for it.

what the 1. it shouldn't cost to direct deposit. 2. it should definitely not cost for each state that you file. like why can't i live in 2 states and not know the rocket science of tax filing? turbo whack... but why did u take my money?

Why I hate TurboTax TurboTax, like other tax companies, pull a classic bait and switch. Offering free filing and the like, only to pull the rug out at the last moment at any change in your income/status/lifestyle/income. I understand I may need premium features but this in no way affects my state return, so WHY CHARGE ME SO MUCH FOR IT? I am paying TurboTax about as much as the federal government which is messed up. I don't see the correlation between the product TurboTax advertises and the actual cost to use. Seems deceptive and will not be using in the future. Decieves you to spend more money

Helpful but surprisingly expensive I do not want to appear to bash TurboTax, because I do appreciate what it has to offer. I log in each year - and the program remember me. If I work for the same company, it actually imports the W-2 for me (awesome!) but yet each year, a fraction of my return is taken away from surprise charges by TurboTax. All of a sudden, you get to the File page and you owe almost $100.00 to file both returns (yes, they charge you separately). If you want to walk through step-by-step each possible deduction, they will deem that you are using the "Delux" version and you suddenly get to pay $50+ just to finish your Federal Taxes. I do not make a lot of money, but I do look forward to my return. TurboTax helps make the process easy and keeps it at a level that I can understand. However, the growth in popularity is evident as the growth in their charges rises each year. Pricey and not very simple.

Good, but far from great. Have used it for years, will continue to do so. Some parts of the product (navigation, online help, flexibility) have deteriorated over the years. Online help is of dubious value, and sometimes wrong. E-Trade import seriously short circuited some critical steps.

UN NECESSARY UPGRADE I had my taxes already completed and just needed to efile- already completed and paid for....turbo tax held me hostage and insisted I pay for upgrade before efile taxes..........BAD BUSINESS.....NEED REFUND ON THE UPGRADE.....

column1: I PAID TWICE!!! SEE BELOW!!!!!

column2: doubled price at finish I have paid close to $40 every year for as long as I can remember to file my taxes. This year, at the finish line, it was $79! This will be my last year to use turbotax.

Not Worth The Money...At All While it's faster than manually doing a return, for someone who has no investments, doesn't own a home and does't itemize deductions, using TurboTax is a waste of money. I have used it in previous years and paid either nothing or nowhere near what it cost this year! What they've done is this: features that used to be free or carried a small charge are now part of a 'premium' package so they can to try to justify charging, or charging more. This is completely unacceptable and I will never, ever use this software again. Did nothing I couldn't have done on my own (except saved time) and cost was gouge-level!

Not happy Last year, it cost me $30 to do taxes on Turbo tax. This year, it cost $120 because for some reason, it signed me up for Turbo plus and would not let me undo because I clicked on help (not knowing I was in Turbo plus). . I will not use Turbo Tax again. The first time I tried this year, it tried to charge me $60, so I abandoned it. Then I couldn't find a free software, so I came back and it charged me $90 that time. I cancelled again and came by hoping to get the $60 charge again, but it was $120 this time, so I just processed it to get it over with and made a vow not to use Turbo Tax again. Make it less easy to press the wrong thing and upgrade accidentally. Too expensive!! I could've bought a grill or a table for my deck with this money, but instead, Turbo Tax gets it. smh. Not happy. Easy to click on the wrong thing and incur charges that can't be removed

poor calculation of estimated state taxes I filed with TT for my 2014 taxes last year and used it to calculate estimated taxes for fed and CO state. I earned only 87% of what I used in the calculation but paid the full amounts. I overpaid the feds quite a bit and underpaid the state by a bunch, enough to cause a penalty from the state.

column1: It also screwed up worksheets for K-1. And it included unneeded Scchedule E. It thought I had rental income, when that was never selected. Even after going in and redoing to make sure I did not mark rental income, it kept the extra workisheet. Ugghhh!
Previous years have worked much better for me in TT. Poor calculation of estimated state taxes

column2: Going somewhere else next year. At least I never have to come back now. Lots of irrelevant information collected for marketing purposes and much more expensive than I expected.

not happy with this process This is the last time I will be using turbotax. The options are absurd. Pay $30 to automatically import the data from last year or start from scratch? Pay $70 because you have an HSA. Pay for MA tax filing. If I'm going to pay upwards of $100 I'll pay someone to do this for me.

need updates with current systems the import feature for stock sales does not pull all of the required information. it doesn't include the same features as manually inputting the info. no feature to use lump sum. asked for detailed info for each stock sale price per unit, not per transaction. manual input allows options. poor feature if you have lots of sales to report.

column1: Also wanted to see what updating W4 would look like so I entered info but didn't finish. I had to go back and manually delete the inputs because there is no option to delete the whole entry at once. after 20 minutes on hold without reaching an agent, and an hour of trying to figure it out I finally realized I had to delete each input for the review tool not to give false alarm. I couldn't file until I cleared it all. stock sale info isnt complete which makes it inaccurate

column2: need updates with current systems the import feature for stock sales does not pull all of the required information. it doesn't include the same features as manually inputting the info. no feature to use lump sum. asked for detailed info for each stock sale price per unit, not per transaction. manual input allows options. poor feature if you have lots of sales to report.

column1: Also wanted to see what updating W4 would look like so I entered info but didn't finish. I had to go back and manually delete the inputs because there is no option to delete the whole entry at once. after 20 minutes on hold without reaching an agent, and an hour of trying to figure it out I finally realized I had to delete each input for the review tool not to give false alarm. I couldn't file until I cleared it all. stock sale info isnt complete which makes it inaccurate

column2: Completely dissatisfied with TurboTax 2016 1. Turbotax did not update their software to handle the 1099 reporting for options. My brokerage used negative numbers as proceeds and brokerage firm said that is how IRS requires them to report it. When Turbotax expert/customer service was contacted the advice given was incorrect. The person asked me to flip the cost/proceed. I took the advice of my brokerage firm and entered all the line items with cost basis and proceeds manually (several hundred). What is the point of paying $150+ to Turbotax if I am spending hours doing this work manually??? Also, the customer service representative was RUDE.

column1: 2. Turbotax hires incompetent people who don't know what excess 401(k) deferral means. Spent 30 mins repeating the same information to the customer service representative. She took 30 mins to write down what I was saying and then said she took notes and will inform the expert who can answer my questions. After 30 mins she said she will transfer me to the expert now and I was on hold for 1 hour and did not get anyone on the phone. I finally hung up. To the best of my knowledge "Transfer" does not equal "Place on Hold"

3. I have used Turbotax since 1999 and it keeps getting worse every year and the price just keeps going up and I see that every year I am having to enter more and more information manually. I will not use Turbotax again. See detailed review

column2: Wouldn't let me print or efile Pretty mad at TurboTax - program wouldn't let me print or efile my taxes. I'm using another service next year. Put in any expletives you want here and it wouldn't start to express my feelings toward Turbo Tax - after 10yrs of using TurboTax - this has turned me away. Wouldn't let me print or efile my tax returns
only use this is you don't have your return from your previous year and you used these jokers then as well. $300+ difference between free and premium service without any extra tax info provided

There is no notification of the $29.99 charge for state taxes until you have completed the entire tax return form. If you want to try the free edition of state tax service they offer, you have to start all over. Dishonest.

most painful experience of my life expensive--- i did not want to pay for my taxes at all (why should I pay to pay) and someone suggested this. It is NOT FREE. save yourself sometime and fill out the actual paperwork. four hours later after filling out my forms, the software decided to tell me it's going to be $60 to file my state taxes---- which i didn't even say to file! I had to delete my whole account to file my federal taxes because once you fill out the form for state there is no removing it. disgraceful. slow, tricky, expensive, conniving, hard-sell, bait-and-switch

Disappointment I've used TurboTax for 10 years. Because of a major screw up, we didn't file taxes last year. When we realized "I thought you did it" meant no one did it, I immediately went on line to access Turbo Tax to file. I was told I could not access my historical data without buying the next year's version of Turbo Tax. I have always been able to access this information at any time in the past years. I bought what I was directed to, and still couldn't access it. Then I was told on the phone #after multiple calls and long conversations with obvious trainees# that the data was unavailable, and they were aware of the problem. Two months later, the same thing. Six months later, I still can't access it, and I believe it is because I ended up buying a desktop version versus the on line version. Whatever the case, I figured out how to get the information the hard paper way, but you can imagine the stress I went through trying to access this. I know I just filed for this year, and had to use Turbo Tax, because I bought every freaking thing I could to get my taxes done. I still can't access my historical data, but I don't have the time to get on the phone and train more Turbo Tax employees. Lesson: Print your stuff, don't trust computer saving, and for heaven's sake, don't count on Turbo Tax keeping your data for you.

column1: Also, this year, I had to work at finding where to put my dependent child. The question/community stuff is a pain, and rarely does a link to the right place appear. You still have to surf to find it, which I ultimately did. But this is a fail for me.

Otherwise, it's organized, and relatively clear. I just have a real dislike for the problems that I've been caused and their customer support. Dependent Info Hard to Find / Historical Data a Nightmare

column2: Had to buy it twice I have been using turbo tax for years at home and I am very disappointed. I finally used a computer at work and paid for it again just to get it done. The program at home said there was a problem but would not show me what it was.

column1: I am at work I cannot add an image The program I bought from Sam's a an error in it and would not efile. I tried to call for help, that did not fix it

column2: I have never had so many problems e-filing taxes. I have used TurboTax for years but this online service doesn't seem to make anything obvious. There seems to be no cross checking to make sure that the same information at different places. The state e-file was a complete mess. IL requires a PIN but you don't make it obvious where to enter it. I had to refile several times trying to get this sorted out and there was no obvious solution to it. It appears that you are using the Federal PIN rather than the state. I am still not sure that my taxes are going to be correctly filed. Just keeping my fingers crossed.
Hidden fees They have many hidden fees (over $200). They even wanted to charge me to file state return on Florida where there is no state tax. I won't use them again. Many hidden fees $200+
TiskTisk All was good until my only option was to have the charge deducted from federal refund due to low bank account balance nad have to pay another $35. EXPENSIVE

Gouged the poor this year with your prices For someone like me who teaches music and has the majority of his income come from a 1099, I have to pay for that extra option. Now I do not make very much money as a teacher so you might suggest to simply not file taxes. However, since I am on a Marketplace insurance I am required to file taxes. The extra costs to file with TurboTax using a 1099 this year over previous years was outrageous and really hurt the bank. If costs don't go back down for someone like me I will not be using this service in the future The prices for filing with a 1099, deducting, and filing a state return were outrageously high

feel ripped off the program did not tell me as I moved from federal to state taxes that they were going to charge me. Then they claimed they would charge me $29.99 when I tried to file the state tax. Then, at the end, when I was filing both federal and state, they inexplicably charged me 64.99. I am completely upset. Turbotax is intentionally stealing from me and I will not use them again.

column1: I only wanted the free option and they misled me into eventually paying them 64.99 for what I could have done in an hour myself. Hate this experience. they made me feel like state taxes were free when they are not

column2: Do not trust Turbo Tax Your agency is preying upon the poor, just like HRBlock, you have the temerity to cheat an ederly person. "Kick Rock you dirty mofo" Think consumers are dumb.....need delux for a 1040......

E-files shows successful but rejected I could not print and review my tax returns - kept getting "Network error". The electronic filing shows successful but keep getting tax return rejected. I can't print my tax returns due to network error so I can't send in my returns by mail - I'm stuck and not a happy camper - this has taken me all day and I'm still not done! Not happy and Not impressed as my first time user. Talked to IRS at 4:40PM MDT and after 3 attempts to E-file that show successful still nothing showing an attempt at IRS. Can't print return due to Network error so I can file hard copy - this sucks 4th time trying to electronically file - get rejected as not legible

Charged me twice for something I already bought Bought the version of Turbotax that included free state filing. When I got to the end of the filing process it said it would be $19.99 to file my state return? Since it was the due date I did not have any choice but to go ahead and pay the $19.99. But what do I find when the website loads for me to pay. The charge will be $24.99. Even more!! WTF? I already paid for it once, then I have to give in and pay again. And when I finally do they charge more. Buyer beware. Have to seriously consider using this again next year. double charged, then charged more
oops The one bad turn that Turbo Tax sent me down was mid-way telling me that if I opened an IRA this year, BASED ON THE INFO> THEY HAD THUS FAR I would qualify for a deduction.

column1: So I stopped filing, ran to the bank and opened an IRA.

When the time came to enter the info. as a deduction it said YOU DON"T QUALIFY FOR THIS DEDUCTION due to MAGI over 70K. That info was on file already when the program recommended this step to me. That was wrong, a waste of my time, and a major disappointment. siad you WILL instead of you MAY or let's check further to see if you qualify

column2: just ok I have used turbo tax or 11 years and this year we sold a house and had to upgrade to premium for three questions $30 more for 3 questions! I tried to call, 45 min on hold and got disconnected. then I go to check out, and my $64.99 premier edition and free state is now $79.99 and $39.99. for 120.00 I could have had some one else have the stress of doing my taxes for me!!! just as expensive as the tax office, codes didn't work and no one available to help

Marginal I would be happy to pay for the turbo tax product before starting the return, then have the return loaded with the previous year's info, and then be able to complete the return and see the results on the actual 1040 and supporting schedules as I proceed. I would also like to be able to enter info on the return (in a what if manner) to see what the impact would have been had if other income or expenses were available. cannot see forms and return until the very end

Not happy Got to the end of my "free" return and wouldn't let me file unless I signed up for "deluxe Plan". Not only do I owe Uncle Sam this year, but I get held over a barrel (additional $55.00) by TurboTax. I've used them the last several years and have not had this problem before.....will have to think very carefully before using them again.....SHAME!!! hidden fees
Walked in, forced to spend more money Everything works smoothly, but geared to keep asking for more money. State returns, forced into a point where I had to just spend the extra $40

Ugh, the IRS is brutal. I've filed with TurboTax for the only 3 years that I've been filing, and now I'm having problems with the IRS for past years with no help because I chose the affordable option. Seeming simple doesn't MAKE it simple, it just makes it even more confusing.

Not as expected :( Disappointed that "free" really means come on in and we will hammer you with additional services at added cost along the way. The amount of forms took longer than expected. The overall process was slower than I expected. Some things worked well, but others are clunky and repetitive. The worst part is that when you have a question, the FAQs can't answer it, and it takes FOREVER to get a hold of one of their agents on the phone. The other frustrating thing is that the "tax refund estimator" asks questions that should allow them to tell you a pretty accurate estimate of the refund - especially since I have no house, no kids, no wife and no additional earnings. But the estimator said I would get approx. $4300 back, while the real deal turbotax calculated less than half of that as the actual return. Really disappointed to find out my return was half as much as previously "estimated"! I assume "estimate" should mean within about 10% margin of error if all the input data was the same for both websites! Too slow, too many forms, added fees along the way
Mostly good The con made me have to refill twice Holds your hand to tightly and some times the mobile version won't let you type the numbers correctly
Initially the site stated that it was free, but by the time I got through, they charged me for every filing, about $200. Fees at the end

WORSE & LAST TURBOTAX EXPERIENCE After entering all W2's & many 1099's TurboTax crashed and lost everything. Had trouble logging back in for my previous year filing to help with this years' return. after 6 password reset attempts, 28 minutes on hold when told waiting time was 10 minutes I finally got back in.

column1: Constantly asks to verify entries from previous year filing, including to look at lines on the form that it has loaded, instead of just asking if you amended your prior year filing without updating TurboTax.

Many questions were confusing. Have used TurboTax for about 18 years, will go to an accountant next year to save time and aggravation. Crashed and lost 90+% of initial entries, constantly asked for verification of info in the form eFiled in previous year.

column2: :( when you advertise that its free it should be free !!!!!!!!! ????

BAD This was BY FAR, the worst Turbo Tax experience I have ever had (over 10 consecutive years). I am moving on without recognition of this. I had to keep repeating infromation. Even after all was reviewed and accepted.

Mostly good but problems came up Turbo Tax would not accept the Payer ID for a 1099-Misc for the State of Nevada. This was not some obscure small business, it was the Nevada government 9-digit code. This gave an error that would not go away, and prevented me from filing electronically. There was no address given by Turbo Tax for mailing a return to the IRS. I mistakenly mailed it to the address that prints at the beginning of the print file, for making quarterly payments to the IRS. These were useless, as I should get a refund. Why do they print out and why is there no information on what TT is printing? I later found out I should send my return to Fresno CA, not Cincinatti OH. I never had these problems in the past with TT. I'm dissatisfied with the 2015 product. Payer ID for 1099-MISC, no mail address for paper filing
Rip off I was unaware of the fee associated with some of the options. It ended up costing $97, when I thought it would be 29.99. Not likely to use this program again!
had alot of trouble don't buy unless you have the very up to date programs on your computer!!!!!! if you have trouble they dont know what to do just tell you tofile on paper
Good if your taxes are very simple  Handling of rental property could be improved
Will not be using TurboTax next year The fees are outrageous

Too Expensive for 1 extra addition I was unable to add in my HSA information unless i upgraded to the package costing $55. It was only one additional block of information that needed to be added and it didn't even earn me an extra amount on my refund to cover what the program cost. I should have been able to do this with the free version. I was basically forced to upgrade just to complete my return simply because I had an HSA. Paying extra $$ just to enter HSA Info
Rip off Still pretty easy to use, but Turbo Tax gets sneakier and sneakier about taking large portions of your money. I won't be using it again. Everything else

Like the CD Version Better If I needed to go back and fix something or needed help, most of the time, it would net let you amend certain parts before filing or the solutions were basically, "File and then amend when they reject."

column1: I also thought that if the CD version gave you a free state filing, then the online version would too. Ended up costing me more than letting someone else do it. Not User Friendly, No Free State File

column2: Good product, but... Solid program, but it is expensive and every year the cost goes up! Expensive

Work needed I like using Turbo Tax but I find the closing, previewing and working with the Preview and Printing a necessary evil. It is not straightforward and the instructions are confusing. Confusing and time wasting finalyzing.

TurboTax Not what it used to be! I have been using TurboTax for YEARS, and I am an accounting professional & QuickBooks Pro Advisor. So I feel it is safe to say I am experiences and not a "newbie" when it comes to using this system. This year I had 4 calls into to support, one call lost when the support phone system crashed, and one call wasted when a rather unknowledgeable support person gave me a discount code for my troubles that I was not ever able to get to a screen to apply. I also had data that I put in that mysteriously disappeared, and found it tricky navigating the process without signing up for something I did not want . I do not expect these foils for a PAID tax filing service. If it was free, I could understand. Without knowledge of major improvements by tax time next year, I will be looking for different software. No longer intuitive/ repeated attempts to force an upgrade/support is ifffy
Frustrated First, I wanted a download to my computer - could not find the Web links.

column1: I hate Web applications in a browser. I had a mistake but could not back up to fix it which forced filing by mail.
Could not find a way to review forms.
When I know what I want to do, why won't you let me do it? Not flexible

column2: Generally great with some significant flaws Data entry process in general worked very well except where my documentation did not match what it wanted me to input. Significant difficulty with with ESOP. 1099 form from broker did not have blocks filled out in manner that Turbotax would accept. Help documentation was insufficient to determine correct way to enter information, so ultimately had to guess.

column1: Final analysis process had similar problems as well as user interface issues. Turbotax would find an issue for review, but the information it would ask for was unclear, referencing the actual IRS form, rather than the simplified summary interface used for everything else. For instance, it would ask to correct an entry on item 3, without anything on the form identified by that number. The interface here was particularly bad. If you scrolled down to try and view the section it was referencing, the data fields and form in background would scroll at different rates, so you could not tell what the entries were referenced to. Ultimately had to again guess an entry that it would accept.

I have used it in the past when my taxes were simpler without any issue. As they have gotten more complex, have been required to use more premium versions, but you do not get any value for the additional price, Turbotax does not handle higher complexity very well. Final analysis review poorly done, not capable of managing information that does not fit it's framework

column2: Outrageous I have been using TurboTax for years and it just keeps getting more expensive. The cost of the software, then an additional fee of $45 to do state and then a charge of $24.99!!! From now on I will be supporting a local accountant and not TurboTax! Plus I uploaded my W2 and it said there was errors with both mine and my spouse's. Price

I have been using turbotax for years. Turbo tax sucked this year. No ability to talk to people. I tried to use the help, but never got response. Very disappointing. I 've been using TurboTax since 1996. And this is the first time I was not able to talk to a person. I am concerned about your customer service this year. I tried 3 times to contact help and all I could do was send a message to other users.

column1: What's up? where is the 800 number # bad..bad..bad..customer servive

column2: im a bit confused  confused if i needed to do something different after filing for the extension
You over charged me for my son's state return! You over charged me for my son's state return! I paid $44.99 for a VA state return and then I was re-charged $24.99 to resubmit.

column1: You don't rock Expensive, repetitive

column2: Minor Cons I've used it for about 4 years now, and overall it's amazing I can do this; however little things like not having a navigation menu for quick links makes the flow longer.

column1: I would suggest also improving the extra help navigation section. It's not very helpful. Not very clear when it comes to fixing errors

column2: Changing Next Year_BAD Product It got stuck in a loop, kept taking me back to fix my return, wouldn't let me e-file. Kept saying form1098 had to be linked/ connected to my Home Mortgage worksheet. You imported it, Ya think you would know where it went, what connected to what. Spent valuable time going thru this till the end, then it wouldn't let me e-file. Will have to restart on another product. GRRR. It got stuck in a loop, kept taking me back to fix my return, wouldn't let me e-file

Oklahoma Capital Gain/Loss Allocation The State of Oklahoma requires you to indicate whether or not the capital gain/loss was for an Oklahoma company. If you have a number of transactions (I had over 100), you are presented with a list and have to individually provide the Oklahoma city in which the corporation is located or check a box saying "not an Oklahoma based company". You have to go into each transaction and edit it. Once you edit a transaction, it takes you back to the top of the list and doesn't remove the one you just edited. You have to manually keep track of which transactions you have edited and it will not tell you which ones you haven't nor will it let you move forward unless you complete them all or skip it to come back later. It either needs to present you with a worksheet list that you can edit and see all edited transactions or simply remove each entry after it has been edited. Extremely tedious and inefficient and lazy programming
you all take more money than what you said. it sucks!!!!!!! you all take more money then what you say.

Navigatigating through forms I have used turbo tax for years and currently prepare my 3 children's taxes as well. Obviously I like it. However, this year I had difficulty moving through the forms. Often if I hit the back button it would take me all the way back to the start of the topic instead of the previous question. Additionally it would skip several questions ahead when the continue button was pressed. This happened quite frequently. Software seemed slow & unresponsive, skipped ahead or too far back

Too redundant I do think TurboTax is the fastest/easiest, but the steps are too repetitive, especially considering there's a review step. Some information had to be entered three or more times. Other than that, fast and painless. Redundant to the point I wanted to quit life. Also, should not have to pay to import W2 info/preserve previous years'

eh... I seriously lost 75% of my refund due to the nickel-and-diming of your fees. Secondly...I didn't need to file a state return for Florida (nobody in Florida does) but that didnt stop you from trying to jack another $40 from me Expensive

e-Fileing State Returns By purchasing the TurboTax Premier CD, I thought I was purchasing the e-file option for both the Federal and State income taxes. I was surprised that I had to pay for the state e-file and that the price had gone up $5 from the package printing once I found the small print. I had to pay extra for the state e-file option on Premier Turbo Tax.

Get Er Done My hubs drives for lyft.com and because he didn't make 20k or more they didn't send him a 1099-Misc. I had to literally hunt down the EIN number in order to file online. It was a pain and turbo tax didn't let me go forward until I got it. price is high
Somewhat stress free Turbo tax is quick. I don't know if it was a long wait because it was tax season but I waited a long time to get some assistance Waited to long for a specialist

Poor Customer Service So for the fourth time, using this software, my Nebraska State return was rejected. Went through each time and corrected what it told me to, and each time it was rejected, despite having fixed all my errors. Called customer service and after being on hold for 45 minutes (Estimated wait time: 25) just to have them verify it before I submitted it again. When I finally got to talk to a person, she didn't know anything about taxes obviously, since she read the error back to me and said, well I don't know what that means, do you know what that error is? Well no, I don't that's why I'm calling you. She proceeded to ask dumb questions, like well do you live in Nebraska? No, I filed here and claimed residency for fun. I didn't get an answer from her on how to fix it, and hung up, when it became increasingly obvious that she had no idea how to fix it, or even what was wrong. Just hope that this one actually gets accepted, since I obviously won't get any support if it doesn't. Poor Customer Service, Customer service without actual tax knowledge

Unhappy & Feeling Tricked and Manipulated! I first selected the File for FREE option because my income is so low and fixed, and it is really very simple as far as input info. This has always been my choice before and nothing has changed. But my first choice indicated I would be better off paying the discounted $29.95 for a simple return and get a little help from Turbo Tax to be sure I was getting "all I was entitled to get". I did not object to this really. HOWEVER, as I was entering, they ask a lot of questions that I answered, but they failed to tell me that they were leading me into the more expensive $49.95 deluxe package. It was NOT UNTIL AFTER I spent all afternoon entering the information they requested did they tell me I could not file until I accepted the deluxe priced option. Shame on you Turbo. These were discounted by 10% because of doing it through my credit union. I will let them know I am very unhappy Doesn't make it clear about your paying choices as you go.

What happened After I started my state return - NY - I was only shown an amount for a refund/payment and was unable to go through the state via the interview method - as had happened with the Federal form.

column1: Although I could have done the state by editing the form directly at 6 PM on 4/18 I had neither the time nor the will to do so. I just sent the taxes in and will have to review and amend as needed.
I have used Turbo Tax for years and have never had this difficulty with the program.

One other things that occurred - in the Fed program I have entered various mutual fund sales - amounts and basis. The first time was told I made thousands of dollars - totally ignoring basis amounts. I deleted the figures and re-entered everything but this time the basis was taken into account- giving me the correct figures. I have no idea what happened to give me 2 wildly different figures. State was bad

column2: Not Very Flexible My first year with a rental property and used TT thinking it would give me an advantage. I am not sure it did.

column1: I also wasn't sure I was going to file my state return using TT, but it did not give me an option to not. In order to file my federal, I HAD to file my state with TT at an extra cost.
Next year I am going to use another service, I did not get the value for my money this year that is for sure. Too Restricted

column2: clunky When you go back to something you have to answer and fill in tons of stuff you have already done. Takes forever. If you have everything organized right away, it may be okay but hard if you want to begin while still waiting for spouse to get receipts Slow, repetitive, painful to edit

Painful experience! I like taxslayer better. Explanations simple and gives you more info about options. I was forced to upgrade if I wanted to finish my return. I was already 2 hours in. Should have been more specific upfront about what was needed based on the documents I had to file. Too many times asked about upgrades,

Hidden fees I only used Turbo Tax because I'm lazy and ran out of time. I had a fairly simple return, and am a person who lives at poverty level. I had to pay $135 in fees just to file. Next year I won't use Turbo Tax. Too expensive

Bait you in Watch what you actually have to pay for. If someone promises you free things, always read the fine print its never free. You cant go back either. Bait you in with shiny things, then charge you at the end

Able to file Did not find last years return usable and later received email that I created another account this year, but I logged in to the only account I know. Makes me worry a little about their systems... did not input last years return like it should

One Shining Star I followed all the Turbotax steps and it kept messing up my return. I called several times and no one knew what they were doing. Do your employees even know anything about taxes or just how to use your site?!?! Eventually, someone told me to file by mail (WRONG). Several months later, I am still worrying about my taxes and I call again because it's finally the deadline and I got nothing. I spent $100+ on your "deluxe" pack and am now realizing I didn't even need it. I wasted TWO HOURS and tried calling on two separate phone for Customer Support(not including the hours and hours I have previously wasted). FINALLY, I got a call back from Christine and she solves all my problems. Christine from Product Support is your only redemption after the heII I went through. I highly doubt you guys will read my whole review too. I also want to know if it is possible to get a refund if I didn't use or need "the deluxe" turbotax. Christine got me through but I am still wary of you guys. Probably not coming back unless I hear otherwise from you guys. Wasted a TON of time and money

Expensive !! I have been filing using TurboTax the past 4-5 years. First TD Ameritrade site claimed I will get $20 off by filing using TurboTax but I got only $15 credit on Federal part. In previous years State filing was very inexpensive, this time almost $40 !! I am considering saving that $40 next time by just using a EZ form. Especially State return is expensive

Too man fees Turbotax is as good as any electronic tax prep and file form. Even with the proper code I was unable to import my W2.even using a link from the W2 website. I was surprised and dismayed that there was a $39.00 dollar charge to pay using my tax refund that doesn't appear until your ready to file. How about adding this to the ever increasing upfront fees. Also don't tell me it's free to use turbotax when it's not! Difficulty importing w2, charge to pay with tax refund.
Mail in file was difficult Over all, was good software. There was no pop-up to mail in state tax forms. "Help" instructions not accurate either. Very disappointing way to finish.
Carryover problem - for 2 years (at least) the carryover from a NOL has caused problems completing a return and the TuTx tool does not allow you to clear input once you are "registered"

column1: - the subject carryover was due to a close/NOL of a business which no longer operates

- in the "fix" Federal issues mode several screens pop up asking for business input about use of a vehicle and other assorted business expenses. It is NOT clear what to do with these screens (bypass? enter a "0" value?). The screens ask for yes/no, or data input. There is not an ignore option.
- when doing a final check I input "0" for the values of expenses and it completely changed the final tax due amount
- I was UNABLE to reverse or clear this input....got a message
saying couldn't clear the return because it was already "registered".

- I was directed to completely start over. This is unacceptable. There should be no point in the filing process where a customer can't make corrections or edits. VERY FRUSTRATING. 2 YEARS a problem. Please fix before next season! - for 2 years has caused "carryover" problems

column2: A ripoff Did not retrieve last year's info. Made me do it. Had to pay $60.00 Cheated me $60

still annoying Lost confidence in Turbotax since they have ignored my correspondence among others regarding a mistake in the Michigan Tax return that they have yet to correct after 3 years. The cost of the product has increased to a point where I will probably use another product in the future. getting too expensive for extra e-file and state return, Michigan TurboTax has had same mistake for the last 3 years -
bug in section 179 allocation found non-intuit site which told me how to get around the problem. bug in section 179 allocation
Something Amiss Had to pay to file state taxes. Didn't import information from last year either. State Refund not free

Quick and decent but too much $$$ IMO Easy to use and navigate. I just think TT charges way too much for what you get. Good on them, it is a real money maker. Way too expensive considering you are doing all of the work yourself
Your software is great. The interface is blissful. Kudos to the people on the bottom who are doing the work designing and maintaining the site.

column1: You people up top - I know you're working for the bottom dollar. But for the love of God, if you have any decency...be up-front about the likely total cost. It just comes accross as criminal to keep those numbers a secret until people have already invested a few hours.
Think about it. It's just sh1tty business. I won't be coming back, and I'll tell all my friends your policies are garbage.
Thanks for your time.

column2: Tax return software  You should let your customers know that you charge an extra fee to file their state return on the box.

When I got to the end and was going to file, they charged me 29.99, It was the last day to file so I had no choice but to pay. They even advertised free Fed and State I chose Turbo Tax this year because it was free Fed and State
Just In Time Thanks for having this service! I feel confident that my taxes were filled correctly. Some W-2 were not available
Questions were very complicated, not easy at all this year!!! Very difficult and confusing.

What's up with the pricing So you send me a cd in the mail, that say's $59. You charged me $69. This year, the state was extra. Your website said $39, and you charged me $44. Then is was $25 to efile to the state. So this isn't such a good deal anymore. I could go to the place where they wear green dresses for about the same. Pricing

Disappointing I wanted to double check my return and speak to turbo rep. Before submitting. After being on hold for 45minutes, I ask a question then get put back on hold for "research", then to be HUNG UP on after 10minutes...call back, another 50minutes, no answer, just HUNG UP on...wtf! NO SUPPORT WHEN RUNNING INTO PROBLEMS

Overpriced, under supported How much it costs boils down to the free Ez or anything else. The extras are a waste of time, trying to get ahold of support takes 20-30min or more and even then they provided no help except to delete it and start over (which did nothing, but waste my time).

column1: I will never use this service again, a physical tax service is cheaper, more reliable and immediate. Useless extras, extremely overpriced, lack of real support

column2: Good Stuff I bought a Turbo tax Cd form Best Buy for $40.00 in the middle of my return, I had to upgrade the turbo tax to do my return.

column1: I had to pay the full price for the upgrade, after paying the full price for the CD at the store, it should be pro-rated

At the end of the process you are asked to print the return twice, once before e-filing and once after e-filing. it is nerve raking because you don't know which print is the right print to have in your files.
I LOVE TURBO TAX, I GAVE THIS A LOW RATING SO SOME ONE WILL READ THIS
!!! I REALLY DO LOVE TURBO TAX !!!! Charge full price for Turbo Tax upgrades,Need to only print IRS return once

column2: Price Gouging Look, it's a great piece of software that is easy to use - but charging to review previous returns? NOT consumer friendly. I will be looking elsewhere for my tax solution next year. Price gouging for copies of previous returns.
Not free I had to pay to file my state taxes. It ended up costing me $30. Not the end of the world, but not free as promised. Not free

adding MAX Review and Quickbooks without asking I have been using Turbo Tax since 2007. I may never use it again as MAX Benefits for $59.99 was added without my permission. When I called my credit union the fraud department tech said that this is his third call in a row just from Turbo Tax alone. Also Turbo Tax adds in a $4.99 monthly charge of Quickbooks, you have no option but to pay for it and then cancel it as you must do because you can not file if you do not. I have already contacted my credit union, Consumer Affairs, next Better Business Bureau. fraudulently adding MAX Review and Quickbooks

Wont use again I am a student and because I paid $3 worth of foreign tax, it forced me to use deluxe. My fault for waiting so late and not having any other options. Tried to call in, but they put you on hold for an hour and then they hang up on you. Pitiful. Rip off

First time paying!! I have used Turbo tax many times before and this year was a little frustrating!! It was asking for more info but when I went back to try and update the info needed it was nowhere to be found!? Does not explain questions real well!!

Too many hidden fees I have used turbo tax in past years, its always been very helpful no hidden fees. This year unfortunately might be my last as there, as there were too many hidden fees. If I knew that it was going to cost me almost $100 to file my taxes I would have gone to H&R Block or another company. Not too happy with Turbo Tax.... lots of hidden fees

Turbo Tax...way overrated I'm an Uber driver (for only one month in December). Because of that I needed to switch to the more expensive Business version of Turbo tax. It still was not clear why I needed to do this, making my tax return much more expensive.

column1: Also, an annoyance was that I was simply given the amount of taxes owed. I wasn't given any break down about why I owed this amount. Price went up dramatically because I'm an Uber driver, Needed to switch to a more expensive option

column2: way over priced, will use and recommend taxact This is probably worth it for people with complicated returns, but for someone with easier returns I will recommend taxact. I have always used turbo tax. This will be the last time now that I know there is a cheaper and just as effective way. rediculous price
GOTTEN HARDER -log- in difficult... never recognizes the password, makes me do a new password over and over and over.

column1: -difficult to locate paperwork and when review, one has to go through every single window.
- liked it before... used to find forms in a filing cabinet and fill them out
- no clue as to why mistakes are mistakes when Turbo thinks i have a mistake. Need to go back to that other window, etc, find the error .. find the 'fix ' window.
- might just have it done next year - i've used turbo tax since early 90s. HARD TO JUST FILL THE FORMS YOU WANT AND SEE WHAT THEY WILL LOOK LIKE FINISHED

column2: unhappy with extra fees this will be my last year filing with turbo tax. I have a very simple returns and would do the free federal return (basic) and also my state tax which I would pay $29.99. however this year after finishing, I was prompted that I have to pay an additional $34.99 for processing, that's very dishonest of Turbo tax, all in all, instead of paying $29.99, I ended up paying a fee of $64.98. unacceptable, I could have went to h and r block and spend the $50 to have them prepare it. never will I use turbo tax services. they ripped me off it is not free as advertised

Overly "Helpful" I had trouble with the TurboTax sales tax calculations and discovered a defect in the system. I was forced to go the the official IRS forms and instructions anyway to be sure I was getting the appropriate tax deduction for Sales tax, so the $55 I paid was really just for e-filing, since I did all of my own calculations anyway. And despite submitting a help request for a call to discuss the bug, I never received a follow-up within the promised window. Instead, I had to delete all of my sales tax information and start over. Too much logic, no explanation of calculations, buggy, no support as promised

Won't talk to Mac? After several unsuccessful attempts to start my taxes on my purchased 2015 TurboTax Deluxe, I finally got through to a TurboTax service rep who was familiar with my problem - the Turbo Tax Deluxe 2015 could not be run on my Mac without complicated changes. The rep talked me through the changes and I was able to complete my taxes. It was obvious that many other customers had called in before I did. There is no excuse for this glitch - there are a lot of Mac user out there! 2015 TurboTax Deluxe WOULD NOT WORK on my Mac even though the package said it would!
Not Responding and forced quit case # 418133476 Case # 418133476

column1: missed the health insurance question ...not responding...found the form and completed it on my own...who knows how many other forms were skipped because the problem.
I spent extensive time with your support...you cid not even have the problem logged.
good reason to use H&R Block next yearTexas could not get through many screens to answer because the soft ware froze up

column2: Not So Turbo Tax I still dont have my tax return from last year, because the auto import incorrectly assigned some of my income to deferred medical expenses. As a result, its been hung up in the IRS void. Sucks... it was kind of a lot of money. Subtle Errors

Long Time User, Possibly Changing The advantage is, you can do your taxes from home. If you like to do things yourself, this is pretty straight forward and easy. I don't mind handling my own taxes with our modern tools.

column1: Intuit has increasingly charged more for their service every year. No loyalty advantages for returning customers. Just more expensive each time. I was actually taken aback by this year's fees. Add to that, they prompt you to add on and upgrade at every turn now. I can't even count how many times i had to decline their desire to charge me more and more. It is becoming more expensive, and you are asked to upgrade for more money at every turn.

column2: Great Program The reason for using this program was so I could e-file due to no printer, now how do I file. if the last date to file was today 4-18-2016, the E-File should be available, WHAT DO I DO NOW TO HAVE IT FILED IN TIME??????????? Won't let me e-file today and I can't print, my printer is broken

VERY poor for someone working overseas I live and work overseas. Your pages are not designed for foreign addresses and phone numbers. In the end I could only file and pay using an American address, and that after hours of fighting your system. I was only able to file with assistance from your customer service by phone. I ended up filing without listing my foreign address because that is the only way I could pay. The IRS is going to wonder why I don't have a foreign address. Poorly designed for my situation
Lower ROI than previously Turbotax is no longer a good bang for buck Price went up services went down.

No Amazon Giftcard Option My return has not changed significantly in the last 5 years. I always had the option to cash out some of my return via an Amazon gift card. This time, the option was not presented (and I bought TurboTax Home and Business from Amazon, actually!). All the reasons presented by a turbo tax representative to possibly explain this did not apply to me. Amazon gift card option did not show up this year
way more difficult this year did not ask for my SS tips (box7) this year. Has for the last 3 years. Caused me lots of drama.

column1: State form was a complete hassle. Asked for school district # and had no easy look up for it. did not ask for pertinant info this year that it did last year

column2: Why no discounts? VERY EXPENSIVE I've used Turbo Tax for about 15 years, always getting a 30-50% discount from one of the online brokerage accounts. NOT this year! I guess Intuit had to keep all the money for themselves to help pay for the expensive SuperBowl ads! It's unfortunate, so I'll be shopping around for another tax-prep package next year. No discounts from the brokerage companies, so $$$$$
You have to clear your taxes and start all over if you accidentally add on a different form on filing help. so dumb :(

FirstTimeFiling on myOwn Next time I will be prepared to use my own debit card for fees because I thought it was free totally and instead I got duped so Thanks I did not like the fees that I did not understand nor the taxes of the card from those states

not as easy or good as 3-5 years ago. The price seems to rise every year , regardless how much change in tax law. Far too much extraneous information in questions and trying to answer to many unusual or obscure tax situations. It also seems harder to move between sections to change or correct numbers or info points . I have used Turbo-tax since at least 2001 and have generally pleased . And my income has only changed when social security gives "cost of living " increase which is usually eaten by the increase in medicare payments. Please simplify rather than complicate "new and improved ", rarely is better . To increase and add unnecessarily to raise the price is no service at all. It is not an age issue due to severe medical issues I was retired a few years ago at age 38.Severe spinal problems, I still write and publish in the areas of economics, securities, and monetary policy. far to much extraneous asides , harder to move back and forth
Potential, but could be so much better Great to be able to work on the the return from anywhere.

column1: Help and explanation windows within the system are great.
Unable to view 2 returns on same computer.
Unable to cross reference to line numbers on the return.
Unable to review certain numbers without going through the entire line of questions. Non-transparent

column2: Great until it fails Last year was great. this year. it was terrible Pushes K1 to all states visited - Does not allow for one spouse to move - charges you before it tells you it can't corre
Inaccurate Avoid using this service, for your own good. Everything

Poor transition... I'm sure next year will now be fine that all my basic information is in their cloud, but my tax information up to TY 2014 was all TurboTax Desktop. It wouldn't load up past year's information properly. A pain!! It's great to have last year's info right there so you can follow things like depreciation and carried over items. We've had the same basic daycare setup for 5 years and I'd have been able to just update with this year's expenses if the continuity were there.

column1: Now that I've gone to the online filing, I hope it'll be as easy next year as it has been in all prior years since I started using TT. The transition from PC program to online program was poorly done. Didn't import prior tax information correctly!!

column2: Customer Service at the Bottom Level Poor customer service all around. App was really buggy, but Carolina and Supervisor Anthony fron Arizona told me: it's just the tablet you are using, since our family filled without any issue. Sorry guys, but I called about my problem, not to hear about how easy it was for the fam to file taxes. Lame, divisive, and rude. They both seemed amatuer, not able to listen to reason. I was told by them to use the desktop version, since the app wasn't working for me. This wasn't a real solution, and ultimately added to my frustration. Both seemed so uninterested, that I'm moving to another intermediary tax filling company. Asked to speak with a manager, but Anthony said the manager doesnt take calls, and it would be a while before i get a call back. How bout i say, See ya. Article in SD UNION Tribune to follow :-) Poor app layout, worst customer service mostly
Too Expensive! How about student/senior/repeat business discounts? I feel like I'm being price-gouged more each year. Too expensive

stupid quickbooks fee I do the entire return and at the end it adds a $4.99 a month quickbooks fee, I tried to remove and I couldn't. I had help team call me and she said she didn't know how to remove it without starting over. Well now I have to call quicbooks and get this removed, or they will charge me every month for the rest of my life. What a pain in the a**!!!! Only thing that stopped me from cancelling the whole return filing is that today is last day and I don't have time to go with another provider.

column1: Had to fix innapropriate language, I guess they can stick me with this nonsense but I better not say a bad word like a** so silly! quickbooks fee I cant remove

column2: Not so easy to navigate Would like to see overall outline to tax return needs more examples and descriptions of tax terms

Horrible waste of time I do the whole return which only being a 1040ez I could have done faster by hand but continued both that form and my state form for the convienence of efiling, however I get to the efiling part it says I need a pin # I do exactly what turbo tax says to do to get the number and it says I cant get one so I do the agi from 2014 and it accepts it and tells me I can now make up my own pin# which I do I then efile both returns,put everything away glad that its done but then I get text messagessaying both returns weren't accepted.Had to go back on and turbo tax says it will help fix whatever is wrong.. NO HELP WHAT SO EVER had to print returns and mail and now they'll be a day late..Next year Ill do them by hand!!!!!!!!! longer than filing bynhand & nightmare to efile
Left me high and Dry return kept getting rejected. no help AT ALL from Turbo Tax Spent money to file a state return that kept getting rejected.

column1: I changed what turbo tax says is causing problems and it gets rejected again for the exact same thing. If you don't pay 45.00 for the help, you do not get any.
Back to H&R Block for me

column2: Hidden Fees...Mind at Ease? Be a little more transparent, and for god's sake if i have a small business don't charge me an arm and a leg to go through my business expenses. Try to charge me left and right... Spent $100 on this thing.
This is the most exasperating time I have ever spent trying to file my taxes.

column1: I will go back to H&R Block next year. Can't delete K-1s, they keep bouncing back. Your help was P--s poor

column2: good till the end on the premier turbo tax I thought state tax was included in the price!!!!!!! not!!! extra fee for state

Waste of Time No. 1 complaint: Forces you to work through deductions etc THEN tells you that you don't' qualify wasting hours / days needlessly on health care, investments, energy credits, data entry, etc etc etc. Tell us the threshold / criteria up front! Not enough help/ info; pushes eFiling needlessly, pushes "audit protection" -- costs extra

To much red tape... Spent over an hour just getting the current files to download...then get message cannot open file. Had to do multiple downloads in order to get complete updates. Files stop downloading multiple times...errors opening files...

Turbo Tax really sucked this time it kept crashing Program fails to correctly log into last years account. Import crashes Turbo Tax. Frustratingly it would import nothing from my Quickbooks. If I wasn't trying to pay as little as possible I would have just gone to a professional. kept crashing on talking to website
Best of the bunch, but that's not saying much We were told we needed the home and business version. Found different prices all over the place. We were told with that version, the state tax was free.

column1: Well the form is free, but electronic filing is an additional $25. They didn't tell us that. Extra states would be another $25 to prepare and another $25 each to file electronically. Kept offering upgrades.
Next year I will start earlier and try the IRS web site and recommend everyone else do the same. It's n ot that tough. Extra charges

column2: Not a happy Camper Probably go with another tax program next year. bought wrong program had to upgrade on line was not good experience.. Help lady was very sociable and informative

Program deleted all my info I started a return and had to shut down computer for other matters. Couldn't reopen that return when I went back, so I started over, filled out the whole thing, and went to e-file. At that point the program gave me back the partially completed one, and I can't access the one I worked on all day today. Have to fill the whole thing out a second time
ok ok could b faster takes to long
didnt like the payments why did we have our state taken out, and you charged us 34.99 to take it out of our taxes and charged us the fee as well you charges us twice for state,

poorly describes when things will be addressed things like personal property tax - what goes were and when? I got covered but it could be better defined that such are handled in section _______ to be covered. I would have to go back and break up a deduction total into parts that were required because they were better defined sub-part of the larger category.

column1: then I got frozen out of my account. I sorry to b e a little handicapped due to a stroke and only type with one hand, therefore I make many typos this then causes problems with passwords -- and early lockout triggers lie yours. I cried for help many times,; NO RESPONSE !! 'WE ARE HERE TO HELP' your words. was this a presidential lie? I left my phone # several times NO RESPONSE!!
YOU SAY MY NICKNAME CAN CONTAIN NUMBERS AND LETTERS -- WHAT I WROTE WAS -- UP SET Kenneth -- THIS CONTAINS N0 NUMBERS!!!!!! SEE WHAT I MEAN
so you change the rules as you go kind of our president? got locked out of opening an existing account, kept crying for help, none came!!

column2: Hidden fee for e-file when getting a refund doesn't appear until the very end and it's virtually too late to go back. I'm a student, you shouldn't make your money off me.
the worst experience ever never again will I waste my time with doing taxes myself.

column1: oh and the fact I had to give this 1 star made me mad! very poor customer service

column2: THIS SUCKS! I would honestly rather pay the 300-400 dollars to have someone else do my taxes! Was charged extra without any other options. Could not go back, had to purchase the deluxe with the state. Bunch of BULL
My 1st Time I am a full time college student and only had 2 jobs last year. One was a 1099 and the other was w2. The cost to file and use Turbotax was too high for me to use again.

column1: Thanks it was very expensive to use.

column2: Easy to navigate program - Cost a little too much I have used TurboTax for many years because of the convenience and completeness of the program. I am satisfied when finished that everything I needed to include has been included. I would like the tax code to be less cumbersome, but that is not TurboTax fault. A little pricey, especially the charge for efiling

I don;t have a computer. I have been doing my taxes at Kinko's for years, couldn't this year because the computer didn't support Turbo Tax. Couldn't upgrade because it is a public computer. Had to scramble to find a computer at the last minute where did I enter this year's numbers?

Don't use Turbo Tax Turbo Tax makes it impossible for you to remove the Max Audit defense and they charge you an extra 35 or 40 for it. I am not happy about this at all and will not be back next year. Unable to remove MAX
never again free...ha I needed to use the version of turbo tax that was not free, for what I paid I could have gone to a tax service and spoken to a human being! price

Not That Impressed..... So, I did turbotax to file because for the first time in years, I knew we would be getting a refund and we are required to itemize based upon our work. I had already done my taxes long form. The issue I have is the cookie cutter approach. For experienced users, this is probably not the way to go. Turbotax did not find anything for me that I hadn't already found for myself. Additionally, they want to add this, add that and everything has a fee attached. This is my first and last time using this software. It does not explain detailed itemized info and asks you to complete areas of forms not needed.

column1: If you file standard and want money fast, go to the IRS website and do it for free.
If you know how to file taxes, save yourself the money and do it yourself. too summarized & nickel/dime you

column2: Quick N Easy is the way I wanna File tonight! It was going good until my new jobs HSA account made me file with deluxe. The discount from Wells Fargo also stated up to $15 dollars off and only received $5. Had to use deluxe edition annd pay. Well Fargo discount sucked

aggravated had issue first time ever with turbo tax with download of my etrade 1099b for trading info. All sorts of issues with codes with federal fixes when trying to file. Adjustment codes. Had to delete and enter gains losses and mail in 1099b with trades to fix. Phone call from your help desk was helpful. Hope next year works better 1099 b download

Good service/ripoff price! $50+ is WAY too much money to pay for state filing! I felt tricked when I got to the end and had to either pay that or delete my state return. I'll do them on my own, thank you; and next year, I'll find a different service! WAY too expensive for state filing, and they hold your documents hostage
Great help for the uninitiated I had not use TurboTax for a a long while, when I started using the 2015 edition I noticed

column1: 1. that the previously available extensive library is gone; in its stead, a simpleminded Q&A guide the filer.
2. an automatic cloud saving. These cloud savings have been subject to predatory snooping form the governments and everyone else, including Intuit

column2: What a Joke I was told that I could file my taxes for the first time free, even whenever I asked if it would cost for a 1099-MISC I was told no it is the first time therefore it will be free. Well I got billed $100 and I didn't even get that much in my return. Very disappointed with Turbo Tax and their services. Complete ripoff and false advertisement

OK, but a real foul up this time! TurboTax is normally great, but not this time. I entered $6500 worth of new windows in the 2015 Home Energy Credit section and somehow it doubled to $13,000. Then, when I realized that we had bought the windows in 2014 and tried to delete the purchase, TurboTax wouldn't let me. I called customer service and Mary got back to me within 20 minutes. She was nice, but we had to go through a lot of deletion trial and error to get it to zero. In the process, I lost the hour of data that I had already entered! It was a pain to have to reenter the data. I might have to try another tax service next year. Big problem with Home Energy Credit!

So expensive! Turbotax does a great job of making it easy to file to taxes. However, it is insane that I had to pay almost $200 for the service. I made $19,000 last year. Couldn't the company help those with lower income and make the rates sliding scale?? It's too late now for me to start over alone or with another company, but I will never use Turbotax again! WAY too costly
Took too long This took too long compared to other years. hard to follow even though it wasn't in the past

Stabbed at the end Advertised as free Federal Return. Let's you enter all detailed information that takes at least an hour and then tells you at the very end you cant use free version. At least be honest upfront and tell me what it costs. I would have paid a little more than a competitor just because I like the service I've received. You would have to enter all information on another competitor to get around it. I've been a loyal paying customer for years. Trick me once, I wont be back. Beware before you type all that info.

Not as Good as Last Year Not as much of a fan as I was last year. I've been using TurboTax for 15+years and love it but liked it better last year (and previous years). The changes that TurboTax made this year are a step backward. It is a bit simpler but it is more difficult to enter info

Price and sells I owed a total of a little over $130. It cost me $94 to file. During the whole process they are constantly trying to sell you something. As if they aren't already making enough from the start. It's taxes though, got to pay them. Welcome to America. Cost

Outrageous fees I've been using TurboTax since at least 2009. I was shocked to see that nearly $150 of my tax refund would be use to pay to file and to pay someone to handle it. That's ridiculous and this will be the last time I use TurboTax. outrageous fees
Never using again each year I am unable to e-file. each year I verify with IRS and SSA that my info is correct and unable to get my PIN or using my AGI never able to e-file

The Ease of filing In all a good, fast experience. Had some questions on my tax penalty and didn't use your help function which may have helped. I was able to search online for the answer. Nothing really.
So Buggy I downloaded the Deluxe product on my Mac. It was so buggy, then froze, crashed and saved NOTHING. And the state tax was EXTRA - yet the product description said it was included.

column1: I don't know why I bother with this product.

column2: Easy but long It was easy to use but really long and slightly confusing.

Credit card charged but my taxes where not filed I completed my taxes and submitted by payment using my credit card. I received a notice my credit card payment went through but your system did not recognize my payment or file my taxes. Only after being on hold and trying to work with a representative for 2.5 hours did I out of desperation to file my taxes I elect to have the payment withdrawn from my refund because the system was still showing that I did not pay. I am very disappointed with my service and I'm out of $144.98 until I can get a refund (hopefully) processed. Payment system

TurboTax alright You need to have some tax knowledge to use this, in my experience. Specificially, the "1099G" unemployment income versus "1099-G" state tax return refund was not intuitive, at all, until doing a google search. Sometimes confusing
all the marketing crud gets a little tedious. I just paid money to do my taxes and you keep trying to get more money from me.

column1: other then the marketing crud its pretty good.
and the review doesn't let you use the word cr#p slow the first time

column2: 'free federal' felt like i was with a high class hooker that just kept making me pay more and more to them until i got the end result. free ended up costing me 96 bucks. brutes. everything else

Sadly,I have too much invested in TTax to switch More issues this year - investment sale default election errors out; there so many places where I correct or add info only to see the program didn't recognize that information even though it is there - for example, I elect to have a portion of my refund applied to 2016, but the ES calculates without taking that info into account. Forms do not refresh unless you enter info in a certain way

turbo tax 2016 my taxes are pretty simple except for schedule C but i have to use most expensive edition because of that. very convenient to have all the info load yr to yr but if prices go up next yr then tax cut here i come. price and need to use more exp edition goes up every yr
turbo t rowe price offered a discount on your service and at payment time i did not receive the discount i did not get the discount i was promised
Hard to check & correct entries I never did find the command to turn "file return" to "File for an Extension of time".

column1: It's Hard to check & correct entries. It's Hard to check & correct entries.

column2: I've been using turbo tax for years. I usually give a much higher rating than a 5 although this year I would get clocked out and had to log in and out over a dozen times. very frustrating slow servers? never had problem before and I'm using same computer and a t1 line at work way too slow this year

Love Turbo Tax but price is too high for easy 1040 I Just paid $54.99 for a simple 1040 tax return. Perhaps I selected the wrong one but the system should be able to recognize it's a simple 1040 and charge accordingly. Through USAA (I'm a member), I used to pay only $19.99 and sometimes less. The past couple of years, I paid too much.

column1: Disappointed and may have go back to doing my own returns. :( Cost too high for simple 1040

column2: Better solution for Community Property Returns! The program itself is very easy to use; after all this is probably my 10th year using it. Bravo for that. However, its not nearly as useful for outlying situations. Specifically, the advice for handling excess 401K deferrals reporting is very confusing as your program has two contradictory solutions. Furthermore, it caused me to have to call several times, and I never got a good answer because most of those times my calls dropped after being on hold for at least 1.5 hrs. Also, it is a shame that this program can't handle domestic partner returns in California very well - after all it has been several years since the law required community property adjustments! Lack of clear direction and advice on thornier issues such as 401k deferrals and California community property returns

TT didn't allow me to print my return Form-filling went well, but at the penultimate page, there was a button to "View or print your return." When pressed, I got an error message: "Oops, you've been bumped out of Turbo Tax. This is an Error 4" and then direction to re-enter TT.

column1: This loop happened twice, but, all along, TT says "Don't worry, you'll have a chance to print or download your return after you file."

I transmitted my return -- but then I was shunted to a "Congratulations" page and a customer review form -- and the promised opportunity to view, print, and download a copy of my return was NEVER presented.
This is a big, inexcusable FAIL. Assured I'd be able to print "later" -- never happened

column2: Trama Unfortunately, my desktop comp. crashed with my beginning of 2015 turbo tax. I could not find the disc to install in my laptop.

column1: Trying to get connected by phone on Friday night (I was put on hold for 40 min.) I went online--which I didn't like as explained above. But I joined up to do the taxes online. The Fee was 3 times what I've paid previously, but it was too late to get
