a downloaded copy of my 2016 TURBO tax I paid for already.
I did get an email from you stating I should have used the old account Somehow I wasn't sure you were correct

column2: Refund I had to re do it 5 times because turbotax kept trying to sneak in a extra fee. I do not appreciate that Did not like how you try to add extra services
Why should you use turbotax Overall this is a pretty good platform, but it would be nice if state return were free as well. it's taxes

After 15 years, giving up on TurboTax Business I've used TurboTax business for 15 years. I think it hit its peak about 5 years ago, when there was detailed and transparent mapping during import from QuickBooks Pro. Now once the import is done, I can't tell where the data went to verify everything was captured. Then I spend about 4 hours tracking down where Section 179 expense, officer medical, officer insurance etc went. Further, the import inexplicably ignores some mappings (e.g., Shareholder Disability Insurance, Employee Disability Insurance) and asks me to categorize them, WITHOUT even providing the account name so I know what account it is asking about. Since I can no longer rely on import, TurboTax no longer has any significant advantage for me, and the bugs in Section 179 reporting and opaqueness of M-1/M-2 reconciliation are beyond frustrating, so I'm going to try a different tax program next year. Import hides my data. M-1/M-2 reconciliation too hard.

IP Pin Rejection IRS did NOT accept their generated IP Pin, because eFile cannot handle 6 digit pin generated by IRS. This is a big FAIL. They will not accept an online generated ip pin in place of the mailed pin, nor, will they accept AGI, instead !!! IRS did NOT accept IP Pin, because eFile cannot handle 6 digit pin generated by IRS.
Really? I am disabled and poor. I just wanted to prepare my modest return without hassle and for free. Yet every 5 seconds I was prompted to buy a package. Never use you again. A lot
sucked A$s it barely gave me a chance to fill out any refunds

column1: it didn't give me the full refund I deserve everything

column2: Works well enough I've been using TurboTax Home & Business for several years and it seems to me that in the interest of making the program simpler and quicker to use, it has lost a level of detail that helps the user maximize tax deductions. I always go with the step-by-step UI so theoretically I should be accessing the highest level of program guidance but there are missing pieces. I think this is particularly true for employees who work almost exclusively from a home office and for other "gig" contractors.

column1: For instance, I've had to call on my own knowledge and search efforts to track down how to deduct items like Medicare Advantage premiums and some home office expenses. mediocre search results and program help / directions

column2: Pulling my hair As a member of the clergy, I find the IRS rules and the filling in of Turbo Tax info to be very confusing and difficult to navigate. Since I end up paying self-employment tax, there is little support info or clarification about what to put into TT regarding deductions for self-employment, how to treat housing allowance versus actual expenses, etc. My pay and expenses are pretty much the same from year to year, and I got a small refund in 2014, but had to pay taxes in 2015 when I was expecting a larger refund. What changed? I have no way of knowing if I filled out the blanks differently, or if the calculations changed due to a tax increase or rules change. Don't know what changed since previous year. Unclear what to put in some boxes. Clergy filings are really difficult.
Lots of upsell Right at the beginning, it deleted all my information from last year when I declined to pay $30 to file.

column1: The software tried to re-add the $30 fee at least 10 more times throughout the filing process.
The $30 state fee isn't mentioned until state information is completed. If you decline, they delete the tax return.
After wading through the advertisements, I was ready to file. TurboTax then promoted a prepaid visa gift card for my return. These cards are predatory to low income individuals. Not a fan.
Next year, I plan to use alternative tax filing software. Obstructive advertising, Information deletion, Prepaid Card gimmick

column2: TurboTax is an expensive choice for a multi-state filer. However relative to the other packages, it seems to get this complicated situation right. Household employee taxes could be vastly improved and users should be aware that state level taxation is not addressed. Transfer of data from prior year, hidden pricing, lack of transparency

Very disappointed I've been using TurboTax for almost 10 years. I was so disappointed this time when I found out that I was misguided in terms of my IL tax filing. The software failed to ask if it was the first time I was filing in the state of IL, in which case you cannot use a commercial package at all -- have to mail in or use the state's own system. Innacurate guidance for IL state filing
Coordination between forms view and other view was at times very poor. Changes on forms were not picked up by other view.

column1: Print function often locked up, even after return was filed.
Help and other explanations were frequently poor or not at all useful.

column2: TurboTax would often take us around many loops. See above. Took too long to complete.
not worth the money Why does the prompt to purchase deluxe version state I can deduct fee from taxes when this is untrue? Will never purchase again stated I could deduct my fee, could not!!!!

Not worth the cost - and don't use a credit card I gave TurboTax a second chance this year, figuring my taxes were more complicated than last year. Nope. Still no better than I did with pen, paper and the IRS guide - and the cost is still offensive for what I got. The surcharge to use a credit card is still jaw-dropping, too. Taxes no lower than doing it on my own
last minute take your money I was to get a free refund for Federal and since I filed at the last minute I was charged. real nice??? charges

Would like a Replay button The one feature that has been needed for many years is the ability to repeat a step-by-step section without needing to re-answer various questions. It would be nice if there was a new navigation button that made it clear that the user wanted to replay the step(s) without changing anything, or have to remember whether they previously answered "Yes/No" to questions.

column1: For the purposes of reviewing previous data, once a section has been completed and the user revisited that section, add a "Replay" (or "Browse") button to the choices. The user can quickly skip past the screens as needed, but be able to retrace their steps. When revisiting some areas, previous check boxes or questions are not defaulted to the response previously given.

column2: No help when I really needed it! I've used TurboTax for years. This is the first year I've had no luck getting a representative to help. I was disconnected twice after holding an hour each time. Overnight, I finally hung up because I had to get up for work the next morning. I really, really needed help and they failed me this year. Will seriously rethink using TurboTax again. Getting help is impossible!!!
Outrageous Refund Processing Fee only at the END! I have been using TurboTax for years and I do not EVER remember having paid a refund processing fee of $35.00!

column1: Since I have previously trusted TurboTax to only assess reasonable fees, I did not attempt to complete my Federal and State returns until ALL information was available and double checked. The Refund Processing fee was not disclosed until the final submission was to be made!
As an Expert Witness on "Deceptive Fees" before the Federal Trade Commission(FTC), I intend to report this clearly Deceptive practice to the FTC! Outrageous Refund Processing Fee only at the END!

column2: OK but not Thanks turbotax for the dozen or so years but it is time to move on. Really after all those filings no that Im paying taxes I have to pay 2.49% to a kickback unnamed 3rd party pretty cheesy and greedy. I dont feel the Bern but I am tired of hidden and sneaky costs thrown in at the end you should be ashamed.. After my tax bill last year it would have been nice to get some straight forward withholding advice for this year not just a sales pitch for investing

column1: looking for somebody new so that I am not trapped into filing this way again. Thanks for the soapbox too many charges at the end, no loyalty dividends

column2: Not a gold standard _ Disappointing Have to google first to find out how to use TurboTax effectively. TurboTax has to hire local brains or train the stupid Indian contractors to get its software straight. Hopelessly not intuitive _ will TurboTax accept liability for wrong calculations?

Too Many Ads TurboTax files me taxes for me and calculates everything. However, it doesn't explain why you got what you got (unless you purchase an upgrade so they can explain basic information to you that is available online). After you choose the free option, TurboTax will pester you multiple times whether or not you want to upgrade. It will make you say "No Thanks" three times in a row before moving on. It also makes you pay to file your state taxes... with my return only being $15, there was no reason to pay $30 for them to do it for me. Lots of ads, Not free for state

Disappointed by the pushy sale stuff Hey, I used the free version for my son after I paid for TurboTax Premier to file my own taxes. It is not free if you try to upsell/trick users into paying more. He is getting back $101, so it is annoying to have to work out of all the tricks. All that stuff takes away from a really class product. I am not sure I will be using TurboTax next year, precisely because of all the extracurricular stuff. The pushy sale of Turbo services is annoying

battle over who gets my money - IRS vs TurboTax Although TurboTax has made it easy for me to do my taxes for the past 3 years, it has become an increasingly more expensive and dishonest platform. The option to add on features for an additional cost keep showing up even after saying "no thanks" the first time. For example, taking the cost of TurboTax out of my federal return. I said "no thanks" the first time and then I almost paid for it due to a roundabout way of saying the same thing. Due to increased cost of TurboTax and it's continued dishonesty over the years, I will most likely choose H&R Block next year. dishonest in costs
Too many glitches Waited 45 minutes for phone help. The person couldn't help me. Sent me to an expert - supposedly 15 minutes. I was on the phone 1-1/2 hours and finally hung up.

column1: I've been using TurboTax for several years and this will be my last year. Glitches turned a 30 minute return into a 3 hour nightmare

column2: NO REFUND WE HAD NO REFUND, NOT THAT WE EXPECTED ONE. TURBO TAX KEPT SAYING "BLAH BLAH ABOUT OUR REFUND WHEN WE OWED!!! IS THE COMPUTER THAT DUMB? PLUS WE ALREADY OWE A GREAT SUM AND THEN THEY CHARGE US $94.98??? YOUR COMMERCIALS INDICATE FREE! I DONT THINK WE PAID THAT MUCH LAST YEAR.

column1: IF WE HAVE TO PAY THAT MUCH, WHY DONT WE GO TO A LIVE PERSON?
WE WILL NEXT YEAR. IM VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!!!!!

column2: hidden fees started out with a forty dollar tax return but with all the fees it turned into a hundred dollar tax return and that was without the representation. Next year I will take it back to the tax service to have it done their hundred dollars includes everything.

Cannot edit state taxes On the Idaho return, going back to edit any number requires going through all the questions over again the same as if you are starting the return from scratch. This is poor design; you should be able to go back and edit any value like you can for federal. Cannot edit state taxes

somewhat deceptive Purchased Home & Business at Costo. Federal e file. state returns. Thought state was included, but not. Get all the way through and find out it will cost me ANOTHER $25 to file state (even though you can file state FREE at state site)...and small print on back says $19.99 and was charged $24.99. WHY? i thought i had purchased program and still had to pay

Good for federal, not as good for state The preparation of the federal tax return went well overall. I have been using H&R Block's tax TaxCut Deluxe software for the previous four years, but the interview process for TurboTax Deluxe was better.

column1: On the downside, the software would have made me miss out on about a $500 state deduction if I had not realized that something was amiss, bypassed the interview process to go to the forms, and have fixed the problem there. That wasn't easy to do either because one form with that figure wouldn't permit me to change it so I had to look for another form where I could make the necessary changes. The specific problem I experienced related to TurboTax not using information from my W-2 about contributions to my state retirement plan. ...but preparing the state return not as well.

column2: Watch out! Misleading deductions. I've used TT for years. However as the laws change, TT gets better at leading you astray when it comes to deductions. I think I'll shop around next year as my trust level has dropped drastically. Short answers to topics are misleading
WTF seems like every year i do my taxes the fees are getting higher. i will find another tax service. i can't keep loosing money. very disapointed. fee are getting very very high.
not happy Really upset because I could not file free and it keep coming up 49.99 plus another 39.99. I only owed federal 49.00 and paid more to file. paid and wanted free

price hike was way to much the price seemed to double from last year and everything talks about your refund well if you owe that is a large slap in the face. will not be using this sight again unless the price goes down. expensive

I used to like TurboTax I have always been a big fan of TurboTax in the past and found it to be the most painless way to do my taxes, but this year, it seems as though the interface was actually less helpful. It was not possible or easy to undo an action once you have submitted something - for instance - a telephone number was missing - you get to the end of the process and it doesn't just have you enter your telephone number, you are forced to recycle through the entire process from page one. Not the best UX design. I would expect better. Redundant and Tedious
Nickle and diming! Every time you click there is some fee for simple tax return. You should be ashamed to call yourselves Americans! I will not use your service in the future! Fees!

Fees are a bummer I filed taxes for my daughter - who is 19 and a full-time student no problems, no fees. Just finished filing the same way for my 22 year old son, also a student, when I got to the State portion they charged me $29.99 plus tax to file for him. His state refund was only $39.00, so basically they kept his entire return, totally bogus. Next year I will just have my accountant do his for him. They add it to mine for free. Charged me $29.99 for my State
Too Expensive The form was fast and convenient but the price is sky high. Nickel and Dime
Surprise cost of deluxe I will never use this service again. Didn't like the $54.99 on one page and then when I agreed to upgrade there was a $39 additional changre for state. Real

This year's was just okay. I was able to navigate last year's product better and easier. I never did find a place to be able to print specific pages for my own file. The part for recalculating the AGI for Minnesota was very confusing. I just had to leave it alone and hope it was correct or that the state would make any corrections for me. You basically have improved the product each year that I have used it (2005 - 2014) except maybe for 2015. In some areas a step back. I liked last year's program better. I never did find a place to be able to print only specific pages of the tax form

Snakes When i started my review, i picked free. By the time i finished, i had no choice but to pay for deluxe. This is really pathetic because there was no warnings or anything until i finished there would be a 55 fee. I wont be coming back to turbotax because of this and im going to make sure i get the word out to everyone i know that turbotax is a bunch of snakes. If you were a decent company at all you would fix this, but im not holding my breath.

column1: Zach Cost, no warning of cost, constantly trying to make you pay for other things

column2: HAD to pay Have to fix the software so that if you make a change or designation and want to go back and delete it that it can be easily deleted. Instead have to switch back and forth between forms and step by step and too time consuming. Need more help in finding deductions people qualify for. problems filing easy royalties - spent 5 + hours on royalties totaling small 3 figures

Undesirable e-filing complexity A good product that I have used for over 20 years went down in flames because of the efiling protocols. Everything was going fine until I chose to file. Need of Drivers License #s. Give me a break, Charlie.

used to like turbotax I filled in all required information. Turbotax made me re-fill some of the information, resulting in duplicate w-2's being filed and causing me to over-pay my taxes. they messed up my return this year and I overpaid
It was ok It was ok Cost to much for a single man

Wow!! Is all I have got to say!! You have all these hidden fee's that you don't reveal until the end!! Thus making it hard to back out of the website. Shame on you!! And I am closing my USAA account just because I was frauded by them to use you. You claimed a fee of $44.99. But at the end everything turned into $119.99 or something like that. Unbelievable. You are not all that!!

column1: You got me this one time. But you won't get me again. And I will tell everyone about this too!! Most importantly I will blast you on social media! Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, SnapChat........ All your hidden fee's at the end!!
